The chrome extensions and applications seem to cover all that I need, which includes listening to music, email, gmail, photo editing, video editing, web surfing, bill pay, business finances managing, word, excel, and powerpoint publication (whether through Google Docs, or the new Office Apps Chrome extension).I also have Chrome Remote Desktop activated, so if I do need to access my other computers, I have the ability from anywhere I am as long as I have WIFI.All in all, it's a great machine for me.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Think about it.  Lightning fast processor in a computer that does 95% of what I use a computer for.  There is ONE Windows only program that I have to use for work, so I still have to have a Windows machine around for that.  I use my Mac at home for photo editing but I'm experimenting with the web based solutions in Chrome, which get better and better each day.I have a 27" IPS monitor for my Mac Mini with a DVI input (Mac) and an HDMI input (Chromebook).  I connect the Chromebook with the HDMI, I connect a bluetooth mouse and keyboard, shut the lid on the Chromebook (that automatically puts it into "docking" mode, so it runs with the cover closed.  Cover closed shuts off the built in screen, so the battery life more than doubles- no need to plug it in when I dock), I tuck the Chromebook away alongside the monitor, and I have a complete desktop computer system that takes up little space on my desk. And no slouch.  The graphics are identical to that which my i7 Mac Mini puts out (1920 x 1080).  1080p YouTube videos no issue.  1080p videos play back from an SD card, no problem.  Haswell processor is lightning fast- instant response.  Web pages load and open faster than on the Mini (ad block pro extension is key).  The audio can play through the monitor via HDMI (if it has speakers, mine does not) or through the Chromebook's speakers.  The Chromebook's speakers are outstanding for a laptop, the best I have heard on a laptop ANYWHERE CLOSE to this price point.  Speakers fire both downwards against the desk surface, and also up through the keyboard.  You can not tell where the sound is coming from, it just sounds great.So, $199 for Chromebook, $275 (or less) for a monitor, $50 for keyboard and mouse, around $500 for a top line, lightning fast desktop replacement.  Add a USB3 external drive or USB3 stick and I have local storage, though the Chromebook comes with 2 years of Google Drive storage.  Now, when I leave the house, I grab the Chromebook and take it with me.  Small, very light, packed inside my $9 Amazon Basics neoprene sleeve.Best of all, since it's Google connected, if you enable Google Sync, if you need to wipe it clean and start fresh (aka, Powerwash), as soon as you log in to your Google account, all of your apps, desktop, configurations etc automatically and practically instantly download, so your machine is back where you had it.  Nothing to re-install, nothing to re-configure, etc.  If your files are stored at Google Drive or Dropbox, they all automatically show back up, nothing was lost.  This is the future of computing.  Resistance is futile.Here are the two bummers:1.  I can not figure out how to get IMAP mail working on it.  My Android phone and tablet (with limited local storage) have IMAP mail, why not my Chromebook?  I use IMAP for work e-mail and Gmail.  It could be configured to only download the most recent emails to not take up space on the SSD.  Choose to save certain messages and attachments locally, etc. that I may need later or offline.  I need a standalone IMAP client for it, or the Gmail offline client needs to include IMAP. If I had that, I could almost get rid of my Mac.2.  The built-in screen's resolution could be better.  I am spoiled by my 27" IPS screen, I want that contrast and brightness on my Chromebook as well. Yes, I can spend more on a "better" Chromebook and get a better screen, I know.Here's a Top Tip for people who already own a Chromebook or are buying one.  This unit comes with 2GB of RAM which is fine, but if you open a lot of webpages or watch huge videos it might bog a little.  Chrome OS runs on Linux, and in Linux there's something called zRam.  zRam creates a RAM swap file on your hard drive, 1.5 times the size of your physical RAM.  Since the hard drive in the Chromebook is an SSD, data moves between RAM and that swapfile instantly.  Once you enable zRam, it will add a 3GB RAM swap file on your SSD, so now your 2GB RAM Chromebook effectively has 5GB of RAM, instantly and for free.  It is a persistent change- it stays there even after you reboot.Here's how:1.  Hit ctrl-alt-T, a browser window opens with a message about Crosh, the Chrome OS developer shell, followed by a command prompt ("crosh>")2.  Type "swap enable" (no quotes) and hit enter.  Crosh confirms that you've created a swap file that will be active when you re-boot.3.  Re-boot, and enjoy your free RAM upgrade.  w00t.

Reviews.Title: What a good deal.
Reviews.Author: Roberto V. Illa
Reviews.Content: I take it with me to medical conferences.You can access e-mail...my main need when I am in a hoteland away from my office.  You can read books.....larger thanmy Android phone....so it is easier to read my amazon.come-books.  Could not load Windows Explorer to get to mybilling website....but Windows Explorer has had bigproblems recently. No loss.  You can even watch movies(Netflix) on this thing.  This little lightweight device was a strokeof genius. It takes care of 99% of my on-the-road needs. Great price!

Reviews.Title: Great buy for the money!
Reviews.Author: AMH "Merry Shopper"
Reviews.Content: I was actually impressed with it though it didn't work out for me. I did a lot of research on all the Chromebooks before buying and the Acer was given the best review by several tech sites.  I was extremely impressed by the speed and battery life. I should have researched the fact that I could not hook it up directly or wirelessly to my printer nor could I connect it to my scanner. However, if I needed a lightweight, fast, inexpensive netbook only, I would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Chromebooks rule
Reviews.Author: Brandon Eash
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace the Samsung 11" chromebook that my kids dropped on the floor and broke the screen.  To my surprise, when it booted up for the first time and I logged in, ALL of the apps from previous broken chromebook were already there waiting to be launched on the new acer.  Even the wallpaper was the same.  It was just like I was booting up the original chromebook.And, google was immediately on top of the heartbeat virus, and virus protection is already built -in the chromebook OS is constantly updating for free in the background without you even knowing it.  No more pop ups from Norton or McAfee or whoever trying to alert you, get you to buy some terrible virus protection that cripples your machine.  I can't say enough about how happy I am with the interplay between chromebook, my google e-mail and drive account, and my android phones.  Google has got it right.  I can access any of my files from any devices.That said, the feel is a little "cheap."  Not as solid and elegant as a Mac Airbook, for example.  I watch Netflix, Comdedy Central, You Tube all the time with no problem, but I'm sure there are higher -end graphics drivers out there.  Most of what I do however is read the news, shop online, e-mail, use the pixl-r (the free web-based "photoshop") and it suits my needs.

Reviews.Title: No need for a laptop
Reviews.Author: Harold Seaburg
Reviews.Content: My 2 year old Chromebook developed a cracked screen. It would could $50 to repair but I can get a brand new one for <$200. So, I opted to buy this Chrome. Its just as nice if not nicer than my original Chrome. Excellant graphics, fast connection to Networks, battery life is amazing, etc, etc... I can understands peoples need for laptops but this does everything I will ever need.

Reviews.Title: Exceeded my expectations
Reviews.Author: RD
Reviews.Content: Once you get used to saving your work in the cloud rather than on the device, this is a great system. Besides Google Docs, it has a lot of free apps including online Word and Excel, as well as drawing tools, games, etc. Very easy to set up and use. Has a USB port too, which is a bonus. I really like Acer, and Chrome is a nice OS for Internet activities. I highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: A lot of machine for a little money!
Reviews.Author: up word
Reviews.Content: Purchased for my Dad (aged 88), who has some physical limitations. He likes the Acer a bit more than the Samsung Chromebook, mostly because of the keyboard feel & touchpad features (his Samsung succumbed to weak hands & gravity). Dad uses the Chromebook for web browsing, email and a bit of music. He lives in a long term care facility & we don't worry much about theft since the Chromebook stores so easily and the price is low.

Reviews.Title: Does what it does, and extremely well
Reviews.Author: C. Conner "Yeah...I love music"
Reviews.Content: I am blown away by the quality of the Acer C720 and with Chrome OS. First, the touchpad and keyboard are better than those on my Sony laptop that cost 5.5 times more. The screen, while not hi-res, works perfectly well for TV and movie viewing. Let's face it, you're not buying this to run your home theater and watch The Matrix.Regarding Chrome OS, there are very few things I do with a computer that it will not do:1) Skype calls (I knew this going in, so it wasn't a surprise)2) Various file syncing programs (Dropbox, JungleDisk, Box) that I use for different things. Of course, I can access my files online, but for business reasons I cannot move some of these to Google Drive.3) A few specific, proprietary non-web applications that will run on Chrome OS (or Ubuntu or OSX for that matter). My workaround for this is Chrome Remote Desktop, whereby I can access my Windows machine perfectly from my Chromebook.Other than that, I can do everything I need including email, calendar, shopping, news reading, weather, and checking a couple of social sites.  And, by the way, the browsing speed and app switching is speedy, flawless and "just works".There are many, many use cases where this could truly be the only machine you need on a day-to-day basis. For non-work computer use, it is all I need and then some.  And I cannot stress enough the quality of the keyboard and touchpad relative to other Windows machines I've used.I even bought one for my father, who get frustrated immediately when technology doesn't "do what he's thinking" (you know the type), and so far he's really enjoying the machine and Chrome OS. And I share mine with my kids, who can do much of their schoolwork on it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent device!
Reviews.Author: derekmski
Reviews.Content: I've had this for a couple months now and I love this thing.  I also have a windows desktop that replaced my windows laptop and the chromebook filled the gap with me needing to use a laptop at school or on the go occasionally.  I love how fast it is, boots up in like 7 seconds, always up to date and virus protection built in so you don't have to worry about anything like that.  Also unlike a windows pc it doesn't slow down after time, it's always fast.  The battery life is also amazing on this thing, depending on what you're doing and the screen brightness you can get upwards of 9 hours out of this thing which is awesome.  I have had multiple tablets and I prefer this instead because I can type documents and longer emails easily.  The keyboard and touchpad are very intuitive with cool shortcuts and gestures.  This thing does have an acer ac adapter but it charges from dead to full extremely fast, in under 2 hours.  It does have an SD card slot, a USB 3.0 port, a USB 2.0 port, and an HDMI out.  The HDMI out does full 1080p and it's super smooth and crisp even when streaming 1080p netflix or local videos, so I was quite impressed when hooking it up to my 40", also streaming from the HDMI doesn't take much battery if you close the lid so you can stream without plugging in for probably upwards of 5-6 hours.

Reviews.Title: Best Chromebook for Students
Reviews.Author: Philip oglesby
Reviews.Content: First off, I'm a Google fanatic. I have all my music on Google Music, Documents on Google Drive and E-Mail through G-Mail. I even own the Nexus 5. When my windows laptop bit the dust, I was looking for a cheap alternative. The chromebook worked perfectly. I usually just surf the internet, buy things online, do light editing in Google Docs and send e-mails. This computer excels.Buy If:-You use lots of Google services-Need a great laptop for surfing the internet, writing light word documents, presentations, playing music and movies and some light web editing. Basically 85% of the world would be able to use a chromebook with little loss of usability.-Want a cheap laptop with good build quality, great battery life (around 5 hrs with heavy use) and want something small and lightweight.Don't Buy If:-Need to do heavy programming, gaming or video editing.-Don't use a lot of Google services or don't want to make the switch.-Can't stand a small screen. (My 57 year old father swears he can't even read the 11" screen).Some Other Thoughts:-Chrome OS is still a work in progress and syncing with Google Drive can be weird at times.-There are a great deal of Chrome Apps that cover a lot of your needs, look around before writing off a Chromebook.-The screen on this laptop is not gorgeous, it's really why I gave this computer four stars.For $200, you really can't beat it if you just want to surf the internet and do light doc editing and video watching.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with my Acer C720
Reviews.Author: Stephen R. Berry
Reviews.Content: This is an EXCELLENT computer for those people to do web browsing, email, and some document editing using Google's applications. I have personally swapped from Dropbox to Google Drive (everyone gets 15GB for free, and Chromebook owners get an additional 100GB space for two years) on all my computers in the house - which keeps all my documents and files synchronized among all my computers.  Works just as good as Dropbox, which I loved for several years.I have cut over to using Google Docs for all my day-to-day writing needs. All my documents are available offline on the Acer Chromebook, so I am not worried about not having Wi-Fi all the time - it just keeps on going and then re-synchronizes when it finds a signal again. You can do the same with other Google applications like Sheets (spreadsheet application) and Slides (for presentations). Just excellent!Battery life is OUTSTANDING. I regularly get the full 8.5 hours they quote, sometimes a little more - all with screen brightness at well over 70%. Build quality is much better than average, keyboard is OK.  I reckon I can do about 90% of all my current computing needs on this little jewel.  I am thoroughly impressed and would purchase another one in a heartbeat.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

Reviews.Title: I LOVE YOU CHROMEBOOK!
Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: I am currently writing this review from my new chromebook right now! :) I really love this little laptop, mostly because it is SO fast and does everything I need it to. I have a full sized HP Pavillion G7 that I have loved since it came out but it is just too bulky and heavy to bring to work, class, etc. This little computer is SO fast, looks nice, wasn't expensive, and does everything that I need. NOT TO MENTION that it weighs TWO POUNDS. If you research what a chromebook is before your purchase (and you should because you might be disappointed otherwise) then you will love this laptop. I do!

Reviews.Title: Wonderfullllllllll!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Allan T. Meyer "Yak Trakker"
Reviews.Content: I LOVE My new chromebook wish I would have had it a long time ago .... I can't say enough good things about it works flawlessly!

Reviews.Title: Great quality, perfect OS for family
Reviews.Author: pmdeyoung "Navy Nurse"
Reviews.Content: Great quality equipment, Chrome OS os perfect for my spouse and kids.Equipment:Great quality, great battery lifeOS:This is our second Chromebook in the family and I'll be getting one for each kid when they are old enough.Fine for travel, I load movies on it for plane flightsMy son uses Google docs for all his schoolwork, the powerpoint and word versions are perfect for his use

Reviews.Title: Acer rocks!
Reviews.Author: Becky Blanton
Reviews.Content: I bought FOUR of these bad boys and they rock. One went to a friend in Kentucky who is an advocate for education about male breast cancer - [...]. Two others I sent to people in Uganda, a pastor with 20 orphans and a woman who dreams of starting her own restaurant, and the other to a friend here who was laid off from a job and want so work online. ALL of them reported they LOVE their Chromebooks. They are great machines. Highly recommend them for new computer users, the elderly who only use them for email, Facebook, and online activities and who don't need the power, bells and whistles of a full computer. For what it does and all it does, it's amazing. I plan to buy four more!

Reviews.Title: A perfect 2nd computer
Reviews.Author: C Graham
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have 1 year old twins and rarely have time to get to our desktop computer in our bedroom.  We have ipads and smartphones but it was getting tougher and tougher to keep up with everything.  We considered getting laptops but hate how slow they traditionally start and how much they weigh.  We then looked at a macbook air but thought the 2 1 year olds would destroy it pretty quickly.  We found this computer and thought for under $200 we would give it a shot and also bought a squaretrade warranty.Honestly, I almost have no need to go to the desktop any more.  We put this behind cushions on the couch, charge it about once a week and it turns on almost instantly.  We set it up to print to our bedroom and to my printer in my office.  We manage our photos from our camera on it, do all things email, web, facebook, etc... on it, etc...  We traveled this last week to my parents and as soon as we added their wifi password we were off to the races.  The biggest downside is we will have to teach a few people how to use google hangouts like my grandma as you can't run facetime or skype on it.

Reviews.Title: Best Cost Effective Alternative
Reviews.Author: Maynard E. Raguine "TakaminePlayer74"
Reviews.Content: I've had my Toshiba laptop for about six years now. In effect, its performance and speed have degenerated, despite keeping it as healthy as possible. Seeing as how I do most of my computer work online nowadays anyway, getting a Chromebook was the most cost effective alternative to getting another laptop or desktop.Everything you need to use the internet as effective as possible is in the Chromebook through the usage of applications. Some standard apps that come with the unit are Google Chrome, Docs, Play, Drive, GMail, and pretty much everything else in the app store.Two gigs of SDRAM, and 16 gigs of solid state hard drive space, and 100 gigs of space on the Google Drive is pretty good for a computer of this scope. Unit boots up in seconds...literally! Computer has built in virus protection, and it updates itself, so no worries on that end.Please take note however, that this is not a Windows based laptop...it's literally just the Google Chrome web browser in laptop form, loaded with all kinds of applications. So if you need something that'll do more work than just browse the web, play music, and edit documents, I highly recommend getting an actual laptop.If you find yourself online most of the time, doing nothing much beyond that, you can't go wrong with the Chromebook.

Reviews.Title: perfect for my needs
Reviews.Author: bjord
Reviews.Content: I had the older Samsung ARM Chromebook,  but it would stutter and lag when trying to watch some streaming movies on Google Play,  so I sent it back and got this model.I was lucky enough to get one of the 4gb models, and this thing is perfect for watching movies, consuming media, writing emails, or anything else I want to do.Just to test it out,  I had several tabs open simultaneously playing movies on Netflix, Google Play,  YouTube (HD), streaming content on the Weather Channel website, Pandora, AND graphic-heavy sites the Verge and ESPN going all at the same time,  and there was absolutely no lag or stuttering at all!I think the keyboard and trackpad are just fine,  and I really like the gestures, 2-finger swipe, and keyboard shortcuts that a Chromebook features.I also utilize web-based programs like pixlr that is a web-based photo editing software when I need functions like that, so I really don't lack for any functionality on the Chromebook.  Any heavy lifting is done by my desktop computer anyway,  so this thing does everything I need it to do.Really a great product.

Reviews.Title: Second Chromebook
Reviews.Author: David O
Reviews.Content: I also had the Samsung model and this Acer C720 is superior to it in every way.  Faster and easier to use and much more fun to play with.  Excellent battery life and portability.  Would buy another any day.

Reviews.Title: Replaced my laptop!
Reviews.Author: Kevin C. Fairdosi "Kevin"
Reviews.Content: I've been using this for a couple of weeks and have loved it. I switched to a desktop for power and sold my macbook pro for this baby. Is it powerful and able to do half of what my MBP could? No, of course not. But that's not the point of this machine. For light work (browsing the internet, checking mail, very simple word processing, etc), this does the trick. I got the 2GB model and have had no problems. I sometimes find myself using Google Remote Desktop to access my powerful desktop from the comfort of my couch, and it works with almost no lag.Some thoughts in comparison to the Samsung Series 3:-I was surprised by how heavy this thing felt. It's not much heavier, but you can really feel it. It was a little disappointing when I first picked it up. Still, it's not exactly a sack of bricks. It's really light, just not as light.-It feels sturdier. The keys on the Samsung constantly fall off, but these feel like they're holding on well (so far). I'll certainly update if I have problems.-The keys are a little hard to press in the beginning. It takes a few days of getting used to, but they are definitely harder to press than my macbook pro and just about any other modern keyboard I've used. That's not necessarily a bad thing, just a matter of taste.-The screen is beautiful on both machines.All in all, I'm happy I got this machine over the Series 3, mainly because of the issue with the keys falling off of the latter. I would prefer that machine in just about every way if not for the keys. This is great though, and I can't think of a reason to dock any stars at this moment.

Reviews.Title: Great Christmas gift, she loves it.
Reviews.Author: Lorentsen
Reviews.Content: My fiancee had mentioned to me at different times she wanted a netbook type of computer, she wanted something small enough that wouldn't take up too much kitchen table space and yet large enough for comfortable viewing.With so many different netbooks on the market, it was a hard choice. Knowing she likes using Google Chrome, Gmail and other Google products, I decided to focus on a Google oriented computer. Chromebook and I'm glad I did. She loves it.The Chromebook is perfect in size,  you feel like you're using a laptop without the chunkiness. The bootup is extremely fast, turn it on and you're ready to go in seconds. The graphics and sound quality are fine for watching movies or listening to music.One feature she liked, you can set the touch pad to scroll with two fingers, making for easy web browsing. For applications, Google has numerous additional applications that can be used on the Chromebook.There is a decent amount of space to store personal files on the Chromebook, it is also compatible with external USB drives and SD cards if you need more space. You do not have to use Google Drive, my fiancee uses a 64GB SDXC card for extra storage.As for durability, durability is fine for everyday normal use. If you have a habit of dropping computers, don't blame the product if you break it, instead buy a laptop designed for handling abuse.A lot of the complaints about this Chromebook are clearly from people who did not bother to take the time to read the product description. The product description is accurate, it tells you exactly what this device is meant for.This is a *web based computer designed around Google* and with that in mind, the Chromebook is worth every penny for what it is designed for.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop, great price
Reviews.Author: Hexydes
Reviews.Content: I'll preface this by saying that I've used the HP 11 and Samsung Series 3  Chromebooks for a few weeks each. The C720 is better in some ways than the HP 11, worse in others. It however beats the Samsung Series 3 in almost every way possible. It's better than the HP 11 in that the processor is MUCH faster. Browsing through tabs and using more intensive websites is a much better experience than on the HP 11. However, the screen and form-factor of the HP 11 are, in my opinion, much better than the C720.Overall though, this is a great laptop. Had they simply put a little more thought into the design, and used an IPS display (which I would be willing to pay a total of $50 extra for), they'd have had a runaway hit. As such though, this is still a great laptop, and if you're looking for a solid Chromebook, you won't be disappointed with this one.

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: crazygirl "kelli"
Reviews.Content: Wow this has got to be the best bang for the buck. I've never been a very computer literate, but dealing with my new Acer, has been a very awesome experience. I have two kindle books that I kind of used to help me with a general overview. This is so different in a great way. I can"t believe the boot time on this machine. To me it seems more like 4 seconds rather than the stated 7. People have mentioned the keyboard feeling flimsy but I think it suits me just fine. Sounds pretty good with the Dre beats.....sound beats the heck out of my Sony xperia z and kindle fire 7 HD 2012. Much louder and for199.00 that was a pleasant surprise. Feels solid, not cheap at all. I'm still trying to get this app-extension thing figured out and the productivity apps? are so impressive. I'm happier than a pig in, well you know where I am going. Out of stock right now at Amazon and I can see why. This thing is THE BOMB!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Big functionality in a tiny fast package!
Reviews.Author: TomBob
Reviews.Content: you can keep Windows 8.  This is everything I need in a fast little package.  I also own a MAC desktop, I Pad mini. They are feeling somewhat neglected since the arrival of my Acer Chromebook.

Reviews.Title: Great Unit
Reviews.Author: Jerry
Reviews.Content: In order to test this unit right out of the box, I attached an HDMI cable and plugged it into a 32" TV.  I also plugged in a Logitech wireless mouse and key board.  Then I turned it in.  One upgrade later it was working like a champ (Total less than a minute).  From then on 10 seconds or less.  No noise.  Both my wife and I have logins.  Just click on your name, put in your Google password and there you are.  Amazing unit.  It just sits there, quietly.  Runs every web page, Netflix, Hulu, Amazon.  We have concentrated on doing everything on the cloud.  My wife does volunteer accounting and membership list work for the county library.  Fortunately, they are smart enough to use Google docs and spreadsheets (BTW-why would you buy Microsoft office when Google Docs is Free?).This is the best unit you can possibly buy-IF you do not need programs  For example, I have a software program for converting VHS to DVD. Can't use it.  I also have a full software program for our printer so I can scan, etc.  Can't use it, although the Chromebook prints to the printer fine.  I also am using Turbotax and Quicken for the last time.  Once I change to on-line that will not be a problem.  Oddest yet, I have Dish network with the Sling Player built in.  Won't work???  The sling works fine on my computer, tablet and even phone, but not on the Chromebook.  I am assuming (hoping) that will be fixed.  We are snowbirds and spend 2 1/2 months in the desert.  DishAnywhere is a godsend for us.If you are buying a second computer, or do not need programs, a Chromebook is the best possible solution.  If you want a computer for your parents and want to be able to communicate without worrying about Microsoft or viruses, this is the one.  You must use Hangouts (no Skype) for webcam communication

Reviews.Title: Works great - IF its what you need.
Reviews.Author: Kayhold
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are 2 very very different creatures. I use my laptop to watch TV, movies or browse the web.He uses his to listen, organize music, and reload his ipod and in general manage his 250 gigs of music.While this Chromebook is great for what I need, its not at all great for my husband, who it was bought for.Now, I thought "Oh, it has bluetooth, he should have no problem with his iPod!" but that wasn't the case. It appears the bluetooth is for things like speakers, and not file transfers. They would not pair up and some research showed it wasn't going to happen.I did plug his ipod directly into a USB port, and I could access the ipod but not like we wanted.Downloading iTunes was also not happening.So, while I would have just used Google Music, my husband is not willing to change his ways, ha! The free Google Music would only let him move 20,000 songs which is about half of what he owns.So, unfortunately we will be returning it for a Windows 8 netbook, but I'm considering buying my own Chromebook.

Reviews.Title: Great notebook for student or just anybody!
Reviews.Author: Omid Barat
Reviews.Content: I bought this chromebook knowing exactly what I am getting into.  People, this is a Chromebook! Not a laptop or a wannabe-laptop!  You can only access the Chrome browser, nothing else.I was blown away by the speed and battery life of this machine.  I also really like the buttons on the top, this doesn't have the F1 - F12 buttson, this has buttons with graphics as to what they do.  Very useful.  I also love  what Google did with the touchpad: 2 Finger scroll, 2 finger snap from right to left goes back, and left to right is forward.  3 Finger snap to either direction switches from one tab to the other, depending on the direction you go.I also love the full screen mode, and the keyboard itself.  I have been using mine for about a week now and am very happy with the battery life, and the overall feel and ease of use of the ChromeOS.  I have been holding it on my lap and hardly feel any heat after HOURS of heavy usage (youtube videos, documents and such.)The main reason I bought this was because I will start a software engineering position soon and wanted to catch up my Java programming skills.  Unfortunately, there is no way to run a traditional IDE like Netbeans or Eclipse on ChromeOS. I tried some of the cloud-based IDE and didn't like it.  The good news is that putting a flavored linux operating system called ChruBuntu is a PIECE OF CAKE.So when I need to do some programming, I switch to Linux and start up Eclipse, it works great!As for performance, I tend to browse or work with at most 5 tabs, and so far, I am very satisfied.Great job Google/Acer!!!  I look forward to buying the next gen!

Reviews.Title: Bought it, tried it, disliked it... not the product but the Cloud concept
Reviews.Author: Flashfox
Reviews.Content: Someone made a valid point. The 3-star wasn't merited as the issue is not with the C720 but with my expectations. So as a product, it does what it is supposed to do and it does it well. It's fast, light and easy to use. I don't give it a 5-star as that would be for the touch-screen version.My personal issues are that I mistakenly got the non-touchscreen version but in retrospect, it was a waste of money for me. Requiring "The Cloud" for almost everything is a serious handicap if you are in an area where there is no Wi-Fi. I had to tether this Chromebook to my phone many times. The product itself is OK but the "Cloud" concept it too restrictive for me.

Reviews.Title: Less than $200 fast internet machine.
Reviews.Author: Michael  Burton
Reviews.Content: I received my chromebook recently and I am just as satisfied as many of the other reviews.  I'll start off with the few items that are less than awesome.  The keyboard is ok, the keys are a little flimsy and I would have liked if there was some beveling.  The screen, although bright and good resolution, has problems when viewed at angles and not straight on. Another quirk I wish there was fast user switching but to switch to another user you have to sign out and the other user signs in.  Surely it is like this so that a latent user profile doesn't eat system resources, but fast user switching would be a nice option.Now everything else about this machine is everything you could hope for @$199.  I have many documents and pictures already with Google and once I signed in with my account they were all there.  It copied my chrome extensions from my desktop to the Chromebook once I signed in so configuration was almost non-existent.It can play every type of web content I've tried; even streaming with the Plex app works wonderfully.  I was surprised at how loud the speakers get, if you have it at max you have to be deaf.  The wifi reception works well.  I can access 5 GHz networks with better signal strength then my phone.I got this for light weight option to use the internet around the house and while traveling.  This will definitely fulfill all those demands and it feels fairly sturdy and I think it should be durable enough to carry around.  Also it's nice that it plays all web content since my wife routinely complains about websites not loading on her iPad and from the first day she grabbed this and the content loaded correctly.  Hooray!

Reviews.Title: All it's cracked up to be, but not much more
Reviews.Author: Simon Grey
Reviews.Content: Before I bought this, I bought a Toshiba Satellite 15634 because I needed a cheap laptop to complement my Kindle Fire HDX (You know, Flash, keyboard, MS Office, etc., plus the capability to cast to Chromecast.) I returned that since it lagged terribly streaming videos, and was just too flimsy. Then I thought I'd try a chromebook, being apprehensive about the OS. I have since come to love this notebook. In fact, I was sold on the set up, before I even got to the desktop. I opened the lid and it immediately asked for the password to my WIFI, and within seconds, I was up and running. It's light and fast and at $200, it beats all expectations. The web based word processor and spreadsheet are plenty sufficient for my needs. It still lags when streaming HBOGO, but I can cast it to my TV via the Chromecast with no issues (well, other than the fact that if you navigate away from the page you're on, you lose the controls, or I haven't figured out how to get them back yet.) All in all, I find this a delightful little tool on the coffee table, not the least for the fact that I don't have to give up my Tablet everytime someone wants to "check something real quick." I just toss them chromebook.

Reviews.Title: Does what I need it to do
Reviews.Author: NR
Reviews.Content: I use this for schooling since I am taking all of my classes online. Startup is fast, works smooth. Google drive took some time for me to get used to, but the printer I have can print off of Google drive, which is very nice. The battery last a very long time, so when research papers are being typed up, I don't have to worry about the battery dying on me in a few hours. I don't need it for games, I built my own PC for that. It's very lightweight and easy to carry in a backpack. I coupled it with a 64 GB flashdrive to hold all of my documents and no problems. I have had it freeze up on me a couple of times since I bought it, and holding the power button for an extended amount of time (~20 seconds) resets it, and it works fine again. Nice budget friendly for those looking for something to type papers, check Facebook, surf YouTube, and check e-mail.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for web surfing, email, and and streaming videos
Reviews.Author: CarportMechanic
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Chromebook specifically to surf the web, read and answer emails, and watch streaming videos (netflix, HBOgo, you tube, etc.).  It works really well for everything.  One feature I really like is that when you open the lid, it is immediately connected to wifi and you don't have to wait for it to connect as you often have to do with PCs.  It really fits the bill for my needs.  It's small and thin and light and very portable.  Excellent battery life too.  Overall very pleased and happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Love, love it!
Reviews.Author: Summer "Summertimealways"
Reviews.Content: We have never had a laptop before, and after reading many reviews,I decided on this one since I needed something affordable. My husbandstruggles to read on a cell phone, and he doesn't like tablets, so I got himthis. He told me to order another one because our teenagers fight over it.This has been the go to computer and I like that because everyone leavesme alone now on my computer.

Reviews.Title: My First Chromebook
Reviews.Author: biz56
Reviews.Content: Studied all the models for weeks.  Shouldn't have waited so long.  Love it, and a terrific value at that.  Use it primarily for surfing and e-mail at home and while traveling in airports, planes, hotels, etc, anywhere with wifi.  Thought hard about the larger size, but 11.6 inches is fine for my uses and the light weight makes it great for a lap computer and don't have to prop it up like a tablet. Battery life at about 4 hours is not as advertised, but it charges fast.  2 meg memory has not been a problem for me.  New models coming out soon and deserve a look, but you can't go wrong with this one for $199.

Reviews.Title: Finally an easy to use computer
Reviews.Author: William Litherland
Reviews.Content: I use a lot of computers in my work doing accounting and tax work. When I get hoe I have wanted an easy to navigate to check personal emails and do some of the online courses that are available. This is the solution. It boots up instantly and puts you on the internet in under 7 seconds! It doesn't need virus protection as everything is in the cloud. The screen size is just right to balance on my lap. I haven't tackled the printer issue but I have another computer that I can print out of if necessary. My wife also bought and she is just as pleased as I am.

Reviews.Title: Great refurb, great price
Reviews.Author: F. Hall
Reviews.Content: The Chromebook is great and really responsive.  The only thing you need to be aware of is it needs an Internet connection to be useful.  Also, for a refurb, you could never tell the difference from a new machine....no marks or scratches anywhere that I could find.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: bebelov
Reviews.Content: The Acer C720 Chromebook is exactly what I needed.  It starts up immediately and lets you check your emails, surf the web and run your favorite apps in no time at all.  I chose this to save the life of my laptop which was taking longer and longer to boot up and shut down.  Now I can check email, Facebook or anything else even when I only have a few minutes to spare.  And it is so light and portable, I can take it anywhere.  I highly recommend this Chromebook!

Reviews.Title: A Most Surprising Experience!
Reviews.Author: Sirzune
Reviews.Content: Is the concept of cloud-computing something for you? Let's see...Since receiving the Acer Chromebook C720-2848 several days ago, I've come away with a brand new perspective on the Chrome operating system. Here's my take on it and why, if your needs aren't completely dependent on Windows, this may be just the right call for you.First, what is a Chromebook? It is a laptop with its own system that relies on everything Google, and runs the operating system "Chrome OS".  Chrome OS does not allow for "programs" to be run in the manner that Windows or Mac does. It is almost fully browser-dependent (but not to the extreme that you can't use the computer without an internet connection). You run "programs" in the Chrome browser, and they run quickly and efficiently, with hardly any hesitation. Unlike that of Windows' program launching, Chrome OS is nearly immediate and glorious in its ability to do your bidding.The first thing you will note about the system is that it boots in under 7 seconds so that you can come from a cold start to having logged-in and ready for work or play. I am used to having my Windows 7 installation tweaked for high performance, but the Chrome OS needs no help there.  A few things before I really get into it should be noted:There is no firewall to configure; no need for virus protection; system is automatically updated without bother, and has an SSD (solid state drive for virtually noiseless computing), and can run up to 8 to 9 hours on one charge.  The OS requires no license validation and can be re-installed quickly if need be. Sounds intriguing? Stick around and hold on to your wig because this thing will flip it!This particular model is the C720-2848, at $200, a revamping of the older C710.  The Intel Celeron Haswell architecture brain that runs it is quite faster than the prior model, C710's Celeron brain, and comes with either 2GB of DDR3 ram or, for more handling power, 4GB, for $50 more. It appears for most users that is over-kill, as most won't have more that 10 to 12 windows running at the same time. My model is capable of having several Youtube videos playing, and several other windows open, with no adverse hit in performance. Should you choose to try a Chromebook, don't pick the older model, regardless of sales discount inducement.When you boot into your Chromebook you are met with a desktop, similar to a Windows PC, but there are no icons on the desktop. Instead, there is a sidebar where you chose which program you wish to use. You want to surf, you click the Chrome icon, and you are quickly sent off to the internet. There is also an apps icon that you click in order to see all of your applications that are available to you. These applications can be downloaded (downloaded here means: the shortcut to the application that will play in the Chrome browser) from the Chrome Store. You can build quite an impressive amount of useful apps for work or play and delete them (getting rid of the shortcut to the application) as you see fit. An example of a utility app is Screencastify, a screen video recorder that can record all you do with or without sound. You can also capture video with the webcam. Snagit, from Techsmith, is another useful app for screen recording or snapping shots of anything that you want on any page you go to.  Another useful application is Clearly, an app that rids pages of all extraneous litter, leaving only text so that you can read or save it.  There is a growing lineup of games that can be played via the browser as well, one of which is still popular, Angry Birds. You won't be able to play more demanding games, but this is not a gaming computer. As more and more users Skype now than ever before, Chromebook users are not as fortunate. But you can use Google Hangout for calls and video chatting. All sorts of utility apps and more are populating the Chrome Store, so this is just the beginning of what may turn out to be a most welcome and fast-growing app market for your Chromebook.The Chromebook can not accept printers via usb (remember: you can't install programs), but you can wirelessly print via Google Cloud Print to your printer as long as you have a printer that is capable of cloud printing. Nearly all printers for just under $100 have this feature today.Typing on the keyboard was an unexpected pleasure, as I have never been able to type comfortably with any laptop I've ever used. The touch pad is responsive and utilizes the familiar one finger mouse move, and two and three finger gestures, the latter being for scrolling back and forth through the open windows. You can plug in a usb or wireless mouse and keyboard, but you probably won't need to.As for music play, the speakers for a low-cost computer as this sound great.  There's appreciable loudness with hardly any noticeable shrill at very 80% volume. The is some slight bass, not heavy and shouldn't be expected on this laptop.  The bluetooth works with newer versions and is backwards compatible with bluetooth 2.0 and up.For light users of Microsoft Office, Google Docs takes over the job. It will read, write and edit the documents. Just don't expect it to be on par with its very expensive brotheren.This model comes with 16 GB (there is a 32 GB SSD --Solid State Drive-- version available) of drive storage and can be supplemented with Google Drive cloud storage (free) for additional storage. You can also slip in an SD card up to 64 GB for .PDF files, documents of all extensions, movies, pictures and music.As for entertainment, Youtube and Netflix is clear and never stutters. Watching movies one SD card on the matte-finish 11.5 " screen is better than expected for such a low priced laptop. No complaints here.There's an HDMI out port and one USB 3.0 and one USB 2.0 port, headphone/mic input.At just 2.7 lbs, this laptop is not cumbersome and stays very cool even after hours of play. I am writing this document on it and I feel quite comfortable doing it. I can't say that about any laptop I've used in the past. I've seen the best of laptops come my way for repair, and not once was I enthralled by the keyboard.  I love this keyboard!When you are not connected to the internet, you can still enjoy your Chromebook to some extent.  You can still write documents, read and write email (for sending later), play one of many free games, read a book or just settle in for a good old movie.  It isn't as crippled as Microsoft's damning commercial makes it out to be, is it?The question now, is: Is this for you? If you aren't a lover of Google's self-contained system and are really dependent on specialized programs, then you probably won't find much to like about it. But if you are all things Google and have no need for heavy, specialized programs like Photoshop, or intensive music production software, heavy 3-D gaming and the total Microsoft Office experience, welcome to the next thing in computing!By Eddie T

Reviews.Title: Chromebook
Reviews.Author: ChesterHartman
Reviews.Content: For $199 the computer is a miracle. What more can I say? The question is though, can I count on it over time.

Reviews.Title: I LUV IT
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I just got it but lack of set up and the portability is great. It surfs the internet super fast. I am very happy. I am writing this review for all the people who wrote reviews and helped me make my decision. If you are not a super technical programmer, this computer should be just fine. I recently went back to school and I think computer works great for my needs. It loads up really fast and updates instantly. I am never buying another windows product again.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: Adrià Vilanova Martínez
Reviews.Content: This laptop accomplished all my expectations. I like a lot that it boots in 7 seconds, because it's magic! You are ready to work in so little time... Also, it is fast and the keyboard it's pretty soft, I like it. Works perfectly for the moment.Great computer if you want to browse the web!

Reviews.Title: Acer C720 Chromebook first time owner
Reviews.Author: HLEStringman "hlestringman"
Reviews.Content: Just got this unit. Took about 10 min to set it up. So far it looks to be just what we need for a simple to operate machine. So much of what we do is on the internet, it made sense to try this out. The computer itself appears to be well-made and feels sturdy, not flimsy. The setup was easy and the way a PC should be.

Reviews.Title: Does enough for what I need
Reviews.Author: K. Bystrom
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace an aging tablet and a broken MacBook Pro.  I wanted something that I would almost only use for quick online tasks or surfing while watching TV.  This really fits the bill.  The start up time with the solid state drive and Chrome OS is sensational.  I used to be apprehensive to use a computer for any quick, menial tasks, but now I just reach from my Acer.  There are some items that take some getting use to.I have run into issues with Citrix because my company doesn't have the latest and greatest that comes with the HTML5 version.  The Chrome OS seems to lack some basic settings that I would like to be able to change.  For example, the Acer will turn on whenever you lift the screen.  It makes sense to do so, but it did take me some time to get used to it when I was just looking to clean the screen or keyboard.  And finally, as I am sure you know, the Chrome OS doesn't have the ability to install programs outside of the Chrome browser.  I knew this going in, but there have been a few times that I wish the OS could at least run very simple programs in an emulated environment.The Acer C720 looks stylish and isn't very flashy.  The keyboard feels a bit cheap compared to any other I have used, but you get what you paid for.  I was actually surprised to find a full-sized HDMI port that easily allows the computer to display on an external display like a monitor or HDTV.  I have actually used that feature more than any other, but having two USB ports that are on EITHER side of the computer is also great.It's exciting to use Chrome OS and the Acer C720.  Google releases new updates to Chrome OS regularly that bring new features and abilities and more and more developers are creating apps that are specific to the OS.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase!
Reviews.Author: Andrea Casnellie
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter for her birthday. She needs a basic, simple book with cloud storage and google apps for school, browsing the internet and social media sites. It is cute, portable, and serves its purpose. I hope she can make it last throughout her school years.

Reviews.Title: Perfect if you have a steady Internet connection.
Reviews.Author: Chris B. "Chris"
Reviews.Content: I own a MacBook Pro, and this little Acer Chromebook quickly won my heart. It is fast, reliable, and functional––if you have a steady Internet connection. If you are reading reviews for Chromebooks, you already know that they are not much good without an Internet connection. This is true, but for the price--how can you afford not to buy one?

Reviews.Title: Use it all the time
Reviews.Author: Janis M Paquette
Reviews.Content: I bought thiis Chromebook specifically for travel, as it's small enough that you don't have to take it out when going through airport security.  But now it's the ONLY computer I use!  It's got a full size keyboard, it's light, the battery holds up a really long time, no worries about getting viruses and it's so fast.....no waitng for long boot-ups.  Love love love it!

Reviews.Title: Great, but Noisy
Reviews.Author: Jared
Reviews.Content: Good screen, keyboard and track-pad and really lightweight.I love everything about the computer except the noise.The noise is a very high pitch sound that kind of sounds like it could be the fan, but everyone on the internet seem to agree that it is coil whine, which cannot be fixed.  It's usually not bad, but if the room you are in is quite it can be pretty annoying and distracting for others around you.

Reviews.Title: Great Chromebook!
Reviews.Author: Max Power
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my Dad to replace his old Windows XP desktop. All he does is email and surf he web. This is perfect! Great price and does what it says.

Reviews.Title: Best Chromebook I have owned
Reviews.Author: Kyle Salewski "Kyle Salewski"
Reviews.Content: I have previously owned the CR-48 and the Acer C710. They were both great machines but this one is so much lighter, snappier, and just works great. I use it as my daily driver and it lasts the entire day. I would definitely recommend this for anyone who needs to write documents, listen to music, watch videos, online shop, and use social media.

Reviews.Title: Can not believe how great it is for the money
Reviews.Author: Stan Tomberg
Reviews.Content: Battery life is longer than they state. We use to listen to baseball on the internet. The screen goes blank during the  game and we get 12+ hours to the charge.Lightning fast starte up and operation.Can not be beat for browsing, enail and use on the internet.

Reviews.Title: Excellent and fast web surfer.
Reviews.Author: Thomas A. Burns "Tomasso"
Reviews.Content: Goodbye Laptop and Hello Chromebook! Super fast web surfing, start up and shut down makes me love this over my laptop and even my tablet!

Reviews.Title: Does what I expected
Reviews.Author: Greg Martha
Reviews.Content: Great to be able to open up the screen and within 7 seconds connected and functioning. Does what it is supposed to do. My one hope is that Google will create more apps for the Chromebook.

Reviews.Title: My Second One . . .
Reviews.Author: B. WILLIAMS "B WILLIAMS LOOKING FOR LIGHT"
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit.  This is perfect for me.  Slip easily into my carry-on and with it's many apps and lots of other features it does everything I need it to do when I'm ' on-the-road'.  Fast and Easy transfers to my home systems.  I'm finding even when I'm not traveling I'm opening this little Acer for quick e-mails and surfing.  Bought the second one just to have one packed and ready to go. These units have a very nice feel to them.

Reviews.Title: good product for the price.
Reviews.Author: david dover
Reviews.Content: Its very compact, loaded with good features, great battery use time. gave this to my wife and she loves it.

Reviews.Title: Simply Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Steven Steer
Reviews.Content: If you're already a google fan (as I am), this device is a no-brainer.  Super fast, long battery life, lightweight.  Don't hesitate if you're on the fence.  I wish I would have picked one of these up a long time ago.

Reviews.Title: Sooooooo goood!!!
Reviews.Author: Birukti
Reviews.Content: I love this!! I was kind of worried about it because how can something not that expensive be good. And I was right, it wasn't good...it was beyond excellent. The packaging was professional, keyboard is smooth, the screen is clear, the surface  is soft, it moves so fast,,, just lovely. I'm so glad I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Previous Chromebook was a C710 (My experience) pros and cons!
Reviews.Author: DBA
Reviews.Content: First off we all know these chromebooks are more or less for surfing the web so lets get that out the way!I deduct one star because of WIFI issues, No ethernet connection and poor SDcard slot design!I will be comparing this to my C710 (which I have owned over a year)Pros:Most noticeable:BATTERY LIFE (more than doubles the battery life than the C710)Fast booting (both 720 and 710 are fast)Light Weight(both light weight)Speakers (Big improvement over the 710)Screen (its a matte screen which is different from the 710 yet I feel its only *marginally better* than the 710 which didnt have the best screen in the first place)Its designed a little better than the C720 as far as screen to keyboard (the hinges)Cons:Loses WIFI connection many times through out the day WIFI is dropped and sometimes doesnt even recognize my network!!!!NO Ethernet plug (the 710 has this) what happens if you need to hook up WIFI theres no ethernet thats not good at all!!!NO dedicated caps lock button yet there are multiples of other command buttonsThe placement of the SDcard slot (it shouldnt stick out the side like that the C710 has a SDcard slot(spring slot) in the front which so its not noticeable when you put it in. Much better than the side slot which makes the C720 look ugly)Not a bad buy, but I should of waited for the other models which are coming out probably later this year!For $200 bucks lightning fast surfing and no viruses its a no brainer!!!

Reviews.Title: This Device Fills A Void That Other Companies Seam To Ignore...
Reviews.Author: SuadeH
Reviews.Content: Acer has really stepped up their game by partnering with Google to create such an intricate tool.  The C720 Chromebook uses Google Apps (which are very clean cut and easy to use) in place of Windows Software.  This allows the device to work online at speeds that my gaming computer couldnt match up with!  I highly recommend this piece of equipment to anyone who needs something to surf the web with, maybe right a quick essay, do some studying, or stream a few movies.  This is simplicity; perfection in a box!

Reviews.Title: Inspires me to simplify other things in my life too
Reviews.Author: nick
Reviews.Content: I'm so in love with this thing. Everything on the keyboard is directly related to the browsing experience. It's the perfect machine for the average internet user. You can buy six of these for the price of a macbook, so if you're on the fence, just buy one of these and a nice desktop and use the other $600 to go on a weekend vacation.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied customer
Reviews.Author: sanderella
Reviews.Content: It is very reliable and high functioning for the price!!  Boots quickly, lightweight and long battery life compared to c710.  Love it

Reviews.Title: Pleasant surprise
Reviews.Author: RC65
Reviews.Content: A Chromebook does not do everything a laptop can, but it does 90% of what most people use a laptop for.  Specifically, what it does, and does very well, is surf the internet.  It does this faster than any computer I've used.  It boots up in less than 7 seconds, also much faster than other computers I've used.  It has a battery life that easily lasts over 6 hours, and it also recharges incredibly fast.  Finally, it is much lighter and more portable than a laptop.  While it looks like the old "netbooks", this product is many times superior to those outdated, balky computers.  Amazingly, this product accomplishes all this magic for what I consider to be the best bang for the buck available in computers today ($200). I also own a desktop and a Kindle Fire, but this little computer has become the machine of choice for 90% of my computer time.  In summary, I have a love/hate relationship with most computers, so far with this machine it's all love.

Reviews.Title: Great for a student or anyone on-the-go!
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: For the money, the Acer C720 (2GB) isn't just one of the best Chromebook on the market, it's one of the better cheap laptops on the market. For $199 at the time of my purchase, I could not be happier with what I got for my money. This 11.6" laptop is great on battery life, has stellar performance, and houses a sleek and portable form factor. Chrome OS is limited to some, but with a constant internet connection and a computer at home that you can remote desktop to (not entirely necessary), there isn't much you can't do with a Chromebook. The dual-core Intel Celeron (Haswell) CPU inside isn't power hungry, it doesn't put out much heat at all, and it powers Chrome OS like a boss. The C720 also carries 2GBs of RAM, which is plenty for most of what you'll be doing inside of Chrome. You won't have any stuttering or lag with multiple tabs open in Chrome, a video playing or music in the background while blogging on social media. At the time of this review I currently have 6 tabs open, including a livestream on Twitch.tv, and there is no lag whatsoever. Battery life is also fantastic. With social media, email, music, and word processing, you can expect anywhere from 7 - 9 hours with the C720, slightly less if constantly streaming video. I had a day where I unplugged the laptop at 7am, used it for notes and videos through school till around noon, then used it all day at work researching tech and playing videos; I ended the day at 10pm with around 49% battery, I then proceeded to use the laptop most of the next day at home before it finally dying around 3pm. So you can expect to get through a whole day with this Chromebook. Another additional benefit is USB 3.0. There is 1 on this laptop, as well as a single USB 2.0 port on the other side of the laptop. You also have full HDMI out for running an extra HDMI enabled monitor/tv. This greatly improves functionality if you enjoy having multiple displays. It's lightweight, portable, looks great and the build quality is superb for a sub $200 laptop, but there are a couple downsides. The original carried a full-size SD card slot (when inserted, the card would be flush with the laptop, making portable storage easy), the C720 lacks this, and only carries a half-depth SD card slot, minor downside. Also, there are no function keys as well as no caps lock key, like the original. I would like to be able to ALT-F4 out of Chrome, instead I have to CTRL-W to close each tab/window individually. The screen is 11.6" and has a resolution of 1333x768, which is just fine for a 11" laptop. Viewing angles and color reproduction wasn't the best, but you won't have many complaints sitting in front of the laptop for a few hours. Another downfall out of the box was the keyboard, the keys were shallow but well spaced. After a couple days of use I got completely used to this and am now typing this review on the C720 at 60+ WPM.To conclude, if you're on a budget looking for a laptop, already live inside of Google's ecosystem or are okay with living in the cloud (no classic Windows applications/limited storage), then this laptop will serve you well.The C720 has the best battery life for a Chromebook on the market, other than Dell's Chromebook 11 ($100 more than the C720 at the time of this review),which only carries a couple hours of battery life over the Acer here. Other than that, you won't find better performance, battery life and a simple, utilitarian design in any other sub $200 laptop.Pros:PerformanceBattery lifePortabilityLoud speakersGood trackpad with easy-to-use gesturesCons:Screen viewing angles and colorsLack of caps lock key and F4 key. (Search key can be swapped with Caps lock in settings)Keys are a bit shallow and hard to use at firstIf you reading this feel I didn't cover some aspect of the laptop, feel free to ask a question on this review, I'm very active in replying to Amazon questions. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Growing to love it
Reviews.Author: Camba Reader
Reviews.Content: I am a daily Mac and Windows user, but I love this thing. It is so snappy: from instant on to loading web pages, this thing is awesome. There is a learning curve to figure out what I can do offline, but I am pretty comfortable 10 days into it. Paired with a Chromecast, it is awesome. I have used it for simple and fast photo edits (Pixlr touch ups). I use snagit for screen captures, and Biblia.com to access my Logos library of books (online only - but much simpler to use than the Logos software).I changed the settings for the trackpad to "australian" and now it mimics my Mac magic trackpad for scrolling up and down a page. With the Kindle extension, I am sending pages to my Kindle.Overall, it's great.

Reviews.Title: great value
Reviews.Author: Tod Harter
Reviews.Content: This is a great laptop to run Linux on, quite inexpensive for what you get. I'm traveling and it is great to have a small lightweight machine with sufficient power and ram to run a modern operating system and applications. It works well with ChromeOS as well if you only need web-based services. Acer has done a great job with the C720s, I think they're pretty much best-in-class for this type of machine.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value!
Reviews.Author: Sac7000
Reviews.Content: Ok I'm not new to computers, PC's, Macs, iOS tablets (iPad) etc.,  Boots up in under 10 seconds, learning time is very short (hey, it's simple!) Keyboard is excellent, not backlit but come on turn your lamp on! It's lightweight and has a excellent battery life. Perfect for shopping, email, facebook, twitter and more. Bought one for my daughter and myself, we both love it and the best part is it's under $200 and very fast! Thank you Goggle chrome and Acer, you guys rock!Would I buy again? Yes!Would I recommend to a first time buyer? Yes!

Reviews.Title: The Perfect Computer
Reviews.Author: nolabola
Reviews.Content: I completely love this purchase.  I've been a Mac user for years and shy away from Windows machines.  I no longer use our Mac.  This meets all my needs.  The suite of Google Docs apps is evolved enough at this point that they provide everything you need.  I'm a periodicals librarian and do a lot of database work, and for nearly all my need Google Sheets works great.I get all day battery life no problem (8+ hours) and don't have to carry my charger around.  The screen is completely serviceable.  It's not my media machine and I wouldn't want to watch a movie on it, but for general use it's great.  Hangouts works really well.A note on dual booting with Linux.  I installed Ubuntu the day after I got it.  It worked fine, but there isn't enough stock memory to make it viable.  I ordered this drive (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00EZ2E8LQ/ref=oh_details_o00_s00_i00?ie=UTF8&psc;=1) which will fit and provide 64gb of storage.  Once I install that, it should run Linux without storage space issues.The only negative (and it's really minor) is that you can't upgrade the RAM.  Apparently it's soldered to the board.  It's not an issue, as the laptop is really snappy as is.

Reviews.Title: Great little device
Reviews.Author: Sir Isaac Newton
Reviews.Content: I am currently using this Chromebook to type this review and I couldn't be happier with the thing.  For $200 it is a little pricey because you can put down a little extra and buy a fully capable Windows laptop for around $300, but if you can find this on sale it is well worth it.  95% of what I do on a home laptop device is web based, so I knew going into it that this is not a full fledged laptop device.  For basic web surfing, it is top notch.  I have yet to see it bog down even with 10 tabs open.  There are several apps that make it more useful as well.  Battery life is also phenomenal!  I highly recommend for basic web use.

Reviews.Title: Great Machine, Blazing fast, But
Reviews.Author: Ameer Saib
Reviews.Content: The Chromebook works well and is amazingly fast, boot-up is under 10 sec. The battery last a long time. I like a lot of the chrome apps, and given time, I can see people breaking free of the Microsoft addiction. The only complaint thus far is the touch-pad which doesn't have a right and left buttons, making it sometimes difficult when making selections; a mouse is a must with this device.

Reviews.Title: Works Like A Dream
Reviews.Author: Patrick Northcraft
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this short and sweet, as there are plenty of well written and long reviews here already, which I did read before buying (as I never used a Chromebook before) and I would recommend you do as well.  Simply put, I bought this because I am currently a college student and I have a Lenovo G780 17" laptop as a desktop replacement in my dorm.  It was a little too big for me to lug around to my classes everyday, so I took a gamble and purchased this as a replacement.  There are apps for almost everything.  If you need to use Office, use SkyDrive and you can make Word, Excel, and PowerPoint online for free.  I strongly recommend this product.  The screen is very clear, the battery lasts very long, and the touchpad is pretty responsive.  The only design issue I have with it is that the speakers are on the bottom of the device, but that's just me.  The sound it still good, just not great when I sit it on my lap, as my leg absorbs the sound.  Overall, I do not regret buying this, and I would definitely buy it again.  It's a great deal.

Reviews.Title: FAST, FUN, FANTASTIC: Superb Little Computer!
Reviews.Author: Rainguy
Reviews.Content: First off, let's dispense with this "But, it's ugly" gripe. It's not. At all. I find the C720 thin and sleek, and I like the graphite gray color that gives off a titanium vibe. Sure, the HP Chromebook 11 is prettier but you're foremost buying a computer here, not a piece of sculpture. As for the "Jeez, you can (unlike the HP 11)  see the slotted vents and screws . . . and EVERYTHING on the bottom" Yeah, you can. I know, because I checked. And that's the last time I looked down there. Seriously, how much time do you spend looking at the underside of a laptop? Why is this even an issue?Honestly, for me the "refined industrial chic" aesthetic of this little Acer is a plus.As for performance, it's, well, amazing. I find both the screen and speakers more than adequate. The screen, once you find the right angle on your lap or desk (which requires all of about 2 seconds) has rich colors, solid contrast and color saturation. I watched a couple of Netflix videos on it yesterday, also several YouTube vids, and they all looked . . . fine. No, not an Apple retina display. But it didn't cost me $1,200 either.  And, with an IMac G5 desktop and iPad, I am, and have always been, a Mac guy. And I still find this Acer immensely impressive and fun.The speakers, though expectedly thin on bass, are clear and resonant, though I do most of my listening via earbuds through which the Acer delivers superb, rich, and nuanced audio.But mainly, the C720 is SO fast. Pages load up almost as fast as you click on the link: BamBamBam. Even the laudatory reviews of the HP Chromebook 11 concede that its processor is paleolithic compared to that of the Haswell-driven Acer.Now, when it comes to computers, I am a certifiable cyber cretin. But within 10 minutes of unboxing the C720, I was zipping around with ease and confidence. Sampling videos, creating music playlists on Spotify, loading new apps from the store such as Planetarium, Pandora, and Old Time Radio, among others. There are still some tasks I need to figure out how to do, but I am now in my third day of use and am hugely enjoying my C720 experience.For $199, it's hard to even imagine a better, or more delightful, or more complete, package.

Reviews.Title: Great alternative to a Laptop
Reviews.Author: golfman
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this new Chromebook by Acer.  I didn't buy the touchscreen so had to adapt to the finger pad which is very convenient.  However, I attached a mini-mouse to the USB port and it works terrific.  The speed of internet browsing is phenomenal.  The apps that come with it are everything you need to get you started right out of the box.  The only thing you need for full implementation of all the capabilities with your Chromebook is a Google account/G-mail account, which is a snap to set up.  Once this is established, you can obtain all the apps you want to use from the Google store if you choose.  I am a Prime Amazon customer and purchase most of my items through my Amazon account, but it is nice to have a Google account to use also.  I strongly recommend this Chromebook to anyone (any age level) if your priorities are mostly surfing the Web and using E-mail.  Great buy!!!

Reviews.Title: Seems nice, but need larger cursor size and brightness for my 83 year old eyes
Reviews.Author: Glenn Van Stephenson
Reviews.Content: I was hoping it was more like a tablet in terms of a touchcreen, but it seems pretty good otherwise.  The keyboard has a nice feel. If anyonme knows how to change the cursor size i would appreciate it!

Reviews.Title: Great Unit for basic use
Reviews.Author: New2This
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews, I selected the Acer C720 Chromebook for use at home.  The unit is primarily used for internet access and some limited word processing.  This unit is light.  The keyboard is comfortable, and it features a bright, easy-to-read screen.Boot time is very good and it has quickly become the favorite unit for several of the members of my household.

Reviews.Title: It does everything it needs to and does it well.
Reviews.Author: Paul A. Van Sickle
Reviews.Content: First of all, I don't  expect Macintosh Powerbook performance from this laptop. Once I admitted to myself that my laptop is really just for web browsing, I decided the Google Chromebook would be perfect. In the month I've owned one, it has performed brilliantly! The system boots in seconds, the display is crisp and bright, the package is lightweight and has a reasonably durable feel, considering the price.I can open several windows and 10 tabs simultaneously without problems. I can stream HD Youtube and Netflix on it, and while I haven't really tested battery life, it seems to have 6 hours+.Be honest with yourself as to what you really do with your laptop (wifi connected browsing and some document creation/editing), and you can spend $200 and get a really great computer.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't Be Happier!!!
Reviews.Author: donetta daliessio
Reviews.Content: For 200.00 you get a pretty fast machine that does it all online. starts  up ans shuts down in just a few seconds, loads pages instantly, is very compact, and touch pad works better than any other.i hooked up my wireless mouse without issue.you would easily pay triple this price for a windows laptop that compares to this 200.00 chromebook for online use.i cant comment on the durability of the machine or its hardware because i have only had it for 3 days, but i don't see anything that looks flimsy.great for online movies, games (non download), shopping, social media, etc.

Reviews.Title: A different way of computing
Reviews.Author: MMouse
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with my new Acer C720 Chromebook.  I wanted something small and portable for using on the internet.  That is what this is.  I love typing, and I am not interested in touch screens, so this is perfect.  The 7 seconds to boot up is a real treat.  I took the Chromebook along when I spent the day at a Hospital with friend getting lengthy treatments.  The hospital has public wi-fi which we attached to without a hitch.  We had a lot of fun with the Chromebook while there at the hospital.  I have been using it regulariy at home and find it very useful and fun. I connected to my Netflix account with no problem and seem to have flawless streaming.  And it really does have 8 plus hours of battery life.I am giving 4 stars, instead of 5, for two reasons.  First, when I ordered the 2 gb of RAM Chromebook, I thought I would be able to install 2 more gigs of RAM someday, myself.  Turns out that is not possible.  It is no one's fault but my own that I did not do enough research, still, it is disappointing (upgrading is fun).  All that being said, it turns out 2 gigs of RAM seems totally ample. I can have had multiple screens open with no problem.The second negative is that the chromebook does not connect to my home network.  Yes, it connects to my wi-fi, but otherwise it does not engage with any other devices via my router.  Not even the printer.  ( in the long run, there is a way to use your home printer, via "the cloud", which I have done).  It might not be fair for me to fault the Chromebook in this regard.  It simply is not a Microsoft Windows computer, and it does not behave as one.  Its a new way of computing, and it takes a while to get the feel for it.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely love it!!!!
Reviews.Author: nick
Reviews.Content: I was looking to buy a laptop for the portability and convenience. While doing some research for which one will suit me and my family best, I came across some info on Chromebooks. The research turned into researching which Chromebook will be best for us. After reading both customer and professional reviews, I decided to purchase the Acer C270.  I absolutely made the right choice. I don't know about other Chomebooks but this one is perfect for me and the family, we love it.It is very portable, its light weight and long battery life make it a go any where computer. It starts up and shuts down in seconds, with my desktop if I wanted to use the internet I would weigh the importance of what I wanted to check against turning on the desktop and waiting for it to load all its programs so I can finally use the web browser. So in the past I would use my phone but then have to deal with mobile page versions or the regular webpage but the inconvenience of small print and some pages just don't work on the phone. The Chromebook solved all those issues, On average I turn this thing on 5-6 times a day.My wife the same, she loves the ease of use and the fact that she can create documents for work on Google Docs. and they are compatible with Microsoft Office, Word, Powerpoint and the other tools in Office. She uses social media websites with no problems as well.My daughter uses it for Youtube and for an online game Animal jam. it performs flawless for both. I also play on WGT.com on it with no issues.Some people complain about the screen resolution, I have no issues here. I watch Netflix and other videos on here.If you are looking for something to browse the internet, watch videos and create and edit documents with a laptop. This is the computer for you. It seems now that companies are taking Chromebooks serious now and more companies will start producing these fantastic machines. I am excited for the future of these.

Reviews.Title: I think I've fallen in love.
Reviews.Author: Gene
Reviews.Content: It just arrived today. Was up and running in a flash. NO Windows to deal with. NO Windows updates to deal with. NO viruses to deal with. It  just worked, with no hassle.  How long does it usually take to set up a new Windows computer, while it searches for updates, makes you select settings, stalls?  NONE of that with this machine!  Set it up to use with my network in under one minute. Just typed in the password and was connected. I can't believe it. The price is fantastic. The machine works and looks great. Acer, please let us know when you are going to make a 15 or 16 inch model.  I'll buy it.

Reviews.Title: Yeah, I'm a Chrome head now.
Reviews.Author: RazzSpew10 "Rev. Neo Gnostic"
Reviews.Content: For $200, this thing is fast. Easily downloads 720P from YouTube. HBO Go, Hulu and Amazon Prime videos play quickly and smoothly. Startup is super quick and the screen is very nice and non reflective. It is quiet as there are no internal moving parts. I am very happy about how fast this Chromebook loads web pages. I recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: LOVE!!!
Reviews.Author: Lady Lisa
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my mom who isn't at all computer savvy.  It is incredibly fast and easy to use.  She loves downloading new apps and toting her little Chrome-baby all over the place!  It does everything she needs and nothing she doesn't, which is great.  I recommend it to anyone who needs a new computer but wants something streamlined and efficient.

Reviews.Title: Best $199.00 spent
Reviews.Author: Ric
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable !! Love it. works super fast. It's like turning a page of a book. Been recommending to everyone. I am truly happy with it.

Reviews.Title: My Wife is Happy
Reviews.Author: Jay B. Thompson "flea less"
