Reviews.Content: I purchased the Acer C720 for my Wife for Christmas it does all we expected and more quick booting and loading of apps a great piece of equipment for surfing the internet.While its not a monster computer seven tabs open and no problem with speed a truly great light little internet tool.When I saw the advertised battery life I was doubtful it would really perform that long between charges but I was wrong and the recharge time was amazing from 20% to full charge in a little over 1 Hour great equipment.

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: Aaron
Reviews.Content: bought 2 Chromebooks last year, this was the third.  Ideal laptop for kids & learning and can't beat price.  Battery life is good, lightweight and performance is reliable and wireless printing was easy to configure once you become familiar with Google OS.  For school projects, web surfing and light activities it's ideal.  Only complaint is that I would prefer to be able to brighten the screen a little bit more but its not an issue.

Reviews.Title: Excellent performance
Reviews.Author: Reviewer#1
Reviews.Content: I played with this machine for last few days and truly impressed by the performance.  It offers best value for given price.  Strongly recommended for students and others who want to use for light work.

Reviews.Title: Acer C720 Chromebook
Reviews.Author: David C. Patty "D C Patty"
Reviews.Content: Excellent laptop for everyday use and internet browsing. Really like the quick start and shutdown and long battery life. Light and easy to carry. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: I love this machine
Reviews.Author: warmjets
Reviews.Content: Yes, this is computer is constrained by internet connectivity, but it is lighting fast and it is the ultimate portable device for browsing + productivity,  Boots in a couple of seconds, has around 7-9 hours of battery life, and handles all basic internet tasks with ease.  This is what Chromebooks were always meant to be.  I was always an Acer skeptic before buying this, but the 4gb model is a thing of beauty.  The Chrome OS takes some getting used to and the keyboard is pretty weak, but this is a small price to pay for what you are getting at this price.  I also personally love the trackpad, but your mileage may vary.  If you need to a portable, durable, long-lasting internet workhorse, this is your product.

Reviews.Title: Really am impressed with chromebook
Reviews.Author: John  O'Keefe
Reviews.Content: Bought this Acer because the hardware meant that I could dual boot with Ubuntu.My original though was an Ubuntu netbook for $200 can't be beat.However, even though I am dual booting with Ubuntu (and would like to upgrade the ssd, void warranty or not), I am writing this from and using the actual chromeos way more than I though I would.Actually, I'm really impressed! It's fast, battery life is ridiculously long, and coming out of standby is about 1 second. Incredible!I will keep Ubuntu around for the few times I need local software that is more powerful than it's online counterparts (i.e. Audacity), but I'm finding myself using and continuing to use ChromeOS for most of my online work.Great job Google, and amazing package to put it in Acer!

Reviews.Title: VERY FAST
Reviews.Author: John R. Durish
Reviews.Content: This little machine is FAST! My son uses it at wifi hubs to play all kinds of games, oh, and do his homework too (via Google docs, etc.)Bear in mind, this is NOT a PC laptop - all the Google functions are great, but make sure you know what this thing is.

Reviews.Title: BEST value Chromebook!
Reviews.Author: Christopher Lynch "Chris Lynch"
Reviews.Content: I've owned all the Chromebooks worth having, and then some- so that leaves out the HP 14's and the educational models.I just got my C720 in last friday, and it is fantastic!Great build (better than either the Samsung or HP ARM models), plenty of power (again, better than the ARM), speedy, quiet, lightweight/portable, GREAT BATTERY!!!!The speakers aren't so great (it's a $200 laptop), the screen isn't as nice as the HP11, but really those were the only things I liked about the HP!For the money, this thing simply can't be beat.  It's approaching impulse-buy territory, and gives you a serious internet-connected machine.

Reviews.Title: Very Impressed
Reviews.Author: michael
Reviews.Content: I just received my Chromebook and I must say I am very impressed. I love the idea of the chrome OS, it's very simple, and the speed and multitasking capability is just astonishing for a 200 dollar laptop. Honestly, I thought I would be too limited with this OS so I was a bit skeptical, but just as most people have pointed out, there are plenty of apps and websites that give you options to get the things done that you need. This is a great computer for the everyday average user or a student. If you just want a simple, fast, secure computer that can manage nearly all everyday tasks at a low cost and virtually no maintenance, then the chrome OS is for you. Of course I don't want to give people the wrong idea, so if you are looking for a computer to use high end photo editing software, or play the latest games, then you are better off with a different OS. This all being said, I thoroughly enjoy having an OS that is so user friendly, quick, and has such a great interface, that I honestly would like to eventually see a "Chromephone" come to light. The integration, ease of use, and speed without having to worry about system crashes, slow downs, and viruses would be phenomenal.

Reviews.Title: Now I know why Chrome books are so popular !
Reviews.Author: Dollar
Reviews.Content: My first chrome book and happy I took the plunge . It is zippy fast and light  Amazing sound quality for such an inexpensive laptop . Very light and boots up in under 7 seconds , it is a breeze to use and great to stream movies with your HDMI , 2 gigs of ram are plenty for such a streamlined product . Love streaming Netflix , either by HDMI or watching it on the screen .Nice to type on too.Battery life is amazing !!Get one and you will be happy !

Reviews.Title: Love this chrome book
Reviews.Author: Xiuxiao Jiang
Reviews.Content: as I rated it ,,,, very cheap price. very fast and lightweight.boot up speed about 7 seconds and shut down only takes 3 secondsweb browsing is so fast, youtube plays 1080p perfectly. email, music,facebook, simply word editing etc... are very easy and fast.... love it ..

Reviews.Title: Haswell is setting the standards for quality chromebook.
Reviews.Author: ronin
Reviews.Content: As soon as Haswell Chromebook was announced I bought it because other chromebook was extremely slow. Enter Intel Haswell. Its freaking awesome. Pages load quickly, and no matter how many tabs you have open, this chromebook keeps going blazing fast.

Reviews.Title: Nice laptop, nice OS
Reviews.Author: Adam Stark
Reviews.Content: This laptop seems very well built, and the operating system boots almost instantly and, even with 2GB RAM, feels very snappy. I originally bought this laptop thinking that I might install Ubuntu, but I think I'm going to stick with Chrome OS.

Reviews.Title: Unbeatable Value and a Joy to Use
Reviews.Author: VicW
Reviews.Content: I've had just a couple of days with the Acer C270 2GB Chromebook, but so far, I'm more than highly impressed and pleased with it. For about $200, it's a steal, I think. You can't beat the convenience of such a light unit for browsing, emails, doc creation and editing.I love the chicklet keyboard, which provides good feedback, despite the limited key motion. I'm slowly mastering the differences with combined keys, which vary from the Windows that I'm used to, but I've been able to find combos to do everything I want to do on it.Audio is louder that on most portables I've used, and sound quality is pretty decent. The screen is fine, biased a bit on the cold/blue side, but satisfactory, and the text is crisp and easy to read.I haven't experienced any lag issues at all, but I also haven't tried to activate more than about 7 tabs at a time, so far.The only slight negative I've encountered is that the SDCard connection is not recessed, so that the inserted card sticks out on the side of the unit, vulnerable to damage. I had intended to plug a 32GB card in more or less permanently, but that is not a practical option, unfortunately. The free 100 GB of Google Drive space (for 2 years), is a viable alternative for the SDCard, and the Chromebook is optimized to provide very direct and quick access to Drive, so it's very much just like having the space directly in the unit, as long as an internet connection is available.All in all, I would highly recommend the unit to anyone, as long as they understand what it is intended to do, and that it isn't a conventional app based, touch-screen tablet device.

Reviews.Title: Highly Recommend
Reviews.Author: M
Reviews.Content: The Chromebook worked perfectly for what we needed. It's small, lightweight, holds a charge and it's fast. We used to have a Window's laptop that we used infrequently, every time we turned it on it needed several minutes to update. With the Chromebook you can turn it on and be on the internet in less then 30 seconds. I use the Chromebook for light internet browsing and streaming while sitting on the couch, but I still have a desktop PC that I primarily use.Conclusion: I think that if you view the Chromebook as a peripheral device, like a tablet or smartphone, you'll find yourself happier then if you expect it to perform like a traditional computer.

Reviews.Title: I am Happy with it.
Reviews.Author: karayil g valsan
Reviews.Content: Light weight, fast boot, fast shutdown, fast loading any sites or any apps. All is internet based. But I can do something like download some PDF and read again......So no wait and see formula. I watching YouTube, all my Mails, Download anything to my ssd drive. using USB drives....... Good. Very cheaper in price. Battery life very good. While web search it is clocking more than 10 hours, while Video....it is less than that. OS is Google Chrome. No Skype app yet. I am using Hangout more now these days. It is fast & clear. Not like Skype, Skype load slowly.. My last PC was near $1000 worth it is giving too much trouble in these days. I am no more ready to spend that much money for 1 or 2 year. This is cheap just $ 200 (16gb) and 240 for 32gb. No fan inside so no noise. Solid state hard drive. Cute yet Powerful, Economic and easy to carry.

Reviews.Title: No more questions, at last!!
Reviews.Author: Bobbio "Bob"
Reviews.Content: Purchased one about 2 months ago. My wife, who did 99% of her work on the internet, always had problems with her Windows Vista laptop; you know, updates, java updates, adobe updates, anti virus updates, etc.  Programs installing toolbars without permission, changing default programs. Really was annoying for her and for me having to always fixing problems. At least twice a week. I always thought that a computer for the average person should be like and appliance; "turn it on and it just works".After the initial setup which took about 15 minutes she logging into her gmail account. Almost instantly all her information was there. Email, Contacts, Calendar, Pictures and all her saved favorites or bookmarks. Then I set her up with Google Cloud Print which works great. Almost two months and she hasn't asked for help once.This is a function of it being a Chromebook and probably would be the same on any Chromebook. But I've bought many Acer products and have always been happy.  I'm very happy with this Acer C720. Its very light and has a long battery life. Instant on and shut down and a great price.

Reviews.Title: I'll give it 5 stars for being a decent chromebook for a student/traveler/coffee shop worker
Reviews.Author: Chip's Challenge
Reviews.Content: I have friends and associates who recommended this chromebook to me, and as of yet--I think that it is a wonderful device! I conducted research before acquiring this, and although the low cost motivated me--I don't typically throw money around for kicks. This was a $200 well spent in my book because the Acer c720 is a useful tool. It would also be a huge step up from nothing for users can't afford a full fledged laptop, this to me, is revolutionary.Overview:It's not necessarily a laptop replacement, but it's better than a laptop in a few ways. The main strength of the Chrome OS is that it is very difficult to hack, and it is usually intuitive and fast to use. This could replace a laptop for someone who only checks their email and does not need a computer for anything apart than web browsing. It's light, inexpensive and operates as a computer for accessing one's google drive and online resources. Everything that it does is FAST, extremely fast for a computer with 2GB.Reasons why I bought it:I have a mac book pro, but after it experienced connectivity issues with my campus network I realized that I only used photoshop and other memory intensive programs at home. I now carry this chrome book with me because it is light, inexpensive and will allow me to upload files for class, type, check my email and visit facebook. It's a mobile computer which I use to submit assignments and can even do in browser programming for class. It's a chromebook dedicated for getting work done, if I need power I'll go home or elsewhere--with this I can't play games (a definite plus for productivity's sake) and feel motivated to work. I sometimes keep it open at home in order to check my email while I'm working on my computer. I also wanted a smallish computer that didn't run windows or android--this fit the bill.This works for me because if necessary-- there are plenty macs and pcs on campus if I need other programs. Also it's fine for anything that I might need to do in a coffee shop.Size: Small and light. I know average sized men who use it therefore the small size is not necessarily an impediment for average use, but the small size might also make it suitable for a child. When it's in my backpack I don't even notice that it's there.positives:+ 7 second boot up+ watching videos online is great+ Light+ 200 dollars is a stellar price for its size and functionality+ App store has note taking apps for class+ decent battery life (8 hours)+ FASTnegatives:- keyboard and track pad are average (use a usb mouse)The keyboard does not feel wonderful on my hands although it is certainly an attractive chiclet style board.- /+ offline functionality is not superb--average. Carrying a usb drive for backup might be useful for some people.- the slideshow part of google drive is unreliable, don't depend on it- Feels unsubstantial-- some people might drop it if they're not careful--it is very light, don't leave it near the edges of tables if you have a cat.Improvements:I would like a less "grainy" keyboard, a more comfortable track pad, skype and a full-ish microsoft office would also be great (but I knew this before I bought the computer). Perhaps having microsoft office would defeat the purpose of a chromebook? If it is offered in the future I'll try it though.Also, if something were to happen to my main laptop or it were in the shop (never happened) I could still have a screen larger and more comfortable than my ipod touch. For the price--this is a wonderful machine and I plan to use it until it no longer works.Recommended for:teachers, students, grad students, fans of chrome os, web browsing people, travelersCase suggestions: I bought the timbuk2 quickie case for this in XS and I'll probably review it when it arrives. I already have it for my 13 inch mac, therefore if it fits--I'll be very pleased. Although it might be a 200 dollar computer, I want to protect it from bangs and scratches, as well as have room for a mouse and the power cord.I recommend finding a nice mouse to use with this chromebook.+++ I't's also possible to run Linux OS as a dual boot on this chromebook. I'll write a sentence or two about this experience when I accomplish it.Feel free to ask me any questions about this chromebook and I'll be happy to answer them.

Reviews.Title: Better than I expected
Reviews.Author: Kenneth C. Reed
Reviews.Content: I'm in IT, so I like to explore different options for my clients.  With the end of support for XP I have a lot of companies who are looking at their options for their aging desktop replacements.  Linux is often mentioned as a replacement for MS products, but the market is fractured and no one distro seems to have risen to the top, so Apple and Google seem to be the only viable options for most mainstream users.  With new Windows based computers averaging over $700 per unit plus new software it's not an insignificant decision if you have to replace, say, 10 of your computers.I'm finding that more and more people use their computers primarily online anyway, so the "limitation" that Microsoft rails against in the "Scroogled" ads isn't particularly valid for many users; of course you can turn on "Offline" on your Google Drive and work on documents and email when your not connected.  With 100GB of Google Drive space for free for two years storage capacity isn't a problem for most people.  Photos can be placed on Google+ without eating into this 100GB limitation so that helps.The computer is very fast doing most things, depending on your wireless connection.  It boots almost instantly, opens local apps like the file explorer and video player instantly, and is light and seemingly sturdy; at least it feels sturdy in spite of the plastic case.  The battery life is quite good at about 8 hours of use and it charges remarkably fast.  The screen is OK, nothing amazing, but quite readable.  With the HDMI out you can easily plug it into a large monitor or TV.  It quickly recognizes the second display and you can easily use that additional display as a mirror or as an extended display.  This is not a gaming computer, but for HD video playback it is excellent when viewed on a large display.  Movie viewing on the internal display is quite acceptable as well, although the internal speakers are not very loud and the 11" screen needs to be held pretty close to your eyes, but not much closer than a small desktop monitor.  Headphones overcome the sound problem if you want to use them.  It's own internal display has good viewing angles from side to side, but is quite sensitive to the horizontal tilt.  However the hinge is stiff enough that the display will stay wherever you place it, so I don't find this a huge drawback, but it could be better.  The keyboard is acceptable given it's size and I don't really miss the lack of the function keys, or you can plug in an external keyboard and mouse.  The internal storage is fairly limited but a 16GB USB flash drive like the SanDisk Cruzer Fit fixes this for very little money.So much for the physical part; how is it to use for work?  Well, pretty good, actually.  The cloud is incredibly convenient for those on the move, assuming you can find a wireless connection, which is more and more common, but most will use the Chromebook in their houses and/or offices.  The range and sophistication of apps is increasing at an incredible rate.  Many desktop functions like QuickBooks, AutoCAD, and office suites are now apps.  That's the good news, the bad news is that many of these apps are still not as sophisticated and feature rich as their desktop counterparts.  QuickBooks, for instance, doesn't let you customize your invoices nearly as much as the desktop version.  The biggest use for computers in the business world is, of course, office suites and Google Docs does a pretty good job, but still lacks many of the features of  desktop office suites.  For instance Excel or  OpenOffice Calc will let you format cells so the text can be angled, but Docs lacks that feature.  That said, Microsoft's own Office Online also lacks this feature along with other limitations.  However, the ability to work collaboratively from anywhere is great and if you work a Google Sheet or whatever, you can later use OpenOffice, LibreOffice or other software to tweak it later.So, is the Chromebook or a Chromebox at full fledged replacement for your aging XP?  No, not quite if you require a feature rich software package(s), but it's pretty close.  I have clients with perfectly good XP machines and they plan on using those machines until the computer fails, but they also realize that as of the 8th of April they will have to unplug those machine from their network and the Internet after moving much of their data to Drive and also backing up locally.  However their investment in the computer, in MS Office 2003, and in other software will continue to be useful as an adjunct to their Chromebooks.For under $250 this is an amazing little computer that will do most of what many people need.  Cloud computing is still in its infancy and as the power of apps increases so will the functionality of this type of computer.  One of the best parts is that you don't need a guy like me to fix your computer anymore; no more viruses, no more software updates, no more backing up your computer; it's all done by the pros, mostly at Google, so it's transparent to the end user.  Some folks worry about the security of their data, but I think that the whole business model of Google depends on them protecting your data so they invest millions into backing up the data and keeping it secure.  How much did you spend on the same functions over the last 5 years?  Less, I'll wager.Bottom line; if you're tempted, I say go for it, I doubt you'll be disappointed and will probably be amazed.  This is not the only Chrome device out there; I also recommend that you look at the Toshiba Chromebook with its larger screen or the ASUS Chromebox which should be out in March.

Reviews.Title: The Haswell processor makes all the difference.
Reviews.Author: James M. Cook
Reviews.Content: I initially purchased an HP 11 Chromebook and while I was happy at first, I quickly realized it wasn't for me. If you only have a few tabs open at any given time, it's fine but if you're a "power browser" like me (and it's a hard habit to break), you will be disappointing. Hover over my username to read my review of the HP 11 and the following update.Now on to the review of the Acer. The Haswell processor makes all the difference in the world. This little Chromebook feels like I'm browsing with a Windows machine. In fact, it beats my roommate's $350 Toshiba with Windows 8 and 4GB ram. I can have upwards of 20 tabs open and stream music with no hiccups at all. True, the design isn't as stylish but I like it in a utilitarian kind of way. I think it of a workhorse and a great value for the money.The keyboard and trackpad is just as good as the HP 11 and while the screen doesn't pop as much as the HP, since it's matte it has the advantage of no reflections and being easier to clean. The fan is very quiet as well and the vents are on the back under the hinge. Much better that my last Windows laptop which baked my left hand. It gets a little warm but never hot. You also get a lot of ports. One HDMI port which I like because continuously plugging and unplugging a slimport into the micro USB on my HP worried me...micro USB is small and fragile compared to an HDMI port so I was afraid it would eventually break. A SD port is also included which is great because I store all my music on an SD card rather than uploading my 2700+ MP3 collection to Google drive or Google Play Music. At 512Kbps it would take forever (I live in the middle of nowhere and even libraries only have around 3Mbps upload speed). With the SD card, I just plug it in whenever I want to listen to music. You also get two USB ports but one is USB 3.0 so when I backup my documents, pictures and music It will come in handy. Even though all my documents and pictures are already in the cloud, I still make backups just in case.As far as the Chrome OS I won't say much since a quick Google search will tell you all you need to know, but as a formerpower user/Linux geek I am at the point in my life where I just want something basic, simple and that "just works" out of the box for a good price and the Acer C720 delivers this in spades! Keep in mind that the Chromebooks are for consumption first and production second (although I really like Google Docs) and you won't be disappointed. Also think of a Chromebook as a tablet with a built in keyboard, better speakers, and a bigger screen at a lower price point and you won't be disappointed. The apps (basically bookmarks in a menu although there are a growing collection of offline apps) aren't as extensive as Android but they are steadily growing. Another great thing about Chrome OS is that since most apps are web based and not installed locally, it's virtually immune to viruses and malware. That's one reason so many schools are switching to Chromebooks and why they are perfect for elderly or computer illiterate people. If you get your parents or grandparents one of these it will save you many headaches!On word of warning. If you want an HD Webcam, get the HP 14. This and most other Chromebooks have a VGA webcam that gets the job done but that's about it. It's not a big deal for me since I rarely use the webcam. Another thing is if you're friends and family don't have Google hangouts, they will have to get it in order to cam with you. I hear Facebook video chat works but haven't tested it. I've also heard that USB webcams work but again, I haven't tested it.In conclusion, if you consider yourself a "power browser" and have many tabs open at once, any shortcomings are blown away by the Haswell processor and the extra ports. I highly recommend this Chromebook.

Reviews.Title: Great product for what it is and for the price
Reviews.Author: Jefferson H.
Reviews.Content: Okay, first off, you're paying $199 for this machine. If you're expecting the highest level of features and/or hardware, then go spend $500+ on a different machine. BUT, if you're looking for something to use quite often to browse on Facebook, email, and just general web surfing for minimal cost, then this is the perfect little machine. It's basically a browser on steriods. It's really fast and snappy because the operating system is so light that it doesn't take much to power it. The battery life easily holds 8-9 hours of solid battery life.When setting it up, the track pad seemed a little jittery and glitchy, but after I set all the settings and increased the sensitivity on it, it works just fine now. I think it might have to do with the software setting itself up for the first time so it takes more resources. I have had MANY tabs open at once and it doesn't show any signs of lag. For the money, this is a great little machine and it's light so you can take it with you anywhere.

Reviews.Title: Fast cheap and pretty good.
Reviews.Author: Griffination
Reviews.Content: Ok so I'm a techie and a nerd and all that.  When I first heard of the chomebook I thought to myself, well that's quite dumb.  However after giving things some thought I realized I did ninety or so percent of the work on my computer on chrome anyway.  What I didn't do on chrome I did on Steam, the other fraction of a percent was photo editing from time to time and I wouldn't do that on a notebook anyway.So when I decided to get a small notebook thing for toting around and using in the bedroom, generally to watch movies and create some content with I fell into the Acer.  There are three Acer tablets in my family, the A200, the A210, and the A510.  All are still running flawlessly.  So I already had some respect for the brand.  I've had it for about two weeks, its performed much faster than any windows notebook I could get for under five hundred.  It's stable, stupid simple, and it does what I need it to do.So what do I do?  I stream movies from the big internet names as well as locally via plex, WHICH might I add works better on the chromebook than it does on my HTC one or A200.  I write, listen to music, well whatever you'd normally do on a computer.  I can spam out the same number of tabs on this as I do on my main machine without a slowdown.I consider the screen very good, the resolution is more than ample for this size and its sharp and bright too.  The viewing angles suck, but I have to have the screen way out for it to be an issue.The speakers are good, much better than my A200 and notably louder than I was expecting,  In my quiet room with the C720 on my lap I have the volume at 20% and its more than enough.Bluetooth works with my headset quite well, again no problems.The battery life is as stated around eight hours of run time which is plenty.A random quirk, the built in video player can handle some .mkv files with subs from the onboard storage, others it can't.  So keep that in mind, the onboard player isn't up to VLC snuff yet but plex can transcode those files just fine from my main machine.For the price it's really outstanding.  I suggest it.  Two gigs seems to be plenty, I was actually expecting it to be a dog, but alas tis not the case.  The thing that needs to be kept in mind is that this is a chromebook, not a windows machine if that is understood it will do just fine and not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: Cracked Screen
Reviews.Author: Rdean
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: Yesterday, my C720's screen cracked and spidered. There's a single point about the size of a quarter towards the bottom right edge the "spiders" out across the screen. Because I had NOT dropped, stepped-on, flexed the screen or otherwise damaged the screen, I took it back to Best Buy, which is the store I purchased it from.  The rep told me it was impossible for the screen to crack without having some external force. There was no use arguing with the guy so I brought home the little Acer and connected it to an external monitor. I can purchase a replacement screen for $60.00, and replacing the screen is a snap, but still, how can a screen crack without it being damaged?  I still really like the little computer but I'm a little less impressed with its quality.---(ORIGINAL REVIEW)  It works and it works almost flawlessly.  No, it won't install Office or Adobe products, but, it not designed for these products or people needing these products. If you need lightening fast access to the Web, your Google Docs or even to view Word Docs, this machine is perfection. It's almost "instant on" and that's a brilliant improvement over any machine I've owned. The screen is small but adequate for it's designed purposes. Watch  Netflix, <Check>, Browse Web, <Check>, Email, <Check>, FaceBook, <Check>, Draft a lengthy research paper, <No check>, but you could do it.The battery is insanely long-lived, the machine is cool as a cucumber on a warm Florida day and keyboard and track pad are fine.  This is not a Porche, Rolls Royce or even a Lexus, it's a Honda Accord.  It looks good, gets the job done and saves you a ton of money.If you understand and like the Chromebook concept, it's a no-brainer. If you neither understand or appreciate Chromebooks, then please look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Value for your money....
Reviews.Author: Bill Morris
Reviews.Content: First and foremost this is not direct replacement of your regular PC. You cannot run traditional Windows/Linux application in it. It runs Google created ChromeOS, which means its just a browser. Yes browser, Thats it!Which also means, whatever you can do in your current Chrome browser it can do that, plus some more. Please read chromebook features on google site before bashing that its not actual PC.Now to the actual laptop:Its very, very, very lightweight. Battery life is awesome. In single charge I can use it 6-7 hours (And also I kept it suspended for almost a day). As usual chrome starts in seconds. Screen quality is not that good. I used to have Sony VAIO as well and when I compare the display of that 3 year old laptop with this laptop then chromebook stills looks poor quality and that is not problem for me. Keyboard is good. Initially I had problem with trackpad because surface was bit dry/rough but now it became smooth. It respond to two-three finger gesture very nicely. It also has stereo speakers and sound quality is good. There are two USB ports and one on the left is USB3. The data tansfer from USB3 harddrive to internal SSD was superfast. But since internal HDD (16GB) is small you can't really carry collection of videos/songs into it.Overall I am very happy with this laptop

Reviews.Title: Great Mobility
Reviews.Author: leepinlilly
Reviews.Content: I bought this to bring back and forth between my home in the city and a cottage up north which has no Cable or wireless. In the summer I drive a motorcycle and and the heavier Asus I have is just to big and heavy to secure on the bike.  I use my smart phone for my hot spot up north which allowed me to use my Chromebook and apply my Amazon Prime to watch movies through HDMI hookupthat worked great then the Chromecast came out so I purchased that. "WHO NEEDS CABLE"  I love this little laptop has great fireup and download timing is awesome. Picture quality is very clear and sharp.  By the way after experiencing the Chromecast at my cottage I dumped AT&T; and the large bill I was paying in the city and know just pay $30 bucks a month for local and all the movies and prime networks CBS, ABC, NBC & FOX ect.....at both places. Happy you bet!

Reviews.Title: Good for just browsing purposes
Reviews.Author: sashank
Reviews.Content: Quick , fast and good for browsing .  Boots very quickly too. The goodies from Google are also good 100 GB online space is just too good .

Reviews.Title: Best for the buck
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I upgrade from the sARMsung chromebook and this is a huge upgrade.  Battery life doubled, performance easily doubled.. I hooked up via HDMI to my 39" tv and works smooth as silk.  I rarely go beyond a half dozen tabs at any time but the responsiveness is noticeably better.BuildThe quality is much sturdier than the sARMsung.. feels much more solid.  Keyboard keys are bit smaller than i'm used to but not a big issue.  Display is bright and crisp.  Video is rich and works without a hitch both onboard monitor or on tv.I'm only a week and change in, i'm sold and already pimping chromebooks with a renewed fervor to friends again.

Reviews.Title: So easy to use-even my six-year old can operate the Chromebook with no problems.
Reviews.Author: msrusl
Reviews.Content: Our household has a Kindle Fire, a Kindle Touch, a First Generation iPad, an iPad 2, Android phones, iPhones, and a desktop. I originally asked my husband for a Kindle Fire HD for Christmas. Then, a friend mentioned getting an Acer Chromebook and how much she loved it. I told my husband to change my Christmas request, if possible. Santa delivered and I couldn't be happier. I have used my Chromebook to Facebook, play Candy Crush, email, pay bills, watch Netflix, upload a sale to Craigslist, ebay, shop online, watch youtube videos, and surf the net. My six year old has used my new Chromebook a few times with no issues. She can find "her" websites (American Girl, PBS Kids, Nick Jr, Disney) without a single problem. My daughter has never used a laptop. She immediately taught herself to use the track pad. The battery life of the Chromebook is awesome and it charges faster than any device that I have. The track pad is simple to use. Two finger touch/press and your have your "right click" function to save, cut, copy, paste, spell check and more. I have no problem with the Chrome OS. I never used it until I received this Chromebook and it isn't hard to get used to using.

Reviews.Title: Keyboard Problems
Reviews.Author: Ziv N.
Reviews.Content: Multiple times in the past week (since I received my chromebook) I have had problems with the keyboard. Sometimes, when I boot the computer, the keys will work incorrectly. Some will not output letters, and others output multiple letters--not randomly, but rather a set combo of letters for each of the malfunctioning keys--and when this does happen I cannot login, due to errors in the typed password that I'm trying to input. So far, each time I have been able to use the track pad, and I have been able to reboot the machine. Each time, this has resolved the issue, but I'm still concerned, and a little annoyed.I've been in contact with Acer and they are paying to have it sent to a repair facility. I love the idea of the chromebook, and since I work on a desktop at home, I really could use an inexpensive laptop (with a real keyboard) for taking to school.If it doesn't work like a charm after the repair I'm sending it straight back to Amazon

Reviews.Title: Fast, but Some Limitations
Reviews.Author: Richard James Haney
Reviews.Content: So far, I like my Chromebook a lot, but there are some limitations.On the plus side, it boots from totally cold and off to fully ready, with Chrome browser open, in less than 8 seconds, as advertised. It syncs automatically with my Android phone. I was already a Chrome user on my Windows laptop (much faster and cleaner than IE), so that was no problem. Since I primarily use my Chromebook for email and web-surfing--both of which it does extremely well--I can accomplish most of what I want to do with my Acer resting (lightly) in my lap. And there are lots of free Chromebook apps available to do things such as play games, check the weather, etc.However...there are limitations, some of which I expected, but not all. For example, you can use Google Docs to produce, open, and work on Office documents, but you don't get the full functionality of Office, such as being able to to password-protect a document, or open a Word document that you previously protected with a password. This should not be a big surprise, since a web-based productivity application will probably never be as fully developed as a full-up suite of applications, though Google indicates they're working on the ability to open a password-protected document. Also, the web-based games (I'm somewhat addicted to Spider Solitaire as a mindless activity that frees me to think about stuff I need to do) just don't work as well or the same way, sadly.More surprisingly, I am unable to print easily (with Google Cloud Print) to my home network printer, a Brother MFC 490CW. The problem is that it is considered a "classic" printer, even though it's on my WiFi network, rather than a Cloud Ready printer. That means that in order to install the printer  so that the Chromebook can access it through the Cloud Print server, you have to open up Chrome on a Windows or Mac computer--not the Chromebook!--that is already connected to the printer. Again, no big problem for me, since I already run Chrome on my Windows 7 laptop. BUT...you can only then print from the Chromebook when the other computer (in my case the Windows 7 laptop) is on and online. Apparently the Chromebook sends the print command and data to the Cloud server, which then sends it to the other computer on the printer network, which then send it to the printer. That's a major irritation, since I don't want to keep the other laptop booted up all the time. BTW, you can check the list of available Cloud Ready printers at [...]Also, although it's not that easy to set up, installing the Chrome Remote Access App on your Chromebook AND your other Windows or Mac laptop really does allow you to access and use files and software on your laptop from your Chromebook. Be sure to select "Open Maximized" (right click on the Chrome Remote icon in your apps) to be able to use your full Chromebook screen. Of course, that also means leaving your other laptop powered up.Overall, very fast, inexpensive, and well-designed, but you need to understand what you're getting.

Reviews.Title: The future is here.
Reviews.Author: Cimmay
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the Chromebook, it does everything I need during leisure time. It runs Netflix and YouTube perfectly, and also live video chat at sites using Flash. I believe the future is web based application and the Chrome Store has a ton of free programs. The Chrome Operating system is amazing, completely worry free and high performance. It's the third Chromebook I've owned, having given two of them away to friends overseas. BTW, the processor is optimized for ChromeOS, it works really good, like a high end machine.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Jackie
Reviews.Content: The response speed is fantastic and it is a terrific size which will be great for taking on overseas holidays

Reviews.Title: Love this buy
Reviews.Author: Nick H.
Reviews.Content: I needed a bargain laptop for studying for the CPA exam and this accomplishes it perfectly. It has everything one needs without breaking the bank. The battery life is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Victor leon
Reviews.Content: I have used this machine for 2 weeks it is fast ,practical and reliable, I think it is a perfect solution for travel and mobility. Chrome os have a lot of programs to work dailyI think we need this kind of laptop as second device, because we just use our laptop to stay connected and manage office softwareIs better than a table

Reviews.Title: My mom loves it
Reviews.Author: Jiri
Reviews.Content: It's a very simple machine which is suitable for 99% of the daily tasks. Excellent choice for my mom and probably for my wife in the future.

Reviews.Title: Great, I love it!
Reviews.Author: Oldmutt
Reviews.Content: I bought the Chromebook because i didn't want to pay some ridiculous amount just to upgrade my XP on my 2007 Lenovo which still works great. I use the Chromebook to have greater security signing into my financial accounts but still use the Lenovo for surfing the web, watching utube and such. When I go on vacation next week I will be taking the Chromebook and see how well it works across the country.The only thing is that the Lenovo is built like a tank while the Chromebook is very light and feels a bit fragile so I bought the protective cover.

Reviews.Title: Made a great gift
Reviews.Author: MySnow
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a Christmas gift for my parents, who are both in their eighties. My mother was comfortable on a computer but my father rarely tried to use their desktop computer. This little Chromebook changed all that. Setup was incredibly easy. After a couple "training" sessions where we taught my father the basics, he was up and running. This is so much more convenient for them to use than their desktop for surfing the web. They also use it for email. The price was great at $199. That's a bargain in exchange for connecting someone to the world.

Reviews.Title: Acer C720
Reviews.Author: blpat
Reviews.Content: The Acer C720 has been a wonderful chromebook. It does everything you would want it a portable, convenient and easy to use small computer. I use it everyday for email, research, browsing, and would encourage anyone considering a chromebook to DO IT!!!

Reviews.Title: Skype works!!!!...if you put UBUNTU on it
Reviews.Author: iskor12
Reviews.Content: So far, I'm very impressed with this computer.  For $200, it's really hard to complain.  It's fast, it's snappy, and it gets the job done.Pros:1.) Chrome OS is simplistic and fast.2.) Great Battery Life3.) Strong Wifi Signal (Both 2.4ghz and 5ghz)4.) Can do just about anything on it...(Especially after installing Ubuntu)5.) Keyboard works well with my fat fingersCONS:1.) Google  (Not a big deal, but it is to some people)2.) Chrome OS is very limited3.) Screen could be better and brighterAs I stated in my title, you can get Skype up and running on it with in about 45 minutes of receiving your chromebook.  Do some research on Crouton.  It will allow you to run Ubuntu simultaneously with Chrome OS, which greatly improves what you can do with this machine online and offline.  Once you have Ubuntu running, you can install Skype...and it does work!  In fact, I haven't found anything that doesn't quite work with it yet....Well, I guess Microsoft office, but there are programs out there that are practically the same...for instance, Openoffice.Need proof on Skype, just leave a comment.  Questions, feel free to ask.

Reviews.Title: Great Portable for Students
Reviews.Author: John-Paul Terranova
Reviews.Content: Going back to college for paramedicine, I needed something to take with me to the hospital, the fire department, in and out of the ambulance, etc. I wanted something to type up run reports and process scheduling. Everything I do for class is done online, so I figured a tablet or a chromebook would be a good solution.For those of you wondering what this machine can and CANT do, just try this. On your computer, ONLY use the Chrome web browser. If you need to type up a document, use Google Docs. Just find the online alternatives for what you use a normal desktop.The Pro's of this machine are:1. Insanely fast boot up/shut down time (seconds, beats my 2012 Macbook Air)2. Battery life lasts for hours, and can standby for days.3. Lightweight and portable, yet still durable4. It's completely silent5. COST - Being that I could lose or damage the device, being sub-200 bucks is amazing.This machine has been running with me as my daily go to portable machine for about 6 months now, and never ceases to impress. I can watch Netflix in HD, and have multiple tabs open and this thing with only 2gb of RAM just hums along just as fast as my core i7 desktop.I wouldn't cease to recommend this Chromebook to anyone looking for a cheap portable.DO NOT COMPARE THIS TO A FULL OPERATING SYSTEM (OSX, WINDOWS).If you want a portable web browser, thats fast, light, full keyboard, functional, and CHEAP, this is the machine to buy!

Reviews.Title: Great battery life, smooth scrolling, fast on/off
Reviews.Author: Kal
Reviews.Content: After six months, I like my Chromebook even more than when I first bought it.  I'm getting 7-8 hours of battery life on a charge, and the system remains very fast.  Scrolling is excellent -- on a par with a MacBook Air.  The form factor is good -- very light, yet solid.  The screen could be brighter, but it's bright enough that I can use it outdoors without any trouble.  It will sit in standby for a week or two before dropping below 20%.My only knock against it is that you have to log back into your Google account after every shut down. (At least I haven't found a way around this.)  That's annoying for those of us who use long, random, secure passwords.

Reviews.Title: Just a simple, cheap laptop
Reviews.Author: Matthew
Reviews.Content: What else to you need? A laptop with just one thing: chrome. And god, does it work well. Like, really well. If you're a student, this is the device for you

Reviews.Title: Very good laptop
Reviews.Author: rsr72
Reviews.Content: Would buy again.  Very nice, quality feel.  Thin but solid.  Performs well, boots fast.  Sure, it's different.  Google is taking over.  They will be the next "Microsoft" or already are, but we benefit for now until someone knocks them off.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: Harpreet Dhaliwal
Reviews.Content: Excellent product for excellent price.  Planning to buy one more. Fast but battery life is short. I recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Ordered 2
Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: I LOVE the Acer Chromebook. My boyfriend bought one and after seeing how great his was I ordered one for myself. They are fast, efficient and easy to use. Do not believe the claims that they are useless without internet you just have to download the right programs. I use mine for everything. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!
Reviews.Author: Amy B.
Reviews.Content: Perfect size and it does everything I need it to.  Shipped great and packaging was excellent.  Have had it for a few weeks now with no issues at all.  Very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Excellent mini laptop
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Propst
Reviews.Content: Does everything I need, nice to have a keyboard not a touch screen. Very fast and easy to use. Light, holds a charge a long time. Easy accurate touch pad.

Reviews.Title: Its great
Reviews.Author: pedro
Reviews.Content: I never realized how limited my use of computers was until I got the chromebook.But this may very well be the only computer I use from now on.It has google docs, internet and a webcam.And if I run out of space I can just use google drive.I don't even need to download videos or music, since I get it streamed online anyways.And all for the low price of 199.Also, no viruses.I was hesitant at first because the acer netbooks I got in the past were of low quality,but it seems that acer has stepped up its game.

Reviews.Title: Fast, basic computing
Reviews.Author: gesiferd
Reviews.Content: I purchased this laptop with the intention that it be a compact, low-maintenance option for mobile computing when a keyboard is needed.  It has more than met my expectations.  The screen is adequate, the keyboard reasonably comfortable and the operation trouble-free.  The keyboard half of the clamshell is slightly convex and the space bar deposits a light, easily-removed mark on the screen if I carry the laptop in a backpack and it's compressed a bit while traveling.  I'll be getting a small microfiber cloth to cover the keyboard when the laptop's closed, which should remedy that issue.  If you go in with your eyes open, realizing that there will be some applications that you can't run on Chrome OS and being willing to find substitutes, I believe you'll be pleased with this machine.  The price is great, especially as a refurb!

Reviews.Title: No, you are not stuck with the ChromeOS!!
Reviews.Author: carl801 "Old soldier"
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for years for a thin, light laptop computer that does not have Windows on it.  I object to paying the Gates tax only to immediately trash Windows and load Ubuntu.  This, finally, is that machine.  It took me all of an hour to find, download, and install Ubuntu 14.04 , which worked flawlessly out of the box.  Wireless, touchpad, networking, power management, the lot just work.  I currently have it set up to dual boot with ChromeOS, but I was so disappointed with the limitations of that operating system that I can't foresee using it again.  The machine is zippy and I feel no need for more than the 2GB of on-board memory.  However, now that I have a real operating system on it, 16GB is not nearly enough room, so I've ordered the MyDigitalSSD M.2 NGFF M2 64 GB SSD.So now I have what I wanted: a thin, light, capable laptop running my OS of choice, and I didn't have to pay for Windows in order to do it.  My thanks to Acer for building the machine, to Google for making open source ChromeOS free, and to Ubuntu and Canonical for making their OS so much better than Windows.

Reviews.Title: YES
Reviews.Author: Waleed Khan
Reviews.Content: Yes, yes, yes. $200 well spent, no regrets. This basically fits all my needs. When I announced I had bought a chromebook a few of my friends were disgusted. One said that "all it does is run the internet" and another said "they break in no time". To the second guy, I'm assuming he was talking about earlier chromebooks which I heard broke very easily. Everything I heard about this one before buying it said that it was much sturdier and did not break easily. To the first guy, I said well, that's all I really need.I really needed a new laptop and as a high school student my priority was speed, lightweight, thinness, efficiency, and for it to look nice. So I started looking into chromebooks and decided that this pretty much met those needs. I'm not really a hardcore gamer, and if I really need to play computer games there's always other laptops in my home to use. I love google chrome and chrome applications for their simplicity and ease. This gave me all that without other distractions. No need to worry about antivirus, no constant update reminders, no snail-pace start up, no overheating. Just so convenient. Obviously there are drawbacks of not being able to do all that you might be able to do with a traditional laptop but I'm willing to look past that. With my high school/artist's budget I don't really expect to make much and so don't really expect to be getting some high tech piece of machinery that works to perfection.The only problem I personally face is that my WiFi connection can be pretty s***ty, but that's not the chromebook's fault. Really, if my WiFi was out while I was on my old laptop I would pretty much have nothing to do except wait for it to come back. So why waste 300 extra bucks on something over priced and over large that I won't even use when I could have this for a much better price? Another thing I had to get accustomed to was the small size. I was expecting something a bit larger and I felt a little disappointed initially when I saw it, but I got over it pretty fast. Now when I use my old laptop or another "regular" laptop, it feels ridiculously large and awkward. This computer takes everything I need and gets rid of everything unnecessary and makes my life so much simpler. DEFINITELY recommend it to anyone who's primary concern with a laptop is the internet. 5/5 for me, thank you so much Google.

Reviews.Title: Good for what you pay
Reviews.Author: dclark
Reviews.Content: I bought this little device with the full intention of installing and primarily using linux. After some frustrating experiences with the trackpad (and as I was going out of town for a week) I decided to revert to Chrome OS just to have something to browse the web with during my trip. For doing just that, the machine is great, and works nearly flawlessly. Long battery life, quick and responsive, and quiet and cool. However, those benefits are also its drawbacks. If you plan to do any serious work, life gets difficult quickly. It's simply not made for those purposes. I eventually fixed all the issues I had with my linux installation, but still use Chrome sometimes. With linux the machine is great, and works just as a small laptop would.Chrome OS is the real limitation here, but for what many internet users do, I think this device is more than capable of meeting expectations. I would feel comfortable giving this to my mother, or a younger person as their own computer, knowing that they cannot really mess it up, nor would they be confused by the device (navigation is much more logical than say, Windows 8). Unless you fall into one of the previous categories, and even then it is unlikely, I would not recommend this as a main computer. As a portable device, that is less annoying to use for surfing the web than a smart phone, it does well.The main reason for docking a star is the build quality. Though the machine is thin and light, Mostly plastic casing makes the computer feel more like a toy than nicer laptops. In addition, the screen has poor viewing angles and the color is lackluster. Trackpad is small and lacks well defined button areas, sort of an attempt to recreate the apple trackpad gone wrong. I find myself tapping by not pressing down, but tapping on the trackpad, which I've never done until now. Due to the smallness of the laptop as a whole, the keyboard is not the standard size and lacks some of the more conventional keys (such as the delete key, which is more frustrating than you'd think). Overall, it was only $229, which makes up for many of the drawbacks. Someone who is looking for a very portable mobile web browsing unit, or someone who is a bit (just a bit, it's really not that hard) more savvy who is willing to install linux, would benefit greatly from this device. It's reasonably priced and does what is advertised, I'm satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Exceeded my expectations.....
Reviews.Author: Hugh D. Hudgens
Reviews.Content: The Acer 720 arrived in a couple of days. It was neat and clean. Start up was almost instant. It took me a few minutes to navigate my way around. A few days to get things how I like them. Since then everything has been wonderful. This machine is super fast and light weight. From dead battery to full charge is only 60 to 90 minutes. I would recommend this laptop to anyone as a second machine and a first machine to many. Do a little research. Make sure to get the Celeron processor. It flies. Enjoy surfing.

Reviews.Title: I love my Acer Chromebook!
Reviews.Author: Toni L.
Reviews.Content: This notebook is easy to use and very light. The speakers are great! I love the simplicity. The battery last for a very long time on a full charge.

Reviews.Title: Nice, inexpensive laptop for Linux
Reviews.Author: Phil Lembo
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, inexpensive piece of hardware. I got one used from an Amazon vendor.After running ChomeOS on it for over a month finally installed Fedora Linux 20 with the stock Gnome desktop. Although my model (C720-2802) only has 2G (of non-upgradable) RAM, Fedora with Gnome 3 fits nicely. Did upgrade the shipping 16G SSD to 64G using a part from another Amazon vendor. That leaves plenty of room for installing additional apps and almost 20G of space for files. Now I can use my Chromebook to makes calls over Skype! But seriously, if you're comfortable experimenting with computer hardware and not afraid of open source you're going to love this model. There are tons of blog posts and technical wiki articles on the Internet explaining how to turn this into a really useful machine.

Reviews.Title: This laptop serves your basic needs
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: This laptop is basically a glorified tablet BUT you get more bang for your buck.The ChromeBook OS is so simple that Honey Boo Boo can operate it with her eyes closed and her mouth full of Faygo. The App store has a whole array of apps for you to do basic functions as you would with any laptop. You wanna type up something? WE GOT AN APP FOR THAT. You wanna make slides? WE GOT AN APP FOR THAT. No, you cannot install software of any sort but with all the app options, why would you? Unless you're a hardcore Skype-r or whatever you kids do to make yourselves feel important, the software is great.The screen is as bright as Stephen Hawking but consumes power like an Ethiopian. Great resolution AND 8.5 hours of battery life?! Stop the madness. I did notice a tad of overheating when I lay the base of the laptop on a flat surface as I was doing some work, but you shouldn't do that anyways and if you blame the manufacturer for that design flaw, then I suggest you don't procreate.All I needed was a laptop to do school work on and watch Netflix. For 200 bucks, you cant go wrong. This little thing is fast, concise, and all around easy to use. I recommend this laptop to anyone who needs to type up things in a Starbucks while wearing his dumb glasses with hard part hair, record a naked greeting for your grandmother on her 87 birthday, or even do a power point presentation on how much you hate power point presentations. THIS LAPTOP IS FOR YOOOOU.

Reviews.Title: Awesome says it all!
Reviews.Author: Kevin Fortier
Reviews.Content: I got this computer as our 3rd Windows based computer was crashing in the last 2 years and I didn't want to have to spend a lot of money to try something new.  My wife and kids (teenagers) use this for school work, surfing, playing games and collaborating with friends.  Very easy to use and quick to start up and operate.  There is nothing that we can't do on this computer that we could on the other.  Very happy with this purchase and it won't be the last!

Reviews.Title: Best decision I have made in a long time !
Reviews.Author: Toni Stisser
Reviews.Content: I first purchased Windows 8 ... took it to the hotel room....No problem getting it started. 20 minutes later....shut it down, returned itthe next day.My Son had purchased HP Chromebook. He loved his, so we talked and I decided to purchase the Chromebook also.I absolutely love it. It's simple, it's fast, and it's everything I could ever want. I am 62, so less is more !I would highly recommend Chromebook to anyone who likes life simple. I love being able to get the apps according to what I want. There isn't a bunch of junk I will never use, clogging up my laptop.

Reviews.Title: Product choice incentives
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: I chose the Acer C720 for its direct Key access--the buttons have a very ergonomically consistent keystroke feel, and besides being portable and compact, it all the same allows for a very broad view of various video presentations.  I also like the fact that their is a synchronized direct key access on the numeric keys on certain web-based calculators, which can alternate with the "point and click" option as well.  The memory and storage capacity were also significant concerns, not to sound like a savvy computer Geek about upgradeability and all, but I think it's an excellent value for the investment.  I also like the sturdy, substantial weight for durability and yet light weight and convenient enough for mobility in the most discreet manner of its class.

Reviews.Title: Love it for writing!
Reviews.Author: Kauai Jen
Reviews.Content: I love love love this little machine. I spent weeks flipping back between, iPads, Kindles, etc, etc and this is IT. I am so happy I purchased this chromebook.  It meets all of my writing needs.  It is super light, I can take it anywhere, I can write with it in bed...wherever.  Battery life is great and it is SO EASY to use.  I will never buy a 'regular' laptop again.

Reviews.Title: Lightweight, easy to use laptop
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: As a successor to the netbook, this is a great laptop for the thing most people do 95% of the time, email and browsing. It starts up in about 4 seconds, has immediate wifi connectivity, gives immediate access to your Google resources such as Gmail, Google drive, Photos, etc. I've been using this unit for about two weeks to see what issues I would run into. The one thing that seems to be problematic is that although the unit has a hard drive, in this model, the OS doesn't allow easy access to stuff on the hard drive like you expect on a Windows device. You have to change the way you manage files because Google intended for things to be stored in the Cloud, Google Drive. Printing has to be done through a cloud printing arrangement such as Google Cloud Print or HP ePrint.All around, I'm satisfied with my purchase. Don't expect it to replace your Windows machine unless you plan on retraining how you do things.

Reviews.Title: One of my Favorite Things
Reviews.Author: Candy Boofer
Reviews.Content: I love this Chromebook!Pros:Size and weight: I thought the 11.6 inch screen size was going to be a little small, but it's actually quite nice. I even find it comfortable for watching Netflix and Hulu+ and the like. Plus, it only weighs like two and a half pounds so it's really comfortable to use anywhere, even in bed.Nearly silent operation: You can barely hear the fans on this thing when the room is quiet. Much more pleasant than my old laptop which would rev up like a jet engine as soon as you hit the power button.Stays cool: Even when I set it on top of my blankets in bed, it doesn't get warm at all. The fans ventilate very well. It helps that this is a low power device I'm sure.Comfortable keyboard and trackpad: I was surprised how comfortable the keyboard is on this. I thought I was going to have to learn to adjust to a smaller keyboard, but the keys are sized and spaced well that anyone would feel comfortable typing on it. And the track pad is nice and large as well. The touchpad is also great. Very functional and responsive. I like that the whole pad clicks.ChromeOS: I'd never used ChromeOS before now, but I think I really like it now. It's perfect for casual computing. Lightweight and fast. Chrome is already my preferred web browser on the rest of my devices, so I couldn't go wrong.Surprisingly versatile: When I bought this I figured I would be using it for online shopping and browsing the web and not much else. Now I find I use it to manage documents and spreadsheets through the browser based versions of Word and Excel, manage files on my Google Drive, use AirDroid to manage my phone, and even use Chrome Remote Desktop to control my desktop.Cons:There's not much I don't like here. I don't like that the power button is kind of incorporated into the keyboard. I haven't accidently pressed it yet, but I'm nervous I might. Also, I wish they would've put a caps lock key instead of the search key. I never use the search key and would much prefer to have a caps lock key. Also, I don't know for sure but I don't think the device ever completely powers down. When I try to clean it, it always comes back on whenever I touch the track pad or sometimes (I think) other keys. A little annoying for cleaning.Conlcusion:This was one of the best purchases I've made in a while. I use this all the time and it's definitely a great value for the price. And I was lucky to be able to get mine refurbished for $150. Buy this. You're going to love this thing.

Reviews.Title: Can't Go Wrong
Reviews.Author: Eloise E. Genest
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with this item if you're looking for a simple computer to get you online and do the basics. You need WiFi to connect to the internet, and then you're good to go.  I search, email, stream Netflix and use Google Docs for word processing.  You can't load conventional Windows software but there are many Aps, and Google Docs recognizes Microsoft Word documents.The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because I can't stream MSNBC shows - and can't get a reason why not.  Their commercials stream fine though.I continue to run expensive graphic design software offline with my good 'ol XP desktop without having to get Windows 8.  (Microsoft just stopped supporting XP which is why I took it offline).  It didn't take long to get used to this Chromebook, and I'm wondering why I would want another real computer until my desktop totally bites the dust.  This is a perfect machine for now - and maybe longer.

Reviews.Title: Love this little fella!
Reviews.Author: Tina O'Brien
Reviews.Content: I am moving to New Zealand in a month and have been diligently moving my files to my Google cloud so I figured I'd give a Chromebook a try so I didn't have to lug my tower and monitor across the globe.  Score!  Just a few "wishes", but no deal breakers - I could't be happier!Wishes- page up/page down, home and backspace keys  (there are loads of new shortcuts to learn, so I suspect it's in there - just feel a bit naked without dediated keys)- Still getting used to the keyboard feel - I'm not getting that tactile sensation and am constantly have to go back and add missing letters.LOVES-  lightweight and instant bootup- variety of useful, fun, and apps I didn't know I need.  Has apps that work just like MS Office apps so I could even work from this little hunk of aweseome- sound and video are great!- just adore Google cloud and being able to access the exact same content and settings no matter what device I'm using.The only thing I'll need to do when I land in NZ is get a new plug in adapter and viola - it's all there!

Reviews.Title: Nice Machine
Reviews.Author: jimmac
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd C720.  My son likes the first one so much he "borrowed" it on what looks to be a permanent loan.  My wife and I missed the portability (our other PC is a desktop).  I use this especially for music streaming and looking up DIY info while working on projects around the house.  Very convenient.  Boots quick, runs a long time, does everything I need and expect.  A very good deal.

Reviews.Title: cheap n good .. better than netbooks
Reviews.Author: CHAN S.
Reviews.Content: good just that the trackpad does not support right click.. only can rely on 2 finger clickgood for web surfing

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Chuck Harold
Reviews.Content: For the price, this computer is awesome! Very portable, good battery life, works just as expected. Highly recommended, especially if all you do is online!

Reviews.Title: Excellent value, good performance
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: 15 or 20 years ago, my parents' employers decided to deploy thin clients throughout their school district.  I was appalled.  Networks being what they were, I shuddered to think of the lag they'd experience when all the teachers tried to access their accounts simultaneously, and how everything would come to a screeching halt the moment the district servers went down.My, how recent developments have changed my opinion.This was purchased to replace a poorly aging Windows XP laptop which my kids used for schoolwork.  It's fantastic.  I've always been wary of anything that won't let me save anything I want locally, but the development and steady improvement of cloud services has done a lot to alleviate that concern and the kids, who've grown up with mobile devices that have limited storage space, have no qualms with apps that both reside and save their data to Google drive.  It's not a desktop replacement, it's not a home entertainment/gaming system, and it won't allow you to hack into  WOPR to play a game of global thermonuclear war, but it'll let you write a report, email it to your mom to be proofread, video chat with said mom to go over the finer nuances of grammar, print it to a networked printer, save it to Google Drive, email it to your teacher, and then settle in for some well-deserved time on Club Penguin.

Reviews.Title: Just WOW!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Last week I bought a refurb unit direct from Acer ($150) and the unit arrived today. I bought this for my dad since he's a senior and the old Windows Vista is getting to be a real pain for him to work with. I originally purchased a Samsung Chromebook (when it was first introduced) for him but found out the printing mechanism wasn't quite there. So I've been using this Acer Chromebook tonight and it's simply a joy to use!My setup with the unit is paired with my Google CloudPrint enabled printer, Epson WorkForce 845. Set up was easy enough. Since this unit is for my dad, I'm going to get him a low-end Epson Expression XP-410. It's only $69 on Amazon and it's a steal! One thing my dad does with his current printer is using it to scan documents and feed directly to his email. I don't think the Epson does it automatically but as a workaround, he could scan the doc onto a SD card or thumb drive, then un-mount it and stick it in the Chromebook. Not as direct but the process is quite straight forward. It shouldn't be a problem for him, albeit he's 83. :-) Go dad!!I also tested the VPN connection and it works flawlessly. I have a VPN service so I could watch BBC programs via the iPlayer. Previously I've been using my Nexus 7 and hooking that up to my TV via a SlimPort connection. It's a bit of a pain but using the Chromebook, the process is much more reliable. Bluetooth works as expected. I'm very happy with how far Chromebook has come, therefore I'll be getting my own unit next week! I was planning on getting the 32GB unit but decided not to since I ordered a 64GB SSD replacement. It's only $50+ and I think it's worth it. Was thinking about the 128GB but since I'll be utilizing Google Drive (with a free 100GB for 2 years); I think 64GB is plenty; at least for now.What needs to improve? Not so much the hardware but I wish the OS has the ability to save web pages on the Shelf, or in a folder or some sort. There's a workaround on doing that but the process isn't as simple. Certain keys are missing from a traditional keyboard standpoint, but I'll adjust. If you miss your Function Keys, there's a way that you can set up your keyboard to toggle them back. It feels a bit 'odd' not being able to save anything on the 'desktop'. It's different and I think I'm going to like it, a lot!Thanks for reading.UPDATE: I just read about where the Epson Connect website has an option where you could scan directly to your Google Drive. Su-weeet!

Reviews.Title: One of the best chromebooks that happens to also be the cheapest one
Reviews.Author: J. Limandri
Reviews.Content: This is is one of the best chromebooks and I have used almost all of them.  The Dell chromebook 11 and the Toshiba 13.3 may be slightly better, but its close.  But if you only have $200 to spend on a laptop I would just get the c720 now.

Reviews.Title: Does what I expected
Reviews.Author: Travis Carter
Reviews.Content: As long as you know it's Google Apps only you'll like it. I thought it would be too small but it's not bad. Can't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: Nice little machine
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Insco
Reviews.Content: This does exactly what I need it to do for under half the price of a traditional laptop. The only reasons I don't rate this as 5 stars is the touchpad and I thought I was getting an ssd card but I did not receive one with my order. In all fairness though how many touchpads are good? This is why God created the cute furry rodent called a mouse.

Reviews.Title: Easy and light
Reviews.Author: Franky
Reviews.Content: This is the best travel computer that I have owned; it does everything I need and the price cannot  be beat.

Reviews.Title: Great travel machine, excellent battery life
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I'm typing this review on my chromebook.  I love it.  It's featherlight (well not really but it's very light), it's compact and it's fast.  I was worried about keyboard size as I'm a pretty big guy (6'3") and have big hands but it feels just fine to me.  Best things about it are the boot up time (it really is about 7 seconds, 3 if it's just waking up from sleep) and the battery life which can stretch all day if I'm only using it for 30 minutes at a time here and there.  I think I last charged this last night and 24 hours later, I still have 60% left since I only used it twice this morning.It's not a full laptop so if you get it to do productivity things (spreadsheets and documents) you probably won't like it.  But if you want something to travel with that will do everything you need without leaving a huge dent in your wallet if something happens to it, this is the machine.  Really happy with the purchase, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Perfect alternative to a tablet with a keyboard
Reviews.Author: Kim Haman
Reviews.Content: He loves it.  It is lightweight, does what it says it does.  If you need a computer for just browsing the web (as he does) it does the job.  Is super fast, lightweight, works great.  We couldn't be happier with this purchase, it's his current favorite toy ;)

Reviews.Title: Impressive piece
Reviews.Author: Mhoward8
Reviews.Content: This is a surprisingly impressive unit based on the price. The specs are obviously not going to be up there with the specialized models and their 3rdand RAM are great for light, office work.The performance is also smooth despite its disadvantage in hardware and the picture quality is adequate, considering. The best feature though is the Chrome OS, which uses up very little memory despite dishing out considerable power. For a cheap laptop, you’re getting a lot of value.gen I series processors, but the battery life, memory

Reviews.Title: nice chome book
Reviews.Author: On-Awa S.
Reviews.Content: I really like this chrome book well belt good charger best price.  If your looking for a smaller laptop in this price range it's a good buy it seems to be a little better brand than other's

Reviews.Title: Great item!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Runs wonderfully.  Battery life is amazing.  Keyboard and touchpad are acceptable (for the price they are pretty good).  Installed linux via crouton, and now it runs everything I could ever want --- including skype,  and microsoft office (under wine).  Awesome machine.

Reviews.Title: Better than Windows laptops
Reviews.Author: fai
Reviews.Content: Excellent fast boot-up, very smooth operation (similar to macbook air), good battery time, well outlook and keyboard and build-up, extremely low price, good for elderly and kids, excellent alternative to windows 8 OS. No regret.

Reviews.Title: Acer Chromebook
Reviews.Author: catherine "cl"
Reviews.Content: This is such a great computer, and for the price, it is amazing. It is extremely fast and light. It serves my purpose beautifully.Keyboard is fine. I knew there was no DVD or CD player in the machine which was not a negative for me.Overall,love it!

Reviews.Title: Great Chromebook
Reviews.Author: Eric von Spreckelsen
Reviews.Content: Already have the HP Chromebook 11.  Had some problems with the charger and battery life, but liked that Chromebook enough to order another, as my family steals my HP more often than not.The C720 is much better.  Battery life is outstanding.  Even charging takes less time.  Battery life lasts 3 times longer than the HP Chromebook 11 too, plus it has more ports, including an HDMI so I can use it at work for presentations.  Great product.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic for the price.
Reviews.Author: Matthew J Carling
Reviews.Content: I've been using this for a little while now and it performance is excellent for my use.Pros====As a browser (obviously) it's very quick and chromecasting youtube has been faultless so far.Having used netbooks in the past, this 11" seems the best compromise between portability and screen size in a standard ratio.Dual monitor mode via HDMI supports both extended desktop (each screen at their own native res) and mirroringNot really a pro for Acer but some of the chrome apps are pretty handy such as remote desktop and ssh clients which improve it's versatility for those who sometimes need to use windows, osx, etcCons====- The keyboard is slightly on the cheap and cheerful side. It operates fine and I have had no problems - it just reflects its budget.- No native support for all video codecs - a specific use case for me in to copy video from my contour cameras to a usb drive while holidaying. No problems with the usb to usb copy but chromeos does not have support for native contour mp4 files to do local playback. A nice to have but not a deal killer. On the plus side, uploading gps files to Strava etc works fine - just manually upload the file off the Garmin flash.Other====For any Aussies, the AC power cable unplugs from the power pack - just swap the US end for an Aussie one. It's a standard clover leaf laptop cable.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Micha gutwilik
Reviews.Content: I love my chromebook. This newer version doesn't have nearly as many pauses and shutdowns as my last one. I just wish the google  doc/spreadsheet/slide apps were more similar to microsoft versions.

Reviews.Title: Just what I needed
Reviews.Author: Kathy Pierce
Reviews.Content: It didn't cost much, but I don't need much.  Just right for what I use it for...e-mail, shopping, streaming, surfing.

Reviews.Title: Acer Chromebook c720
Reviews.Author: ABC721
Reviews.Content: I just received my new Chromebook.  So far, it is great!  Very easy to set up and get going...no issues with initial connection to our wireless network.  Easy to set up my online banking and bill pay accounts.  I think for what it is (primarily a browsing device) it is a zippy little machine :0)

Reviews.Title: Great on many levels but be aware of what you can't - yet - do
Reviews.Author: A G SMITH
Reviews.Content: For a good value lightweight, attractive laptop with superfast boot-up and a fab battery, it is really good.  As I live in Cyprus however, the Google play music/movie apps aren't 'yet' available, and I used to have a UK ip address to watch UK tv.  This is no longer possible and I am scouring the internet for a possible solution.  I realise that the whole point of the 'op speed' is that there is nothing downloaded or stored on the Chromebook.
