Reviews.Content: Just purchased the 2gb model. I primarily have a desktop that I use for everything, but needed a portable device to work on programming. I was going to dual boot ubuntu, but I didn't want to have to set up my environment again. Its still a possibility, but using nitrous.io there's really no need to at this point. I was a little sceptical about the 2gb model, but I've had no problem multitasking on it, even while using a secondary monitor. Speaking of, this has been the easiest OS I've come across setting up dual monitors. All you have to do is plug it in and it auto detects and expands the display.  $200 is a steal for this.

Reviews.Title: Good price, good device, linux makes it even better!
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: ###################Here's what I like:###################  * Price - A very good price, makes a good computer actually affordable to almost anyone.  * Design - The shape of this device is like any other conventional device on the market, which is good.  * Color - I like the grey and black matchup alot.  * Weight - This device is very lightweight and I can hold it with just 1 hand, which helps alot when I need  to move it somewhere or charge it while holding something.  * Keyboard - It has a good travel distance to type on, so you can touch type on it well.  * Trackpad - It has a good size and its responsive.  *Note* - You can adjust the sensitivity of the trackpad buttons by unscrew/screw on  the center rear of the laptop.  * Battery - It lasts around ~6 hours doing intensive tasks (streaming, gaming, compiling).  Around 8 hours doing less intensive tasks. (Office tasks, listening to music, etc).  *Note* - Disabling bluetooth, wireless when not needed, unplugging USB devices  and lowering screen brightness helps too.  *Boot - It boots fast (~7 seconds).######################################Here's what I think could be improved:######################################  * CromeOS - It's fast, simple, low resource, "customizable" though apps, automatically updates, it just works, so  what not to like?  It's bound to its google ecosystem, not very touch friendly yet, the apps are not as  complete as the alternatives yet, the offline functionality is limited, devices  recognition is limited too (USB printers mostly, you can set wifi printers though).  Though updates are frequent and the system improves each day.  *Note* - See the "Aside" section at the very bottom if you want to install a  different operating system on it.  * Microphone - It works but sometimes is hard to hear, the sound could be louder.  * Fingerprints - You'll see some around the computer because of the gloss finish.  * Graphics card/GPU - Sometimes videos and Skype skip frames, more noticeable when  using HDMI output.  For the price can't complain much tough.  * Ram - I wish the ram was at least 4GB or at least not soldered.#######Overall#######A very good deal, if your looking for a new basic computer or a replacement to your old one look no further.#####Aside#####  I installed Fedora GNU/Linux on the chromebook.  I have access to libreoffice, GIMP, Inkscape, git, USB printer is recognizable,  can work offline very well, skype works, etc.  If you want to do it too, I'll leave some hints here  (search with your favorite search engine):  *ATTENTION* - This can void your warranty, do at your own risk!  # Make a backup of your ChromeOS(Important to fallback in case something goes wrong!)  - Search "google Recover your Chromebook"  # Chromium developer mode info.  - Search "chromium Developer Information for Chrome OS Devices" and select  the model (acer c720 in this case).  # Upstream coreboot  - Search "chromium Upstream coreboot on Intel Haswell Chromebook".  # Arch linux acer c720 information very useful.  - Search "archlinux wiki Acer C720 Chromebook".  # Cnet info on how to multi-boot ChomeOS with Ubuntu (The most simple method).  - Search "cnet How to run both Chrome OS and Ubuntu on a Chromebook"  # Installing Fedora 20  - Search "forum Fedora 20 sur l'Acer C720P"

Reviews.Title: Even this 65 year old guy can figure out how to work this computer!
Reviews.Author: Rod Hays
Reviews.Content: Works great after I figured out how to work the thing. Me being 65 years old can even figure out how to work the thing. It's fast also compared to my other computers.

Reviews.Title: I like it....mostly.  3 1/2 stars!
Reviews.Author: Christa Pettis
Reviews.Content: I am going to irritate a lot of tech savvy people.I will admit to being only mildly into the newest stuff.  I have an iPad, iPhone, Kindle, and I just lost my trusty laptop.  RIP old friend.I am short on cash at the moment, and while I use my other gadgets for most stuff...I found editing my photos, and making my digital scrapbooks very difficult on the iPad.  I made a rash decision to buy this because of the price.  Here is what you need to know:#1.  NO iTUNES!  This isn't a big deal if you don't have apple products, but I have $600 of music on my account.  I also can't sync my phone/ipad on cloud with the chromebook.#2.  No gaming.  Not a big deal for me, but of note for some people.#3.  Online word processing, Google docs.  I don't mind this feature, I actually kind of LOVE google drive, but if you are looking for an office-type program....move along.#4.  You MUST have a cloud printer IF you want to directly print from Chromebook.  You can't print without a wireless printer, and one that works with google cloud.#5.  This Chromebook never wants to auto connect to my WiFi, and when it does it doesn't work correctly.  I have to disconnect and reconnect wo my WiFi service 90% of the time I open the browser.  This is a problem.  Very buggy.In short, Chromebook has a TON of potential.  I like it, but I don't love it.  I now wish I would have saved up a few hundred more dollars for a laptop.IF you are looking for a web browser with keys, this is fine.  If you decide to try it, do yourself a huge favor and buy Chromecast along with this chromebook.  Chromecast is an awesome feature!

Reviews.Title: My favorite gadget!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have owned several 7" tablets, a Nexus 10" tablet, and countless Windows laptops and computers. Since purchasing my C720 several months ago, it is the thing I reach for when I want to process my email, search the web, or work on any of the increasing number of web-based applications I use. In addition, I maintain several servers using the fine 2X Remote Desktop Client on my chromebook. This (I am using it right now) thing is as light and small as my Nexus 10 in its keyboard case, but so much better for everything that requires even a little typing. The only thing I still do on the tablet is watch Netflix and read e-magazines on Zinio. It is pretty much the same thing with my current laptops (and HP 12" touchscreen model (weighs twice as much as the C270) and a 15" i7 that I use as a backup server and for programming. I spend far more time using the chromebook than either of these other portables. So, although technically the chromebook is a supplementary device, it is the one I use most. In all fairness, I should add that my business uses Google Apps for Business, so the chromebook is a great fit in that regard, but Chrome is such a good browser that I think it would work just as well if we used Office 365 instead. I can't believe that this machine was only $200.Features: Time to get into the system to start using it is as fast as anyone could ask for, and less than the 15 seconds that I have read in various reviews, whether starting it cold or waking it from sleep. In that respect it feels more like my phone or tablet than my computers. The keyboard is solid with good action. I can type as fast as with any other keyboard I have. It would be nice to have a higher resolution screen, but it is good enough, and the brightness is absolutely fine. Although I really have not found it necessary, I leave a tiny 64 GB flash drive plugged in all the time, in case I suddenly need some off-line storage. Oh, that reminds me of my one gripe. The SD slot is very shallow, so if you insert an SD card, most of the card sticks out. That means it is good for copying stuff onto or off a temporarily inserted card, but you really can't leave it in there or it will surely get broken. Anyway, no biggie. I am delighted with this purchase and with the chromebook concept. It works out much better than I had imagined it would!

Reviews.Title: Like it but have an issue -Edited
Reviews.Author: Jase
Reviews.Content: Had to edit my review. Still really like the idea of a chromebook however i'm experience problems with mine. It randomly shuts down. I've posted in googles chromebook forum but haven't gotten an answer that helps. I've ran a Chrome OS recovery which installs a fresh copy of Chrome OS on your computer. It shut down 5 mins after that. I thought maybe it was overheating on my lap - covering the exhaust port and fan but it shut down on a table a couple days ago and last night in the middle of a movie. Both time the vents were completely clear. Have read 2 other reviews that have this problem. Might just be faulty hardware and I got an unlucky one. Not sure but I will have to take this back. Don't know if I will purchase another.This is my first chromebook. If you know what a chromebook/Chrome OS is capable of will not be disappointed.I've been using it for a couple days now so I'll give you a breakdown of what I like about itScreen- 11.6 is alot smaller than I'm used too. That being said its not a bad trade off for the portability of this device. Its a TN screen so colors are not that great but also not bad, I've seen 400-500 dollar laptops with worse screens. I compared the chromebook with the ISP panel and it was so much nicer of a screen but I did not like that chrome book. I actually like the matte screen. My last 2 laptop were glossy so I thought i might not like this one but thats not the case. Remember the price of this laptop I can't complain at all about the screenHdmi out - I've hooked this up to my 55" samsung tv via hdmi. The picture was amazing. Just make sure you don't choose mirror displays. that will send the 1366x768 image to the tv. Choose the other setting and it will send a full 1080p signal to your screen. I tested playing movies from either usb port, the sd card, and the actual hard drive on the computer and all worked perfectly.Webcam- just average. In good lighting its a decent image. Medium light starts to get grainy. Low light pretty bad.Audio- sounds great with headphones, speaker volume is more than enough with my Grados. Built in speakers are very good as well, better than my last 2 laptops which is odd since the speakers here are on the bottom.Battery life - have been getting 7-8 hours just as advertised. I really find this incredible, my past laptops were 3 hours at mostwifi- works great. I needed an ethernet port which this did not have. I purchased a usb to ethernet adapter from amazon. It was cheap and works perfectly. Tried it in both usb ports and is automatically detected and worked in both.Sabrent USB 2.0 to Network 10/100Mbps Ethernet Adaptersd/usb ports - all work and quickly, dont' have any usb 3.0 devices to see how much quicker the usb 3 is.keyboard- i like the small keyboard. can reach any button easily while typing. doesn't feel cheap. the full screen button and the buttons around it are a little "clicky". There is some flex in that area of my laptop which causes that sound. If I push down slight on the plastic above those keys they sound just liek the rest. The tiny flex in the plastic is what is causing the sound , the keys work fine.  Some buttons are gone from a regular laptop or keyboard but there are short cuts to each of these missing keys. Just have to look them up - example no delete button but alt+backspace functions as a delete button.Trackpad- is sensitive and responsive. Click feels solid, but i find that i really click anymore just tap it. Since the laptop is small the track pad is on the small side. Sometimes when I'm scrolling down I run out of track pad. I just have get used to it and two finger scroll a little quicker and then it brings me to the bottom of the pages i'm reading.So for 199 I really think this is an amazing machine. If you know what Chrome OS is capable of then you won't be disappointed with this.  At first I didn't know how I would manage without downloading the programs I have on windows but it seems in this day there is a web based program for everything you need to do.My only issue is Toshiba just came out with a chromebook CB35-A3120. It has a 13.3 inch screen (supposedly better colors, glossy screen). Two 3.0 usb ports. It is 279 plus tax so its almost 50% more than this model.  I've not seen one in a store yet but I might consider getting that instead depending on when I see one in person.

Reviews.Title: What a gem!
Reviews.Author: Mei C Lai
Reviews.Content: It's perfect:  fast, intuitive, great price and just about everything I was looking for.  It's quiet, does not generate excessive heat and starts and closes down in a sec.

Reviews.Title: Worth every penny!
Reviews.Author: MM
Reviews.Content: It is super quick, easy to use and inexpensive. It's also well designed and put together - nice job Acer. Everyone should have a Chromebook!

Reviews.Title: Chrome book
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: The computer came sealed with all the parts. We have been using it daily with my daughter in high school. I like how quickly she was able to use it and feel comfortable.

Reviews.Title: Really nice
Reviews.Author: Richard Gartner
Reviews.Content: I got this for my 7 year old son for Christmas. Its been a lot of fun for him. You can enable a supervised account with your google account and supervise everything they do (at this time its a hidden setting in chrome, search for it). I set it up so he can only go to the sites I want him to go to like kahn academy, wikipedia, lego, math games, etc. He is having a lot of fun and a lot of learning and like I said, I can log into my google account and control where he can go online. Its decently made, its not going to be on par with the build of a real laptop but for 199 bucks Im not sure you should expect that. Its a nice, cheap 'laptop' for doing a lot of things online.

Reviews.Title: An awesome computer that is not for everyone!
Reviews.Author: Daniel Rendon
Reviews.Content: Chrome OS has a lot of drawbacks. You cannot use it to sync an iPhone. Forget about installing iTunes. Editing video would be a nightmare. This computer cannot function as a primary computer.What it can do, it can do very well. It is ideal for checking email, purchasing items on Amazon, streaming music, checking accounts, and watching YouTube. Spotify, Google Music, and Pandora all work well on this computer.As a teacher, I needed a machine to carry in my messenger bag, check attendance, and input grades. This computer is great for simple tasks. I am in love with it. I have a fully loaded Mac Mini at home and I use it for all of the heavy-duty computer tasks. As a secondary computer, this computer rocks. The battery life is insanely awesome (8 hours on a single charge!!). The screen is passable. The audio quality is okay. The storage is limited but if you have an internet connection, the world is at your fingertips. If it is on a website, this computer can handle it. For $200, I highly recommend it as a secondary computer.

Reviews.Title: WONDERFUL piece of laptop
Reviews.Author: Santosh Balan
Reviews.Content: I brought this as a birthday gift for my daughter 9 year old.  What was surprising is that my wife who has a Sony Viao laptop also prefers to use the Chromebook when she can.  My daughter hit the ground running with the Chromebook os and did not require any training.  This serves all her needs and i do not have to worry about virus, patches or a corrupt os, boots in 7 seconds and an 8 hour battery life is icing on the cake.My wife has expressed that she is willing to take a Chromebook for her birthday gift to replace her Sony Viao.  Although this may not be a full blown computer, this serves 100% need of 80% of the users.  for the remaining 20% of the users like me who have specialized need for software for professional reasons, you always have the macs and window pcs and the associated pain that comes with it.

Reviews.Title: Okay I am sold...
Reviews.Author: Lucian A. Sperta
Reviews.Content: Just got this little baby and turned it on, HDMI plugged in...awesome connection with WIFI, watching YoutTube now...awesome view only 720 but real nice, my other Dell lap top was connected to my T.V. Dell Windows 8, now I can take that with me and use it while this little Google boy will do all I need for only internet stuff. Nice look, nice feel, take some getting used to, smaller than what appears on Amazon. Looks like a mini lap top. I thought it would be bigger in size...I love it.

Reviews.Title: Better alternative
Reviews.Author: MBH1
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with speed, screen quality, battery life and overall utility. It's a great product and priced right. Highly recommend this for a coffee table surfing appliance. Great for emails, surfing, you tube vids, online banking and limited games. Perfect, but would prefer the ability to control content better. Kids have unrestricted use of the web, wish the ability to block adult or inappropriate content was possible.

Reviews.Title: The beauty of simplicity
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Got 95% of my work done without the hassle of software updates, virus, slow start-ups, memory leaks. Light to carry and long battery life. It has easily become my coach computer and Starbucks computer.

Reviews.Title: wish I'd gotten this before I got my regular netbook
Reviews.Author: Kamali
Reviews.Content: I went in skeptical, I will not lie. I read the reviews and I went...eh, never as good as they say. But the Acer Chromebook is everything everyone says it is, and then some. I'm talking speed that's, frankly, amazing. I'm talking multiple windows with no issues, or even multiple video streaming sites at the same time with no lag whatsoever. It actually boots in less than 7 seconds, has some decent speakers and, other than it being app-based, it's comparable to a regular laptop.Considering that I bought it for classroom use, I definitely came out on top.All in all, this might the best purchase I ever made and this thing is worth every freaking penny.

Reviews.Title: STOP AND LISTEN!
Reviews.Author: Troopie
Reviews.Content: This Chrome is awesome! I got it for 199, and I am loving it, the only con I have is the keyboard is flat, and I am use to a desk top keyboard. The built in mouse has to be controlled with two fingers, and that's awkward at first , but you get use to it. Now if your'e use to downloading a lot of data, this may not be the computer for you. I have watched movies on my Chrome with no interruptions, and I am enjoying it ! Even though its plastic, its quality is not bad at all, its very sturdy. Don't be afraid of the purchase, I think its better than the HP, and definitely better than the Samsung. I am really excited about this little addition to our family. My next purchase it the Kindle Fire...

Reviews.Title: Seniors - don't hesitate to buy one!
Reviews.Author: Kate Fitzpatrick
Reviews.Content: After spending months thinking about buying a Chromebook I finally decided to do it and couldn't be happier.  It is super simple to set up and use (took me less than five minutes) and I find I'm using it almost all the time instead of my laptop--it is SO MUCH faster!  One of the reasons I hesitated to buy it was because of the size--I was worried about being able to see well with this smaller screen but that hasn't been a problem at all due to sharp high-quality resolution.  Another concern had been typing on the smaller keyboard and that isn't a problem at all.  I find it very comfortable and easy to  use.  Google Docs makes it possible to do word processing without Office (which is much more difficult to use anyway!)  The touchpad/mouse was much easier to use than I expected, too.  Just overall terrific for any age, but  I would highly recommend it for other seniors as a low cost way to browse the internet, check e-mail, and watch those Amazon Instant Videos!

Reviews.Title: Great for schools
Reviews.Author: DWB
Reviews.Content: The chrome book actually lives up to its advertisement. I am able to go from power off to logging in in 6.4 seconds. We are rolling them out in a middle school and getting the students working quickly was a key factor for us. Also, from closing the lid to getting back to work is about 4 seconds. Makes it easy to move the laptop without having students carry it by the screen. I have had it active for an hour and the battery indicator has barely moved.

Reviews.Title: Great for my money!
Reviews.Author: Susan McCloud
Reviews.Content: After deciding that I wanted to cloud compute and that I understood and enjoyed using the Google platform, I decided to spring for a Chromebook.  I have 3 other laptops but they are much larger and I don't enjoy taking them on vacation because they are so heavy (comparatively).  My new Chromebook is so light and compact that it is a joy to use and carry with me wherever I go.  The frame and keyboard are a little delicate but I have adjusted my touch a bit to accommodate.  Can't beat it for $200.

Reviews.Title: An unbelievable bargain! (with updates and tips)
Reviews.Author: Phantom-X
Reviews.Content: A grand slam chromebook at a spectacular price!  I've never owned a chromebook, but I'm so glad I purchased this.Benefits:* Speed - connects to WiFi instantly and runs all web-based tasks as good as my desktop PC.* Instant boot up* Immediate access to Google Drive, Google Email, etc.* Lightweight* Battery Life (8.5 hours)* Quick charge time (charged very quickly from 82% to full today when I received the product)* Chrome Remote Desktop -- this app allows me to connect directly to my desktop PC (which has Windows 7).  The app works very well, and this essentially means that I HAVE FULL ACCESS TO WIN 7 WHENEVER I WANT!Zero cons at this price.  This is now going to be my little workhorse computer.Acer has really hit this one out of the park.**UPDATE #1**I've been using this for a few days now.  I'm still very impressed with this machine.  I really cannot state how great the battery is:  I literally went through almost 2 full days of use with this on a single charge (not continuous use, but off and on for hours at a time for the entire two days).I also earned 100 GB of free Google space - bringing my total Google Cloud space up to 130 GB (all for free).I've been speed-testing the WiFi.  The machine achieves excellent speeds (same as my desktop PC).  This may be standard nowadays, but my cell phone and other laptops I've tried often have a slightly inferior WiFi connection.  So I'm happy to report that this thing achieves full speeds over WiFi (and really connects almost instantly to it).There are a few things I dislike, but it's not with the machine itself.  Google Docs is missing a few features that I would have assumed standard (e.g., no ability to use a section break).Also, I really like Google Chrome Remote Desktop, but there is one issue with the screen flickering when I try to stream StarCraft 2 on my chromebook.  I'm not sure what the reason is, but it may have to do with my desktop PC having two monitors (dual screen).  Not quite sure yet.  Otherwise, Google Chrome Remote Desktop is brilliant!One thing I noticed:  If you have multiple email accounts with Google, you'll need to create a separate user to access them.  It's not a bad thing, but it is a necessity.Another thing:  There is no "delete" key on this keyboard.  That may be standard on laptops, but I used that key all the time on my desktop PC (and I miss it!).In sum, I'm still very glad I purchased this Chromebook.  People try to ding things by saying the screen is of poor quality, or that the keyboard is bad, etc.  I DO NOT agree.  The screen looks great to me, and the only thing I can say about the keyboard is that it's a little smaller than a full-sized keyboard (standalone).  But I can type on it just fine (as I'm doing now).All in all, a terrific machine at a terrific price!  Still 5/5 for me!I'm getting ready to travel across the country for approximately 2 weeks.  I will post another update on my experience using it on the go.  Cheers!**Update #2**I'm on holiday and recently flew from Ohio to California with a connection in Texas (American Airlines flights).  GoGo in flight WiFi worked and it was FREE!A few things:*It only worked from Texas to California (no service from Ohio to Texas)*The overall speed was very hit or miss.  One second web pages / music would be loading decently, and then it would come to a grinding halt.  This was, admittedly, rather annoying.*When I had no connection, I noticed that I could still make changes to files I had stored in Google Docs.  For some reason, these files would still open even though I had no internet connection.  I'm very baffled by this, but it's an incredible plus.  Basically, all the changes I made were synced once the connection resumed.  This is an AWESOME feature because it allows me to work despite the lack of an active connection.Other general thoughts:*The speed of this chromebook is incredible.  A particularly nice feature is the boot-up time.  If you open the chromebook, it resumes instantly.*Again, I have to comment on the wicked good battery life.  I cannot remember the last time I charged this device, but I can tell you it was BEFORE I left for vacation, which translates to about 5-7 days.  This is with full time usage during my flight (several hours) and also moderate usage before and after the flight.  As of right now, after about a week of light / moderate use, I've got 22% battery life / about 2 hours left.  WICKED GOOD BATTERY LIFE!*A pleasure to travel with due to its slim and lightweight design.I was hoping I'd be getting some more work in during my trip, but we all know how that goes.  I will post another update again in the future.Still 5/5.**Update #3**I've had a few more thoughts since my purchase.  First off, still love this machine in pretty much every possible way.A minor downside, at the moment, is Google Chrome Remote Desktop.  First off, the app works great FOR THE MOST PART.  However, certain tasks / applications ARE SLOW.  The trouble is that I have not figured out a way to fix this issue.  I'm not sure if it's a hardware issue, a software issue, or a bandwidth issue.  I've tried reducing my color depth and eliminated all visual enhancements on the Win 7 machine, but it hasn't fixed the issue.I dug around and it turns out that Google seems to be aware of this issue, suggesting that I'm not the only one experiencing this and also that they are currently working to resolve the performance degradation during Chrome Remote Desktop.The best way I can describe the performance issues is this:  Laggy.  The cursor will sometimes lag behind, typing will sometimes be delayed, and applications will stutter a bit.  It seems to get worse depending on where I am using my chromebook, which makes me suspect that it might be a bandwidth issue.  Of course, I'm not 100% sure and it may be a combination of things.  I do hope that they resolve the issue sometime soon!Otherwise, nothing majorly new to report at this time.  It's still a workhorse bargain of a machine as I outlined in my previous reviews, and it's most certainly still one of the best electronics / laptop purchases I've ever made (if not THE best computer purchasing decision I've ever made!).**Update #4**Quick tip:  To avoid the loud mouse click when using the trackpad, push down slightly above the left mouse key.  The button will not depress, and thus will not make noise; yet, if you find the sweet spot, you can successfully click the mouse!  :)I also wanted to say that my GoGo WiFi was much better on my return flights (previously, it was kinda slow and in one leg not even available).Also, Google Chrome Remote is great in terms of reliability, but needs to be updated for better speed.  Also, when using Chrome Remote in full screen mode, a really annoying display box telling you you're in full screen mode pops up whenever you hover your mouse near the top of the screen.  This is really ANNOYING and should be eliminated!

Reviews.Title: Why Not?
Reviews.Author: Budget Uke Buyer
Reviews.Content: Considering how many things you can't do on a computer without an internet connection these days, I don't know what there isn't to love about this Chromebook. I'll admit, the smaller form factor has taken me a few days to get used to but that's a minor adjustment I'm quickly adapting to. I can't believe how well Netflix runs on this baby. No buffering at all! Works almost seamlessly with the Chromecast adapter and my flat screen. Yeah, it's made of plastic, but hardly as ugly as the dozens of other hulking laptops currently on the market. If you drop it, it will probably break. So will an Ipad or any other electronic device. The display is more than adequate. No glare. The matte screen is much easier on the eyes and looks as good as most other current laptops, but I'm highly biased towards this type of screen since I spend a great deal of time staring at it. Speed. I bought the 2 Mb version with some reservations, but haven't had any problems at all staying connected or having multiple page open at the same time. I don't use my Chromebook for business, but I do rely quite heavily on Google docs. It's a fantastic, stripped down, easy to use word processor that is way more useful than Microsoft Word has ever been for me. Bottom line; this Chromebook does what it says it's supposed to do. It's the first computer that's ever done that for me right out of the box. I have an older Windows 7 laptop that I'm keeping around to do all my music recording on, but other than that, this Chromebook will be my go to computer. It's fast, light, efficient and extremely easy to operate.

Reviews.Title: Trackpad issues x2
Reviews.Author: Dewey's Mom
Reviews.Content: I wanted to like this Chromebook so badly. I loved the weight, the size, the brightness of the screen, how it booted quickly ... there was so much to like.But the trackpad was defective right out of the box. The pad itself seemed to hover over the rest of the keyboard, as if it weren't secured into the frame or maybe the plastic shell was warped. I would push on it and the entire keyboard area would flex. The pad was smooth and flat, but when i would drag my finger across it the cursor would kinda float between points. Or it would jerk from place to place. It would not move smoothly anywhere. It was so bad that I couldn't even click on buttons because the cursor had a mind of its own. At first I thought it was maybe my finger, so I tried different angles and I even tried dampening my finger to get more friction on the pad. Then I got my wife to try using it. Nothing changed.So I boxed it up and sent in for a new one. Amazon Prime had me a new one before I could even get the first one in the mail. Opened it up and the EXACT SAME PROBLEM. Trackpad will not work. At this point, i'm getting my money back because two in a row is awful. I had high hopes ... if only the trackpad could work.

Reviews.Title: trackpad problem
Reviews.Author: Massang
Reviews.Content: track-pad does not work properly at all. so frustrating.especially vertical move with one finger is terrible, not working at all, although scrolling with two finger works better.it is defective product.mouse is must.I would like to return this but i ordered from japan and i do not know if i could return this.

Reviews.Title: The fan is annoying.
Reviews.Author: theJonster
Reviews.Content: I'm used to the silent samsung and work in a quiet room.  I thought this computer would be an upgrade, but the fan cycling on every 6 seconds even when it's not working hard, even though it's quiet, was annoying.  I'm waiting to see if hp will come out with a silent 11" that will be better than the samsung chromebook 2 11"for the record, I would love usb charged with a hdmi port and a speed upgrade to handle video better... and did I mention I like it SILENT :)  I'm spoiled now

Reviews.Title: A great product for lightweight work on a GNU/Linux platform.
Reviews.Author: David Maverick
Reviews.Content: I bought this product acknowledging ChromeOS as a useless and questionable OS in regards to user privacy, almost equivalent to malware like all Google based products.Regardless, I promptly installed Arch linux removing any trace of ChromeOS (except a back up of course) and found this device to be a very snappy and almost exceeding my expectations regarding its power. It can run some newer steam games (albeit on low settings) at a stable 25-30 FPS. Not great by any means and borderline not usable, but it can work if you're desperate.The battery life is far more than I expect out of a laptop at this price with about 8 hours of constant usage. (Running Firefox with multiple scripts, chat programs open, IRC, etcThe screen's viewing distance isn't anything spectacular, but it's more than acceptable for the price.I've found it to be an excellent choice for anyone who wants to do lightweight computing, this is all you'll need. Just uninstall Chrome OS due to it being useless malware (redeem your bonuses before uninstalling if you choose to use Google software) and install a real distro, then you are set for a great laptop at a great price.

Reviews.Title: read about chrome OS before buying!!!
Reviews.Author: Keith O'Brien
Reviews.Content: If you're unfamiliar with chrome OS, Don't buy this machine. It works very well for what it is, a fast internet browser. Everything in chrome OS is wifi based. The "apps" are just links to websites you can already go to. If you want music you have a number of streaming sites plus google play music. Google docs for word documents, you even sign on to the chromebook with your google account. The price is great for this machine but outside of wifi you're scroogled (as microsoft said in their new attack adds) as your chromebook is essentially a paper weight. For the more tech savy, you can also run Ubuntu ([...]

Reviews.Title: works great - printer setup a little difficult
Reviews.Author: Christopher Knipple
Reviews.Content: Bought this for daughter to do homework via google drive etc. So far it has done exactly what it is supposed to do. One downside I didn't realize is that there is no native printer support on these. In other words...in order to print you have to either have an internet cloud  printer (not the same as a WiFi capable printer) or you have to set up your home network PC to be a printer hub (more complicated than I wanted to figure out). So...I solved the problem by just telling my daughter to do all her work on the google drive using this Chromebook, then go print from google drive on our home desktop printer...or at school. This all works fine for us with just a few extra steps...but it won't work for someone who doesn't have a second computer that's a standard laptop or desktop hooked up to their printer.

Reviews.Title: Sound issues.
Reviews.Author: Annie
Reviews.Content: One day sound, next day nothing. Have gone to all the help sites to no avail.  If you are not a tech this can get very frustrating. Every time I think I've got the issue solved it comes back again.

Reviews.Title: Better than most but still insufficient
Reviews.Author: Hackworth
Reviews.Content: I've purchased two of these so far, but for others in the extended family. The problem is that I'm so tired of almost every Chromebook model having only 2 GB of memory and generic 1366×768-resolution displays. Yet when one is lucky enough to find the rare Chromebook with 4 GB and a higher resolution, it's already sold out! They sell like there's no tomorrow.We have a super-high end Chromebook Pixel at the top of the heap, and many generic low-res units at the bottom. Why can't these manufacturers get a clue and offer something a bit more mid-range? As for myself, I'd buy one in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: This computer has touchpad problems
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: When the computer is plugged in the touchpad becomes erratic and unresponsive. When unplugged the touchpad works fine. Buyer beware!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great computer for the price!
Reviews.Author: Harley Ryder
Reviews.Content: This is my second Acer Chromebook, I replaced my C7 with this C720. This works great, has longer battery life and is so easy to operate. I usually grab this over my laptop and my desktop when I want to get online fast to look something up. It is true to its claim of booting up in 7.5 seconds. Its so fast for such a small device. Its light, thin and very mobile. I always take this on motorcycle trips. It doesn't take up much room at all. I prefer this over any pad type device of the same size because it has a keyboard and can sit on a table or your lap by itself, leaving both hands free. No need to hold and balance it like a pad device with one hand and use a finger to operate. Pad devices were great when they came out, but are too big and heavy, they don't stand up unless you purchase a stand or case w/stand for more money.

Reviews.Title: Not too bad, but didn't work out for me.
Reviews.Author: David Huseth
Reviews.Content: I ended up returning this machine to Amazon and am purchasing a Windows 8 laptop instead (Lenovo IdeaPad U430). The Chromebook C720 has a lot going for it. The battery life is superb. The build quality seems generally very good. The keyboard was fine for me. It was easy to use. 5 minutes out of the box and I was online. The small size is nice for traveling. The display was quite good for the price. The biggest problem, and the reason I chose to return it, was in the Chrome OS /browser. Every time I'd open the browser and hit the new tab key, the browser would open many (at times >100) new tabs. I'm sure there is, or will be eventually, a relatively simple software fix for this flaw. But it was incredibly irritating and I wasn't able to find a solution and didn't want to wait. After trying Chromebook, I realized too that, for me personally, giving up the ability to network with and share files with my other machines was too much to give up. I did try the Chrome Remote Desktop app to control my other 2 PCs remotely and that worked like a charm, but it was not a substitute for file-sharing.

Reviews.Title: Does everything a 21st century computer user wants
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: I love this little computer. I originally got this chromebook after my macbook pro died, and it has since taken care of 95% of my computing needs. The keyboard feels great and the thing is silly light. The screen and trackpad both work very well but show some signs of a $200 small laptop. Nothing to worry about in my opinion. I bought it along with a larger solid state drive and then installed ubuntu on it with crouton. The whole process was pretty approachable and greatly expanded what one can do with the computer. I would recommend this computer to just about anyone who isn't doing serious photo/video/audio editing or gaming. I've also had trouble running a virtual machine on it, so people who rely on one should be wary.Most people, myself included don't need the heavy duty supercomputers that pass as a laptop nowadays for home usage. So why pay more than $200 for one.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Machine as a secondary unit
Reviews.Author: Ranka
Reviews.Content: Alright folks, I just bought my first chromebook after hours and hours of searching for the one with the best specs for the cheapest price. And here we are!I am not really much of a laptop guy, I have a ridiculously expensive pc, with a filco cherry brown mx keyboard, and gaming mice, etc. So why did I decide to buy a chromebook? Well, I am a student, and I didn't want to go home after class every single day just to do hw or wait for class (and god knows, I won't study once im in that gaming environment i created). So I looked to find a way to help me stay focused - at school. And bam, a fast pc that cant play games but can work very well on the browser. And furthermore, google made it! Expecting quality out of em.And quality I received. Everything I love about this except for a few minor thingsGoogle Slides is trashcan for viewing microsoft PPTs. It is always in some shape or form corrupted. Not even worth my time. So I recommend having a power house computer at home. What I did was download the app Chrome Remote Desktop, and Set it up to my desktop at home. Then, if i need to look at ppts for class, i simply sync to my computer at home, and download the ppts and view them. It's pretty witty i gotta say. But anyhow, The screen is pretty small imo, but its workable once you get used to it (2-3 days) And the keyboard is hard to get used to for the first 2 days or so. I just played a bunch of typing games for an hour or so and went form 60 wpm back to my avg of 90 wpm. Definitely a good keyboard once you get used to it. The trackpad is a bit rough at first. Felt a great deal of friction at first, but once you use it enough, your hand oils will seep into it and make it smoother and easier to use. Trust me.Also, before buying this, spend some time learning to use google docs. Since switching over is a big change. Also, i dont like the Search function instead of Caps Lock, thank god you can change it. So I did. Im worried about it getting scratched, so i bought a cover case, "Aqua iPearl mCover Hard Shell Case for 11.6" Acer C720 C720P series ChromeBook Laptop" It looks really nice with it on too. Plus, it has 2 lifters on the bottom of the case so you can elevate your chromebook as a whole to type if you prefer.Fast load time. Easy to use. Great machine. Tbh, it's very fun because of how interestingly new this concept is to try to put on for a laptop.Tl;DrBest specs for cheap chromebook, Fast, L2Use Google Docs b4 buying, Use Chrome Remote Desktop to use your actual computer away from home, invest in a case.EDIT: 1 Month LaterMy problem with viewing ppts was solved after i found out using google drive viewer instead.I love google docs now, been using the google cloud system a lot more now that I can really use it and take it with me everywhere. The keyboard is pretty good, i get about 89-104 wpm on it, and on my filco cherry mx ninja majestouch 2, i get about the same.I am very glad I bought a case for my c720, because I can already see all the scratches on it even though all I have been doing is putting it in my backpack. I just wish the screen was a bit bigger, not really used to it. Just gives off the "secondary" computer vibe. IF it had a bigger screen, I'd give this a perfect score. Prob just a 4.5/5 so far.And compared to the pixel, this machine is the closest you are going to get for a budget price. The pixel is cool, but I am sure something else will come out better than it.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Wyatt
Reviews.Content: Couldn't be more impressed by this tiny machine. ChromeOS runs quick and boots quickly thanks to the 16GB SSD and applications already on the machine are all useful (no bloatware) Great battery life, good sounding speakers and the display is awesome.

Reviews.Title: Nice but some problems
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love how light, quiet and cool this chromebook performs. I have issues with the Bluetooth - it's not picking finding or pairing with my Jambox from Jawbone. And a bigger issue - the headphone jack isn't working. So there is no way I can listen to music/movies without everyone hearing.I wish the operating system were easier to use in diagnosing hardware settings. I'm used to Windows Control Panel, but there doesn't seem to be much of that in the "settings" in the bottom right corner, even the Advanced settings. If I figure out it's my error and not the machine's then I'll raise the # of stars in my review.

Reviews.Title: Dont like tablets and my desktop is my workhorse
Reviews.Author: C. Brown "Ideas that speak volumes"
Reviews.Content: My $1200 macbook never really got much use outside of surfing the net. I have a great iMac desktop that I use when I want to work on apps like photoshop, lightroom and premiere pro. So it became obvious to me that i had a $1200 web browser (always running chrome) that really was not being used to it's full potential. So when my son decided that he wanted a laptop, I decided to look at the new chromebooks for him. But after doing a little research and soul searching, I decided it made more sense to buy myself the Chromebook and give my son the macbook.So far it has been a great decision. The small size of the chromebook make it extremely portable. Much like a tablet, I find that I can take this thing anyplace that I would take my 10 inch tablet. Closed, this chromebook is almost the same size as my tablet in it's leather case. And, for whatever reason, I prefer to use something with a dedicated keyboard over a touch screen.The battery life in this thing is much better than the battery life of the macbook. It almost seems to match the battery life of my Samsung Galaxy 10.1 Tablet and may even beat it. Never really tested them both.Now initially it was a bit difficult for me to figure out how to deal with files on the chromebook but once I did, doing things like downloading photos, saving them, posting them to facebook and sending them in emails became simple.In reviews I read that this 2GB version would slow down when multiple windows were open. I have not had that experience. I am a man who always has about ten windows open at any given time. This chromebook  handles as many windows as I normally would have open without much noticeable change in speed.No real difference from my macbook there.There have been so many reviews of this thing, I really shouldn't waste time typing so much. If you like browsing the net using Chrome and need a laptop to perform the basic tasks, then this is the device for you.

Reviews.Title: Small and lightweight!
Reviews.Author: angela
Reviews.Content: I needed a laptop to lug around campus (big campus, so I needed a lightweight laptop) to see PPT online, type paper, take notes, etc. This has all the functions I need. I admit, the Google App was something new to me, but it wasn't very hard to download it. All in all, a great buy. And the battery is like forever (8.5 hours!).

Reviews.Title: Super fantastic
Reviews.Author: Andrew Harris
Reviews.Content: Replaced my i7 4 gb laptop. This is faster because of the OS. Recommend only for people with a desktop.

Reviews.Title: Amazing little performer!
Reviews.Author: Nancy Rodick
Reviews.Content: Santa got this for our son for Christmas, and we have been quite impressed with its speed, battery life, portability, and ease of use.  He is able to watch videos, do web-based homework assignments, read ebooks, surf web, etc on the C720.  It's boot speed is crazy fast, and the 2GB RAM has been enough (no hindrance that we've noticed). Software is a bit limited, but basic word processor and spreadsheet are built in.  This gift has been a winner so far!

Reviews.Title: No fuss solution
Reviews.Author: John Alvarez
Reviews.Content: I have many computers (too many in fact) and maintenance can be quite cumbersome. Are all operating system (OS) updates installed, is the antivirus running, are there system errors, and so on. I deal with this at work so I do not like to deal with it at home, especially when a child is using the computer. A child can destroy an operating system in no time flat. That is why I like the Chromebook. I do not need to deal with a thing. My daughter can play all her online games without causing me any additional computer maintenance.If you only need to do web based activities (browsing, email, watching online videos, writing papers, etc.), the Chrome OS is perfect for that. Just the Chrome web browser and no additional software. The operating system itself is a customized Linux distribution, which is well-known for being secure and not always requiring powerful hardware. If there is a problem with the OS, do a factory reset and you will be up and running in no time.The size of this laptop is a bit small at 11.6 inches, but good enough for light work. It is a perfect size for my daughter. At $200, this is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: I just received my Acer C720
Reviews.Author: Korejem
Reviews.Content: I bought the $199.99 version. I've had it for about an hour now. I think this is a lightning fast computer. I agree with others about the noisy keyboard but I will adapt. Packaging was in excellent shape and nothing was missing. Setup was very easy and fast. I used the Google browser on my older netbook so all I had to do was sign in after connecting to the internet. The battery was almost fully charged. For me, this is a different type of upgrade from what I first envisioned. There is so many choices now. I have no doubts this will do what I used the netbook for and probably more because of apps I haven't looked at yet. I have no complaints about the screen and how things look. I don't think I'll miss avast voice after upgrading either. I've been on battery since 11:30 am and it is now 3:37 pm. My neighbors stopped by and took a look at my new Chromebook. The battery is at 87% now. Happy Holidays! Four stars only because I haven't had time to check everything else out.  Happy Holidays Everyone!

Reviews.Title: MacBook Pro User
Reviews.Author: Jonathan
Reviews.Content: I just recently purchased this Google Chromebook and it is AMAZING! Super fast, lightweight, and best battery life of any laptop I have ever used. I switched from using my Macbook Pro because I realized that I all I used on my Macbook Pro was Chrome, iPhoto, and Microsoft Word. With Google + Photos, it assists me in editing photos and keeping them backed up. Google docs was a great replacement for Microsoft Word, especially that it works offline. The battery life is probably one of the best features of this laptop. Consistent browsing has gotten me to about 8 hours of battery life and that includes some YouTube videos and CNN videos. I would definitely recommend this laptop to anyone in school or just does basic web browsing. No set up at all, boots up in seconds and you are online. :) Greatest $199 purchase I have made.

Reviews.Title: Perfect fit!
Reviews.Author: M. M. Bly "music lover"
Reviews.Content: Having read the other reviews on Amazon, I realized that this computer's primary purpose for me was to be streaming video. I really can't run other things I use at all. That was OK by me... the price was right, and I was able to stream a Syracuse basketball game that was only on ESPN3, the 1st night I had it!!It's main use for me will be streaming basketball games... Syracuse, Delaware women's basketball, and Chicago Sky games when the WNBA resumes!I probably will find other things, but so far, it fits my needs perfectly!!

Reviews.Title: Headline required
Reviews.Author: Thomas
Reviews.Content: Kids has not put it down since they got it. Both my girls have this laptop for "school work". Keeps them off my computer, and the price is great.

Reviews.Title: An awesome secondary laptop for everyday use!
Reviews.Author: MG
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied with the Chromebook from Acer! This is my first chromebook, and I use it as a secondary laptop in addition to my MacBook Pro. Here I list several pros and cons from my 3-day experience:Pros:1. Battery: I am very surprised that the battery lasts so long compared to any PC or MacBook, probably even longer than advertised. Also it charges very fast.2. Style: Before I got this chromebook, I thought maybe its style is not as attractive as the new HP 11. However, I completely changed my mind when I opened the box. The Acer C720 has a very nice looking outside, and the weight is very light.3. Apps: There are so many apps in the Chrome Store that meet all my needs.4. Sound: The speakers are pretty good. For running multiple tabs, you hardly hear any noise from the inside of the chromebook. Very quite.5. Remote control: Make sure to check out the Chrome Remote Desktop (or alternative apps). It is pretty easy to get control of my MacBook Pro. You just need a PIN number to get the access.Cons:1. Skype: I knew beforehand that Skype is not supported in Chrome OS. I do hope that there could be a Skype app in the near future. Though Google Hangouts is awesome, some people may still want to have Skype at hand.2. Touchpad: when I click on the touchpad, I hear a crispy sound that I dislike. That sound may make the chromebook feel "cheap" in quality, but that is the only aspect that I am a little disappointed. Again, for the $199 price, I should not ask for more and more :)Overall, I highly recommend this Acer C720 chromebook to those who are considering a secondary laptop besides the working computer.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding piece of technology
Reviews.Author: Seth J Danneman
Reviews.Content: Just an amazing piece of technology.  The screen size is just about perfect, the resolution is just right, and the speed is AMAZING!  Excellent notebook concept for "supplementing" your desktop.  The price of 199$ for this haswell dual core cpu and ssd provide outstanding speed and value for your daily needs.  Don't hesitate on picking one or two of these up ;)  The Chrome OS seems very mature.

Reviews.Title: I love it!!!!
Reviews.Author: Tommy J
Reviews.Content: Wow! This really a great computer. I love the OP system. It based on Unix/Linux so no virus checkers are necessary..Super fast and light as a feather. Down load the manual lots of info. There is a learning curve, but well worth it.Watch Netflix and be amazed at the speed. Get the Netflix app from the google store, free.The cloud drive is super fast. The Chrome browser works great, but there is a learning curve for an old Foxie.

Reviews.Title: great for the price just to get on line
Reviews.Author: james shuey
Reviews.Content: for the price its great only needed one for the wife to use to go on face book  and games

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: Ruth
Reviews.Content: I have had this for a few weeks now and I love it!  It works very well on the internet and the google notepad works great.  Worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: great!
Reviews.Author: testni_hamo2
Reviews.Content: It's cheap and nice. Battery lasts long. It's light and easy to carry around. I recommend it to non power-users.

Reviews.Title: Great alternative for non-savvy users
Reviews.Author: Hashwin Singh
Reviews.Content: I bought the chromebook for my mother who I would describe as a technophobe. As she had experience using an android interface, the transition was seamless. Perfect for watching videos and internet surfing.

Reviews.Title: a brilliant little inexpensive machine
Reviews.Author: norrie
Reviews.Content: I love this little computer.  Even though I can't print yet without the purchase of a special printer for chromebook I get  a greatdeal of fun with it.  I don't play games but could if I wanted to.  The graphics are brilliant and it is fast at downloadingmy email, Netflix, youtube and lots of other things.  I love it!!

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Steven
Reviews.Content: This product is fast as hell ! I did not expect such great performances with such a low price :)

Reviews.Title: speed
Reviews.Author: Jane Woodham
Reviews.Content: it is so quick, great, but long battery quickly used up as you can't seem to turn if off. Google docs very basic, so only 4 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: Seems pretty solid...
Reviews.Author: Joshua B. Smith "Joshua B. Smith"
Reviews.Content: The thing I wanted most from a Chromebook was the portability, battery life and solid physical shape of the computer. The Acer C720 seems to fit the bill just right.I have only had it a very short time, but I can see why Chromebooks are being used more and more folks around the world. Considering so much of what we do every day on our computers exists online and in streaming format (netflix, facebook, twitter, online shopping) there isn't need for every computer in the house to be able to edit and store a ton of photos and games and music (though with the minimal storage built into the C720 you have room for at least some of what you would like to have close at hand).I needed a backup laptop to head to work and school with me, and this fits nicely into my bag. To keep it from getting scratched I'm going to get a little laptop sleeve for it. I think its body could withstand a few tumbles and tosses, though.Hope you found this review helpful, feel free to leave a comment if you have any questions! :)

Reviews.Title: Woot hoot
Reviews.Author: Evelyn Davila "Re Creating"
Reviews.Content: This Purchased was for my cousin who is enjoying it very much. I reccomend this purchase. He is online with a camera.

Reviews.Title: Just love it
Reviews.Author: slowbutshure
Reviews.Content: This has become my go to internet device. It has that quick start that the fruit people brag about, a long battery life, and a convenient browser interface. I take it along when I go out to lunch some days to check mails or read at the local subway. Thin compact and light. I find it more useful since I prefer a real keyboard over just a touch screen. I get more than enough touch screen keyboard use on my phone. I do not try and use it for heavy business applications or other work as a remote access device like the other reviewers. The cloud print capability is very useful though, and I recommend it. The only problem I have experienced so far is with some hotel wifi systems. There have been some places where my laptop would connect, but this would not. Usually by tinkering with the wifi settings, I eventually get it connected. The browser is still a work in progress, functional now, but I am sure will continue to evolve to an even better feature set over time. This is my favorite electronic gadget!

Reviews.Title: Fast, easy, but no users' manual
Reviews.Author: jpneal "jpn"
Reviews.Content: Really a great asset to internet access. Only complaint I have is the lack of more detailed operating instructions. I did figure out that with no delete key, press ALT + Backspace to delete. Other secrets lie beneath and are, as yet, undiscovered.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: David Pinson
Reviews.Content: Bargain buy for a well featured chromebook - so fast to boot up and get on the net, keyboard is great and battery life phenomenal.

Reviews.Title: It came rather quickly
Reviews.Author: Frankie Perrino
Reviews.Content: I love my new Cromebook very much.  It's run very quick.  If you're thinking about getting a notebook, then get this one  :-)

Reviews.Title: Simple to use and fast
Reviews.Author: Anton
Reviews.Content: The Chromebook sets up in minutes if you already have a gmail account.  It makes you wonder how other non-Chromebook systems need to be so complex.  It is intuitive to use and is fast.  battery life is also surprisingly good.

Reviews.Title: Chrome book
Reviews.Author: Kyle Gray
Reviews.Content: I was unhappy with a Surface so I tried the chromebook. Even with real MS Word on it I was less than comfortable typing on the Surface. The keyboard on the Chromebook is almost perfect and the speed in accessing the net is as advertised. Much more convenient than the Surface which is gathering dust in my basement...

Reviews.Title: one of the best bang for buck netbooks out there.
Reviews.Author: Chance
Reviews.Content: This thing is rad. Excellent battery life. Good display and lightweight. The keyboard was just the right size. I really like the chromeOS, it's simple and straightforward. All-around great value.

Reviews.Title: Love It!!!
Reviews.Author: SteMan
Reviews.Content: I have a desktop computer, Android phone, Kindle, iPad, etc.  I have them all.  The Acer Chromebook is my favorite for quickly answering emails.  The iPad and my phone I answer quick emails, but I used to hold off on replies that required a lot of typing.With the Acer Chromebook, it turns on super fast and with the attached keyboard it makes answering emails with a longer response a snap.  I have also used it to take notes at meetings without worrying about plugging it in because the battery lasts so long.  The problem with my laptop is the batter lasts two hours only.

Reviews.Title: Acer C720 Lasted less than 90 days, warranty won't cover.
Reviews.Author: Russell Burns
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Acer C720 less than 3 months ago on March 20th and the display developed a black spot on the left side and multi colored lines running up and down the screen.  Contacted Acer for warranty repair and was informed that they would not cover this as they said it was from physical damage and that was not covered.  They offered their standard laptop repair at $199, same price I payed for it.  Acer did offer to repair for $99 for "customer satisfaction", but I don't think spending an additional $99 for such a fragile device is worth it. I think I'll put that $99 towards the purchase a better built product.  I'm very disappointed that Acer won't honor their one year warranty period.  I was happy with the speed of this Chromebook, but the quality of the Acer C720 is very poor by my standards. My first and last Acer product.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Timothy Schilling "Timmy"
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful item for those who just like to touch base, post and do some internet searching.  Anyone who wants something bigger then their phone screens but without all the extra stuff a standard laptop gives you (that you more then like would not use), this is perfect.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: mujer
Reviews.Content: Just what sister was looking for:  perfect for surfing the internet, email, social media, online shopping.  Would recommend for these tasks

Reviews.Title: Quick start up
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Bax
Reviews.Content: This is a great little laptop. Does all the things we need with quick start-up. No more waiting. Battery is holding a charge well and extremely portable.

Reviews.Title: Acer 720 Chromebook
Reviews.Author: Martin E Wilson
Reviews.Content: Acer C 720 ChromebookBecause after a few hiccups on start, it has worked very, very well. It could use better instructions all problems have to be solved using youtube or forums.

Reviews.Title: Acer Chromebook
Reviews.Author: Donna M Mulcahy
Reviews.Content: Love the Chromebook. It is mainly for internet use although has ability to store some files. The only thing I dont like is that it doesnt accept all apps. Lightweight, convenient, fast

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Jeff Van Note
Reviews.Content: Great product.  Very happy with my purchase. Does everything I was expecting it to do. Much more convenient than using a tablet.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Ria Rue "Riarue"
Reviews.Content: I love this Acer C720 Chromebook.  Maybe the touchpad needs a little improvement but overall I love this product.  I'm hoping to buy the Acer Chromebook with a touch screen later.

Reviews.Title: Chromebook one month later
Reviews.Author: seeker
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife. Her laptop died. Monies tight, so after a little research I bought her a Chromebook. So far she is enjoying it. It gets her on facebook and email and she can play her games.She downloads her embroidery designs to a flash drive which we can view on our desktop PC.All in all it is working out.

Reviews.Title: 2GB working fine
Reviews.Author: Daniel Rocha
Reviews.Content: I set mine to dual-boot Ubuntu and had some initial regret about only getting 2 GB, yet even under heavy use I pop up the performance monitor and haven't yet maxed out the RAM. Impressive speed and capabilities, but up-close you can see it's an inexpensive laptop.

Reviews.Title: Awesome value, fast little computer
Reviews.Author: Curtis Clements
Reviews.Content: The Acer C720 is everything I wanted.  I bought it to do Java programming at school and so far it's been everything I've ever needed.  I had to install Linux on top of Chrome OS, but that isn't too hard to figure out how to do online.  The machine is fast.  For $250 this is an insane deal and I would recommend it to anyone that would like a small, light, fast linux machine.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good for the price
Reviews.Author: Rachel Rosenthal
Reviews.Content: I was considering buying a new laptop to replace my Macbook that's getting old but didn't really have the cash to spend on that right now. I already have a desktop at home and a laptop for work so this device would mainly be used for surfing the web, shopping, watching videos. The pros are price, amazing battery life, very lightweight and has a keyboard. I do find that some of the videos I watch sound a bit grainy on this device though.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: mc
Reviews.Content: Terrific speed; virus proof; fun to use; holds charge over 8 hours. Great product; self updating; excellent keyboard. Buy one and see!

Reviews.Title: Works better than described!
Reviews.Author: Sally Maimoni
Reviews.Content: I really like this new Chromebook.  It has a beautiful display, it loads quickly and easy to navigate.My two issues with it are the Bluetooth didn't connect as expected and the drag and drop is a little heavy-handed.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Leandro
Reviews.Content: Perfect, its the future right now.We can do everything with this computer, and its slim, and quickly, Google is the best!

Reviews.Title: c720 chromebook
Reviews.Author: veleasea l cromartie
Reviews.Content: Great product. I absolutely enjoying this product. I still have a lot to learn. I am trying to figure out how to download movies onto it. But I love it. I take it everywhere with me.

Reviews.Title: This is my 3rd
Reviews.Author: dennyandcarrie
Reviews.Content: My personal Chromebook is the C720P touchscreen. I have purchase 2 more C720 no touch screens for others. All three have worked flawlessly. I don't think I will ever need to use Windows again. I personally do not think the touch screen portion is worth the extra money. If the keyboard was removable the touch screen would be great. I also have had several friends that have purchase one and they also tell me they will probably never go back to Windows either.

Reviews.Title: Great product for the price!
Reviews.Author: Ryan Carmichael
Reviews.Content: When my last laptop wouldn't power up anymore, I started looking for a new one. The only thing my laptop has been used for in the past couple years is letting my daughter watch youtube videos or play games on PBS's web site. I also occasionally surf the web and maybe once in a while do a video chat/Skype.With those requirements in mind, I wanted to get the cheapest laptop I could find. I am not a big Windows 8 fan (my now-dead laptop was running Linux) and of course Macs are too expensive, so I started looking at Chromebooks. To be honest this was the cheapest one I could find with decent reviews, and at only $199 I thought I'd give it a try.I'm pretty impressed with ChromeOS as a whole. It boots very quickly, and this C720 has a good battery life (4 or 5 hours with youtube watching). The screen quality isn't the best but the resolution is acceptable. As you would expect, pretty much everything is based around Chrome and it all works pretty well.One thing that is a downside of ChromeOS and not this particular product is that since everything revolves around Chrome, any Chrome extensions you install have the opportunity to mess the system up pretty good. After a couple weeks of really poor performance after installing (and uninstalling) some extensions, I did a system restore (which was very easy/fast from the menu). After that, I just didn't install any extensions and it has been working great ever since.The device is really light and easy to carry around. It doesn't feel exceptionally sturdy.. I'm not sure how many drops it will survive.Sure I'd like it to be a little bit faster, have a higher resolution, more RAM, etc. But for the price point, this really is an amazing product.

Reviews.Title: developer mode and crouton
Reviews.Author: Andrew J Madison
Reviews.Content: If you don't know what the subject line says, then my comments will not mean much to you. However for the money, you can turn this tablet with attached keyboard into a great little machine. I've turned the machine into a multi-OS machine, and can do chromos things, and then run ubuntu. I've since installed libreoffice and have a true off-line machine, where I can copy/download documents and spreadsheets, and work on them without an internet, of deal with chromos' fussy word processor, though libre-writer has its foibles as well.

Reviews.Title: smooth performance
Reviews.Author: juan jose
Reviews.Content: Pros: Better performance than ARM Chromebooks; Matte display reduces glare; Runs cool; Affordable price; Good battery life;Cons: Dim display; Bland design; Limited app selectionFor what it is, it has worked fine for me. I wold have liked to know how limited chromebooks were before I purchased, I would have bought a cheap laptop for a little more, like this one http://amzn.to/1lRTt26Still thats no reason to reduce the rating, for what it does, its an excellent performer

Reviews.Title: Good Product
Reviews.Author: Melinda S DeRossett
Reviews.Content: This was exactly what I was looking for.  The only thing I don't like is there is no nook app for it.

Reviews.Title: replace ChromeOS with Linux and enjoy the benefits
Reviews.Author: Tiger128
Reviews.Content: I replaced the ChromeOS with Linux, and voila, I have a long battery life, lightweight, portable development machine.2GB is quite sufficient for ...- running all browser based apps (such as Google spreadsheets, gmail etc.)- browsing in dozens of tabs- running LEMP/LAMP stack based web development environment (includes Apache/Nginx, MySQL, PHP etc.)- running the Java-based Netbeans IDE- running several local terminal sessions- running several remote SSH sessionsALL of the above AT THE SAME TIME!CONS:The reason for only 4 stars are couple things that hobble an otherwise great machine:- the manufacturer originally came up with a 4GB RAM version (which would have been even better) for $50 more, but now it is nowhere to be found (for found only at unreasonable marked up prices)- the ChromeOS keyboard is horrible. It doesn't have several commonly used keys such as ... DELETE, F11, F12, PgUp, PgDn etc. Not sure what they were thinking.

Reviews.Title: acer maker of the chromebook c720
Reviews.Author: ruth handel
Reviews.Content: I love this chromebook my family owns one the interface is so friendly it really grew on me over the last few weeks this laptop is light and unbreakable to some point. It fell many times and still works like its brand new.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop for doing work with my middle school son!!!
Reviews.Author: Mike Reynolds
Reviews.Content: No problems to report and easy to use. If you need a laptop for Netflix, small tasks  and simple everyday stuff this is for you...It boots up quick too...

Reviews.Title: Nice product for the price
Reviews.Author: Sebastian Vallejo "malchuchaki"
Reviews.Content: I like this product, is good for internet connection, is fast to start up, l like chrome os, but i would like that in the future it will come with support for some hardware, but is perfect for taking with you to every place.

Reviews.Title: Bought for my aging husband.....
Reviews.Author: agjf
Reviews.Content: Who is in a personal care facility.  He wanted to stay in touch with his children and visa versa.  A PC was a bit difficult for him so I thought that an Android computer wouild be easier.  Once he learned that he how to sign in he was good to go.  Now he is branching out and using it to search.

Reviews.Title: Really Nice Little Item!
Reviews.Author: R. J. Hollis "Music Man"
Reviews.Content: I did not want to upgrade my old computer after XP stopped being supported.  This Chromebook is a big browser.  It's always up to date and easy to navigate.  I like it a lot and it fits my needs perfectly.

Reviews.Title: My man loves this notebook
Reviews.Author: Sandra D. Beeman "Sandra in PA"
Reviews.Content: Apparently there are things you can do with this notebook that is better than an ipad or laptop.  He is mainly using it forwork application.  We have p.c.s, Macs, ipads, and Surface Pro.  This has enough other interesting facets to it that makes itworth owning.  More specifics, you would have to ask him.

Reviews.Title: im posting this from my Cromebook now
Reviews.Author: shopaholic
Reviews.Content: i love this computer only problem is that it doesnt  have DVD. i wouldnt get it for school, i just use it for social networking and shopping.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic gift for my teenager!
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Simpson
Reviews.Content: This works awesome, great laptop for my teenager.  For what this is, you can't beat the price!  Easy to tote around, and also made well.

Reviews.Title: The Acer Chromebook is simply the cheapest high-functioning laptop available
Reviews.Author: Michael Sharp
Reviews.Content: Before placing my order, I was deeply concerned that I would be wasting 200 bucks on a piece of crap. I could not have been more wrong. The Acer C720 Chromebook gives you a fully functioning computer, a solid hardware, fast internet, and thousands of free Google apps and games, all for the price of a couple tanks of gasoline. What more could you ask for? It's exceptionally lightweight, which makes it easy to travel with. The battery lasts an astonishing 9 hours without requiring a recharge. The internet is lighting fast, the user face is simple. The Chromebook gives you every important function for a remarkably low price. I couldn't recommend it more highly!

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised
Reviews.Author: Benjamin D. Lapointe "benlap"

Reviews.Content: I bought this Chrome Book as a cheap laptop that I could connect all the time to my main TV through an HDMI cable to watch internet movies and videos.  Then I found out that it makes a fast wireless connection to the Chrome Cast on my TV from any website.  That wasn't the case with my Windows laptops that only made a fast connection with the Chrome Cast from websites that were already set up for Chrome Cast. The Google Drive is also very useful since it includes Word, Excel, Power Point, etc.  Now I am buying a second Chrome Book because my son took over the first one. Reviews.Title: Great second family laptop
Reviews.Author: Andrew D Moore
Reviews.Content: Yes, there are a few tasks I need a different operating system to complete, but overall I can do pretty much all common computer tasks fine with this Chromebook. With vim and ShiftEdit, I even do a good chunk of Web development with this computer. I still take video editing and rom tinkering elsewhere, but this little guy is great for just about everything else I've thrown at it. The built-in terminal works fine, and there's enough storage space for transferring materials around. Certain tasks are still a little rough around the edges (working with zip files could be smoother, for example), but overall, I'm more surprised by what I CAN do on the Chromebook, rather than the other way around. If you are the "tech support" family member and need to suggest a consumer laptop for a less technical family member, the Chromebook could be a godsend for you and for them. You'll need to convert Microsoft Office use to Google Drive use (works fine for me, but I don't really created sophisticated layouts. Chrome's Excel replacement is really quite good now, with much better formula options), but other than that, I think most computer users would be foolish not to consider Chromebooks. The price alone makes them worth a look and with Haswell in them the battery life is great. A few things to keep in mind: wifi must be reliable, new users need to be patient and develop easy (but possibly different) workflows, you may need to search a bit for extensions in the Chrome store to replace a few Windows/OSX functionality, and it may be easier to buy a newer printer for use with Google print if you need to print a lot. I'm quite pleased with this machine and I would not be surprised if ChromeOS ends up as a new Windows in terms of widespread use. With its cloud-first leaning and the ease with which users can switch computers (even to other operating systems with the Chrome browser installed), it's really a great choice for mobile workers. It also really lends itself to use in schools, so the next generation will be well-versed in its functionality and well-aware of its budget-friendliness... a great take-to-college machine for students on a budget.

Reviews.Title: Chromebook

Reviews.Title: A really good secondary computer, but only a secondary computer.
Reviews.Author: raginkestrel
Reviews.Content: This Chromebook's software is very fast and smooth. The device is light and quite thin. However, Chromebooks still have a lot of features missing. Printer support is where I encountered a serious lack of functionality. If you have an Android phone, you can send your print jobs to it, as Android has good driver support from printer manufacturers.Trying to access your printer directly via Google Cloud Print is useless, unless you have a Windows computer running all the time, with a printer attached to it.Another problem that I encountered was finding a good calculator program. Chrome OS has a very basic calculator, but if you want to calculate anything more than basic math, then you either have to get a full-blown scientific calculator from the Chrome Web Store, or calculators that are really buggy. Very frustrating, as all I needed to do was calculate percentages.One final issue that I had, was that I had to use my Google account password as the device password. That required me to dumb down my password, so I could remember it. Normally I have a password manager create a complicated password and then sign in to my Google account using the manager. Why Google choose this method when Android allows you to create a device password is a mystery to me. Apparently, Google thinks you will only be accessing their services on a Chromebook!When it comes to using Google services and accessing the web, this Chromebook really shines. Do not purchase a Chromebook if you need a full desktop system! That being said, I am happy with my purchase. I bought a refurbished model, and I have had no trouble with it at all. Acer designs a great Chromebook.
