Reviews.Title: Blows my expectations away!
Reviews.Author: Josh from Midtown
Reviews.Content: I bought this Chromebook in a pinch. My Windows 8 laptop from Gateway suffered a sudden screen-break and was no longer usable. I had to have a computer, so I went out and bought this at OfficeMax, as it was the same price as on Amazon. I figured I would be able to browse the web, check email, and write papers. I wasn't expecting much more than that, but I that was all I needed at the time being. I soon found out that this little Chromebook could do much more than that.On my old computer I would download music from online (hip hop mixtapes mostly, which aren't always available through iTunes or Google Play) and then upload it to my Google Music account, so I can access the music anywhere. To upload music on WIndows 8 you need an actual program downloaded from Google. I assumed that since Chromebook doesn't support traditional programs that I would no longer be able to download or upload to the cloud. However, after downloading an album that came as a .zip file, I found that there are browser-based unZIP software, as well as programs to download torrent files, and you can upload music via the browser.This thing is great. I'm typing this review from it now and typing is not difficult or strained. I thought the small keyboard would affect my typing ability but I was wrong. Will definitely be recommending these to friends who are in the laptop business.

Reviews.Title: Exceeded my expectations
Reviews.Author: Kelsey Jones of MoxieDot
Reviews.Content: I wanted a smaller, lighter computer for when I'm traveling for clients or to conferences. I thought that it would be cheap and clunky, but it has been AMAZING. It even feels better on my wrists when I am typing on it on my lap (I also have a Toshiba Satellite that is thicker, hence the wrist and hand ache because of the angle).Many people say that it is dependent on the internet, but there has never been a time when it has "Screwed" me over because I didn't have the internet. I can still type my notes or documents normally and then it will sync them up to my Google Drive once I get online again. And think about it, when are you not without internet?

Reviews.Title: Great product, Arrive on time

Reviews.Content: great product, I'm pretty happy. And most importantly arrive at the time indicated by the seller.The quality and design left me quite satisfied, and the working speed is sufficient for my work

Reviews.Title: Fast, convenient, and flimsy
Reviews.Author: Anneliese Marvelous
Reviews.Content: This is a great affordable little machine for users who do a lot of writing and reading on the go and are comfortable working with cloud storage via Google Drive. It's fast and reliable, incredibly lightweight and fairly easy to use. I recommend it highly as a portable second computer for a moderately tech-savvy person. I wouldn't recommend it to someone as an only computer or to someone who isn't comfortable occasionally googling around to figure out a problem.My biggest complaints are not reasons to avoid purchasing this Chromebook, but things I'd wish I'd known prior to my purchase. While the apps available through the Google Play store are overall very helpful, switching between non-Google file types can be tricky. Mostly for me that's dealing with Windows documents, such as .docx. I've also had some trouble with media files, especially video and sound, that I'm still trying to sort out. Streaming works well, but opening previously downloaded files is not so simple.The biggest criticism I've encountered in about a month of ownership is just how flimsy the hardware is. It's something a few reviews mentioned, but it didn't really jump out at me until I got my own. About two weeks after I bought my Chromebook, my medium-sized dog bumped it off the table and stepped on the (closed) Chromebook. It booted up and works absolutely fine, but the upper-left hand corner of the screen is a grey block and there's a weird green line running down the screen. I would definitely recommend buying the purchase protection plan for this laptop. I am filing a claim with my credit card in hopes it'll be covered.I might be slightly biased because my ASUS K50 is an absolute tank and has weathered a lot more damage in 6 years of ownership. It also weighs 6 times as much, which is why I upgraded to the Chromebook.Still, I like this machine a lot and I'd buy it again. I carry it almost everywhere for work and I love how fast and convenient it is. I will be investing in a good cover, though.

Sure, I laughed at first being the techie that I am but then it I looked it over and was sold.  Thanks to Amazon and FedEx (One Day Shipping), I received the Chromebook less than 24 hours after I placed the order.The Chromebook works great and I can't rule out buying myself one in the future.  This is an Intel based one (Haswell) that offers more than enough speed for quick browsing experience. Quick and easy access to Youtube and Gmail as well.  If you or anyone you know lives on Google's portal, buying a Chromebook is a no-brainer.

Reviews.Title: Amazing laptop (A mac user's review)
Reviews.Author: RainyNW
Reviews.Content: I have seen some junky sub-$1000 laptops. Lets say this is not one of them. But this laptop does not run Windows, so that might be the main reason.Don't bother with the extra memory (32GB), as I have no idea what to even do with even 16GB on such a laptop. The only use extra memory would be likely involves reformatting the device and installing a new operating system. Everything you do is stored in the cloud. Save yourself some money and get the cheapest unit.Everything you do on this computer, even the settings, runs in the Chrome browser. It is a bit underwhelming at first, but it will make up for it in vast speed. Pages load instantly. The latest HTML5 apps run amazingly well. It is an extremely fast computer that just happens to have a 1.4GHz processor, 2GB of RAM and a small flash drive.For those linux hardcore users, the development mode can dump you to a unix prompt with just about everything else one would need to do...but this is optional.I will be buying this computer again for another kid. Or perhaps a 3rd unit (i find it great for casual web browsing while my wife uses the macbook air for school)

Reviews.Title: Want a Chromebook?  Get this one
Reviews.Author: David Carper
Reviews.Content: It's hard to beat the C720 at this price point.  It's more than capable of running Crouton off an (upgraded) SSD, or off of an SD card or USB thumbdrive.  With Crouton running a copy of Ubuntu, you've got a very wide selection of games off of Steam, emulators, and other programs, and still retain all the simplicity of ChromeOS with a simple keystroke combination.  It's technically possible to just wipe ChromeOS out completely and turn it into a simple $200 Linux notebook, which it's certainly effective as, too!Even without installing Crouton and things like that, the default ChromeOS is still plenty useful and has a lot of options, especially with the included Google Drive storage.Just be aware that without Internet access, there's not much a default Chromebook is capable of doing.

Reviews.Title: Can't think of a reason to go back to my laptop
Reviews.Author: Joshua Kiewit
Reviews.Content: I got this thing yesterday, have used it for a total of about 5 hours, and still have 30% life left, web pages load quicker than on my other two PC's, and this thing is so light. Only reason I'll use my laptops again are for photo and video programs. This thing is awesome.

Reviews.Title: GREAT
Reviews.Author: Jose M Aguirre Sr
Reviews.Content: Is a great machine for Young children, fast and clear!! I recomended for homework and game play, is very usualy.

Reviews.Title: Acer C720
Reviews.Author: Tim Fulgham
Reviews.Content: I've been very happy with my purchase. Serves its purpose for me very well . Also very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: pretty awesome
Reviews.Author: Nathaniel
Reviews.Content: only complaint. can't run applications. installed linux, which was a bit of a chore, but well worth it. buy its worth what you pay.

Reviews.Title: I really liked it.
Reviews.Author: Carmen Gabriel
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my nine years old daughter, she likes it very much, I think is an excellent product for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great travel computer
Reviews.Author: Mike Williams
Reviews.Content: It is taking a little bit of getting used to all the differences of a chromebook but I am enjoying the new computer. It is lightweight and great for the constant carrying I do back and forth to work.

Reviews.Title: Best purchase ever!!
Reviews.Author: Tessa
Reviews.Content: Best little computer ever!!! I have told all my friends and family about it. Amazing value!!! Internet is very fast and the keyboard is a

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my needs... pricing, speed, functions
Reviews.Author: Annie T
Reviews.Content: So glad I purchased this little machine!  I still have my HP laptop but it's much, much slower (and older) but it's a completely different "laptop" than the Chromebook.You open lid of CB and it turns on within about 2 - 3 seconds.  No sound, no sign of a fan running, no glitches.  Just smooth as silk...  it seems like it's not really "on", it's that quiet!Fast.  Fun.  Keyboard is a little smaller than I'm used to, but it's big enough to very, very easily get used to, and to actually USE.Can't think of a thing I don't like about it - the price is great.  Has the HDMI port so I can simply hook my HDMI cable from CB to TV (both, obviously, have the HDMI ports, otherwise it wouldn't work!). So right now I've rid myself of NASTY Dish Network (I say this because they treat their employees like garbage, and I'm being generous with this comment...)  Yes, Dish has ok technology.  So do their competitors, plus if you have high-speed internet, you can access everything that way.  So forget about paying the outrageous fees for being able to watch a wide variety of shows & movies.  Use the internet - Hulu Plus, Netflix, Amazon Prime, etc. and pay a nominal monthly fee and watch shows/movies whenever you want.Love this Chromebook.  Very glad I finally purchased it.  It's very thin & sleek.  Lightweight.  And it's built very well - not flimsy, not cheap feeling.  It's sturdy and super light.  That, along with the speed and absolutely no fan noise or any type of noise, it's a treat!  And a GREAT buy!

Reviews.Title: Thoughts!
Reviews.Author: Carlos Torres
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a device that is a laptop and aren't wanting to waste a lot of money! Well this is the solution to your problem!

Reviews.Title: Very Good Buy for secondary computer
Reviews.Author: Patrick Murphy
Reviews.Content: It works well for what I need it for. I already have a desktop and just wanted something mobile with web access that I can write papers and make presentations on. I would not recommend it as the primary computer one owns though; it can't download any program of significance (unless you convert it to Linix, but that has its own problems) and its offline functionality is severely limited. Overall a good computer though, just make sure its what you want.

Reviews.Title: Love!
Reviews.Author: Momi
Reviews.Content: Purchased my first laptop ever.Great ever since the first day i got it. No problems at all. I recommend it to all first time buyers:) Sound quality is good and so is the camera.Battery life is awesome and surprisingly long.

Reviews.Title: Just wonderful!
Reviews.Author: Alan P. Dutcher "alzie"
Reviews.Content: The HW is great, batt life is great, and it boots fast.It has every thing that i need in a note book.How ever, i was under whelmed by ChromeOS.Its totally dead off line.I really need to use it off line.Sooo, the other reason i bought it is thatthe hacker hobbyist people have ported Bodhi Linux to run on it.I have installed it, and now the unit can be completely stand alone.I m a very happy camper!I highly recommend the C720.

Reviews.Title: bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: carson
Reviews.Content: I have this device and it is def a bang for your dollat. It isnt the fastest one out there but for what you pay you get value for every cent.

Reviews.Title: bought it for my boyfriend, who LOVES it so far
Chose this over a tablet & am very pleased
Reviews.Author: Zoo "zooropatv"
Reviews.Content: Bottom line:  I needed something inexpensive to browse the web etc. while the desktop computer / media center was otherwise busy, and something to do a little bit of work during the week.  I considered the full slate of Android and iOS tablets as well as inexpensive Windows laptops.I was very impressed with the specs on the C720.  After my first weekend with it I'm thrilled with the purchase.  It's light enough and small enough to go anywhere easily but provides a good interface to "get stuff done."  Add the ability to install Linux if you're a DIY'er and it really is a great device.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Adam
Reviews.Content: Very nice for the price and faster than the Samsumg x303.  I have to say that then Samsung has a much nicer keyboard. Ubuntu runs pretty well on this Chromebook.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: I love it. The keyboard is easy to use. The internet is super fast. Just a click one blink ,and it's there. I'm a student so it meets all my needs and more. Thank you, ACER you make the best computers/ chromebooks/laptops. The seller also, shipped it extremely fast a day before expected delivery.

Reviews.Title: Acer C720 + Ubuntu 13.10 = Full featured and fast laptop for $200
Reviews.Author: brismuth
Reviews.Content: I got this for my wife and immediately installed Ubuntu 13.10 with Crouton. Installation and setup were a breeze and she couldn't be happier. All the drivers work great and she's never had any problems with it at all. 32GB SSD is plenty for what she's doing (mostly running Microsoft Word with Wine in Ubuntu or Gimp/Inkscape for minor photo editing projects). Great deal!

Reviews.Title: An Excellent Product!
Reviews.Author: Leon Fraser
Reviews.Content: Excellent! I am very happy I bought it! Highly recommended....especially to parents and by extension, students, who can't afford the high-priced units.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: bobbi lee johnson
Reviews.Content: i am very happy with this works great its fast and does everything i want and need just wish it has a place to put c.d's in

Reviews.Title: Small and speedy
Reviews.Author: Mary R.
Reviews.Content: I don't do heavy gaming and graphic things.  I needed word processing and web browsing.  This little thing is perfect.  Boots up so fast that I don't have time to fetch a cup of coffee while I wait for it like I did with my windows operating system.  I'm still figuring a few things out here and there and the keyboard is a bit more compact so I have be most diligent in making sure I have my fingers on the right keys but it is really great!!!  I did buy a mouse to go with it though because I just don't do so well with those finger pads but it could be that it is because I had gotten so used to having a mouse. Anyway, highly recommended for someone who doesn't need all the bells and whistles of a high speed gaming machine.  If you want something that is very portable with excellent battery life and  doesn't cost too much this could be perfect for you too!

Reviews.Title: I THINK ITS GREAT!!!!
Reviews.Author: Garrett Van Tassel
Reviews.Content: I bought this computer as an upgrade to my old IBM laptop which did not work very well any more online.I had no problem setting it up, It was just like working with my old device running XP. getting help for almost any problem is just a click away. If you can't  find the answer in the computer there are forums out there for you to go to.you can even email google for help. I have not found any thing that I don't like about this machine. When you get one just got to the built in help and try to learn something every day about your chromebook. then go to youtube and check out the videos on your model. I have had my c720 about 3 weeks now. I recommend this for just about anybody. I am 61 and I had no problem making the switch from XP to Chromebook. I only regret not making the switch sooner.

Reviews.Title: loving it!
Reviews.Author: C. Conciatori
Reviews.Content: I have had my chromebook for about a month now and I'm loving it.  I especially love the fast bootup (as that was one of the reasons that I wasn't using my old laptop).  It's so light, but have not encountered anything I can't do on it that I normally do on my old laptop.  Overall I am very happy with my purchase and am using this as my main computer.

Reviews.Title: acer chromebook
Reviews.Author: olddice
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed, I cannot say enough for the price and the product. You will not be sorry if you purchase this product.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: Louise Bastarache
Reviews.Content: Chrome book works a little diffidently. It has apps. I like it very much so far. Have to use the "enter bottom on the keyboard after signing in. No enter on the screen. That was confusing. It turns on very quick. For the price, it is good. I don't use it for a lot of functions. I like my ipad.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: D.Juelfs
Reviews.Content: great product for school and work. Very light and compact with an amazing battery. Highly recommended if looking for a reliable laptop.

Reviews.Title: nice bang for buck
Reviews.Author: Leroy Hill
Reviews.Content: Does most everything needed.  Setting up printer and scanners are a pain in the ...  Other than that an excellent laptop.

Reviews.Title: I have to get use to Chrome OS
Reviews.Author: Rosemary Parker
Reviews.Content: I like it, but I am still getting use to the chrome OS. I had no idea that it is a lot different than what I am use to - Windows OS. I am getting help from my granddaughter who has knowledge of learning about the Chrome/Cloud OS in computer class at School. It is still a bit of a challenge for me but I am learning

Reviews.Title: great delivery
Reviews.Author: Lanisha
Reviews.Content: Everything is Great I haven't used the laptop yet i bought it for my son's birthday in may im sure he will love it

Reviews.Title: The best performing chromebook for the money
Reviews.Author: D. ALGER
Reviews.Content: This is not a laptop - it is a small, cheap device that let's my kids learn and play online.I chose this chromebook over other cheap ones because it has a real computer processor and not a smart phone processor so it performs really well even when loading the largest google documents / presentations.I also chose a chromebook over a real laptop because I don't want my kids installing viruses and messing it up all the time.  I spend no time cleaning them off and they each have exactly what they need to get their school work done and nothing more.You can also print to any printer hooked up to a PC running special software though I recommend getting a printer with wireless capabilities built in if you don't already have one.  Brother Printer HL3140CW is a great color laser printer with built in wireless at a good price.  Search for 'Google Cloud Print' to learn more

Reviews.Title: Great couch computer - suits our needs very well
Reviews.Author: Travis Kline
Reviews.Content: We purchased this to be a second computer for our family and are very happy with the results. It is thin and light and has a great battery and does everything we need. Make sure you know about the Chrome OS and what it can and cannot do before you buy this. I did my research and for our needs - basic web surfing, YouTube videos, basic computer gaming for the kids - it does very well.The one thing I miss is a backlit keyboard. My work Macbook has this function and when the lights are down or someone is watching a movie not having lit keys makes it hard to type. But for $200 you cannot expect to get everything.

Reviews.Title: A fantastic little laptop.
Reviews.Author: Andrew Jared Stoehr
Reviews.Content: When I first started college, the laptop that I decided to buy was around 8 pounds.  While it was a beast of a laptop, and I could use it for playing video games really well, it was not too portable and I didn't like carrying it around.This year I decided to get one of these just for school and was blown away by how useful it it.  The battery lasts a very long time, it's usually only around halfway discharged after a full day of classes.  I use it for taking notes, listening to music, browsing the internet, watching movies and shows on Netflix - basically anything you could want out of an ultraportable laptop like this.  One of my favorite features of it is the HDMI port.  It's a breeze to pick out a movie on Neflix and just hook this little guy up to the TV to watch it.One of the drawbacks is that the ChromeOS isn't the most open operating system, but if you don't need this computer to do anything too crazy, this laptop is perfect.  Also, there are many sources that show how you can install a version of Linux on the it, which I personally have done and enjoy very much.

Reviews.Title: ACER C720 Chromebook
Reviews.Author: doknik
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I wanted for surfing internet, e-mail.  Lighting fast and about as light as my Kindle Fire. Love it.

Reviews.Title: Great value, Great portability
Reviews.Author: Luis
Reviews.Content: I just recently bought this Chromebook , but so far I like this Chromebook. I've only had it for a couple of days so I can't comment on the longevity of the product. I was lucky enough to get the Chromebook for $149.99. The laptop is very light and like other people have said, the battery will lasts upwards of 7-8 hours (depending on what you are doing). The laptop itself is thin but with a solid body. The body does not flex and the screen does not shake or move when you are typing. The keyboard is smaller than a full sized laptop but still very comfortable to use. The mouse pad is sensitive and has a built in button design.So far the Chromebook meets all my expectations. It is not a full size laptop , but it will do 90% of what a laptop will do. Given the great value and portability of this chromebook I highly recommend it as a backup or even a primary laptop.I've only had this for a week so I can't speak on its longevity , but I will update later on.

Reviews.Title: Acer C720
Reviews.Author: Barb Blackford
Reviews.Content: Actually it was a gift for my sister.  She loves the convince of the size, the weight and the 8 !/2 hour battery!  It does everything that her old computer did, but faster and with more ease.  Actually, when my computer dies, I will replace it with this unit.

Reviews.Title: Acer C720 Chromebook
Reviews.Author: Bill A
Reviews.Content: My wife really likes her new Acer C720 Chromebook she states that is much lighter to hold then our laptop. My wife has had no problems surfing the net.

Reviews.Title: My wife and I love this thing!
Reviews.Author: Donald Walker
Reviews.Content: The Acer C720 Chromebook is a great piece of technology. If you can live without software that has to be installed on a computer and only use apps and plugins that work with the Google Chrome browser - and there are a lot. This is a great $200 solution.As long as Google will continue to support Chromebooks for a few years, this purchase will have been well worth it.

Reviews.Title: C720 Acer
Reviews.Author: ILWeber "Lotus"
Reviews.Content: It definitely gets an A+  It is exactly what i was looking for. It gets the job done fast! I am happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: browse internet
Reviews.Author: bill
Reviews.Content: to browse the internet and video quality I give 4.5 out of 5 on speed if you have a old computer no comparasion I ordered to replace my windows xp think I made a good purchase this item tends to get all good reviews on youtube and websites I visited before ordering a must buy unless you have bad vision I would say this and all tablets for example my 80 year old stepdad but a great buy for anybody else acer exactly gets some of the better reviews of the chromebooks out there hooks up to tv but have to change the video quality for that easy to do once you figure it out

Reviews.Title: great productivity tool
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I use it mainly for productivity related tasks like paying bills, read books, C++ programming (through remote desktop), web browsing is great, google docs is good enough for most of my needs. Remote desktop is absultely necessary for me, it basically extends my powerful desktop to everywhere

Reviews.Title: Very Happy
Reviews.Author: Diomedes A. Gil
Reviews.Content: This pc is everything you need as a second pc if you do more than surf on the web. better than a tablet for typing. i'm very happy.

Reviews.Title: Good laptop
Reviews.Author: son nguyen
Reviews.Content: Very good battery life. Great price for a nice laptop. This will serve well for those who needs a dedicated internet laptop without the clutter of windows. Super fast booting and shutdown. Only took a couple of minutes to setup.

Reviews.Title: Acer C720
Reviews.Author: Lynn Dee Walther
Reviews.Content: Fast loading once you understand the language barrier. For English it s listed in the Spanish name Ingles. I do not like the fact that it cannot be set to public. This is the reason that I made the purchase.

Reviews.Title: If their were 12 more stars i would fill them in too!
Reviews.Author: James D. Sering Jr.
Reviews.Content: As we speak I am using my Chromebook C720 to write this review. I have owned and still own countless laptops. MSI GT70 and several Dell XPS models. But this is different. Its ease of use and features is top notch. Starts up in under 8 seconds and is very very fast!! I love being able to grab it and open the lid and it turns on and is ready to go before you even get comfortable to use it, its that quick! I would recommend this laptop to everyone that wants an inexpensive, very very functional, and all around perfect small laptop that acts big around all others,

Reviews.Title: If their were 12 more stars i would fill them in too!

I would recommend this laptop to everyone that wants an inexpensive, very very functional, and all around perfect small laptop that acts big around all others,

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: IK
Reviews.Content: This is the best laptop I have ever owned! Super speedy, opens quickly, and fantastic for people who are into the whole Google "ecosystem". If you want to download external programs outside of Google then it won't work. But this is not what it is for.Fantastic for the price, and very light. Would highgly recommend.

Reviews.Title: a very useful computer
Reviews.Author: aubyn norris
Reviews.Content: I purchasEd this product for my granddaughter and she likes it ver much.She is seven years old and is finding it very useful.

Reviews.Title: VERY HAPPY
Reviews.Author: LOUISE HARIHARAN
Reviews.Content: I BOUGHT THIS FOR MY DAUGHTER, SHE IS 12,  SHE CARRIES IT EVERYWHERE.ASLO READ SOME PEOPLE HAD PROBLEMS WITH NETFLIX, BUT WE HAVE NOT HADONE GETTING ON ANY SITE, AGAIN WE ARE VERY HAPPY.

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: Mechele
Reviews.Content: this was a nice investment.. i actually gave it to my son for his birthday.. he will work on getting set up and let me know.. if all goes well i will buy another one for myself.

Reviews.Title: Great for non techies
Reviews.Author: Christopher Mckinley
Reviews.Content: Got this for my 50 year old dad, hes not good with computers but he has no problem using this.He wishes the speakers were a bit louder though

Reviews.Title: Simple and Fast
Reviews.Author: Christian
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife. She loves it and when I asked her if she'd rather have a Macbook Air, she said no, she'd rather have this because if she drops it, she wouldn't feel bad. I can't complain. I've used it quite extensively as well. I can say that it's blazing fast. I have seen no speed issues and battery is very substantial - 2 full length movies on a full charge and some.

Reviews.Title: Great little laptop
Reviews.Author: S. Day
Reviews.Content: I didn't know what to think about Chromebooks at first, but after having one for a while, I have to admit that it's pretty neat!

Reviews.Title: Love this device!
Reviews.Author: Mr. Shopper
Reviews.Content: Recently sold an Asus Transformer with keyboard that was used for a couple of years and took the proceeds to purchase this via the Acer store as a refurb - EXCELLENT purchase!  The whole computing experience is even better than the Android tablet.  Don't get me wrong - Android on my phone is wonderful but when it comes to a larger device, where I tend to do/expect a little more, this Chromebook more than surpasses expectations.Chromebooks offer a computing experience, in my opinion, that closely mirror what one is already familiar with in a traditional PC environment - operation of the hardware, software functionality and overall familiarity make for a small learning curve.  I really also like that you can work offline with it - to an extent.  I've used it only once offline and that was to continue working on a document - it was a success.The Acer C720 is overall well designed.  It is thin, lightweight and they keyboard is comfortable to use - especially those of us who are old-school typists :) .  The screen is fine enough - this is at basic hardware and thus you have to expect some areas to be cost cutting.  However, the whole package makes for a great experience.Google is only going to improve the Chrome OS and these devices are going to continue reaping the benefits of those improvements.  Matched to Acer's hardware design and low-cost, they have a hit.  I can see why Chromebooks are picking up in popularity - lightweight, fast, easy to use and reasonable price now brings computing closer to what people as me want.  (I work in IT and believe me, LOVE, LOVE, LOVE the simplicity of this thing - I get sooooooo tired of babysitting technology, fixing its many issues at times.)I'm extremely pleased and look forward to using this Chromebook for the next several years.

Reviews.Title: Simply Awesome.
Reviews.Author: Anna Foley
Reviews.Content: Honestly I wasn't expecting much when I bought this. But it simply blew my expectations out of the water! It's fast, compact, and does exactly what I need it to. While it does suck to not have Skype and such, all of its apps make it very easy to use. Its battery life is just amazing, too. I highly recommend it to anyone who just needs something more than a phone to access the internet and have fun with on the go!

Reviews.Title: WiFi antenna has room for improvements and intermittent trackpad issues - otherwise great
Reviews.Author: Jacob Phillips
Reviews.Content: We've had some intermittent issues with the touchpad not working. It doesn't seem to matter if it is plugged into the wall outlet (electrical interference) or not. The WiFi antenna isn't as strong as my ThinkPad from the same location. Otherwise, it works great and serves it's purpose well.

Reviews.Title: its something
Reviews.Author: Devon
Reviews.Content: the laptop itself is well built, good audio, comfortable keyboard and despite others making claims to the contrary the screen is pretty good. With the default chrome OS its is very fast and responsive, startup time is almost instant, of course it 100% dependent on an active WiFi connection in order to do anything at all. The various Google services are read-ally available and load quick.If what your looking for is a system to access the internet and do general basic computer things, you always have wifi and want something it would be near impossible to screw up no matter how bad with computers you are crome os may be a good fit for you. I would recommend creating a google account just for the cromebook rather than using your primary one so you have access to all its features without the need to always be signed into your private accounts.I do like chrome but may  go ahead and install a more full featured Linux distro some time in the future. I may do a duel boot setup and keep crome, if you decide to do this I would make a full backup of the stock OS just in case you do want to revert back with ease.Note the 8 hour battery life is due to the processor underclocking itself if you do something process intensive like playing a video game for example you will not get anywhere near that

Reviews.Title: GREAT CHROMEBOOK
Reviews.Author: D Tab
Reviews.Content: This was intentionally for my 11 yr old son for school, but with our computer giving us problems my wife and I have loved this little chromebook and thinking about getting another for our personal use and business she has, we still haven't gotten a printer, but probably will in the near future, highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: Great product.
Reviews.Author: Scott Nuelken
Reviews.Content: Okay, it is a chromebook. aren't all chromebooks pretty much the same? The difference, today after a week of stuff breaking, my daughter dumped a drink in this thing, I unplugged it, shook it off, and it works! Thank Gee Golly Sugary Chocolate Marbles for great miracles! Also, I like it. Thanks for a good product. This review has been edited to meet Amazon guidlines.

Reviews.Title: Great inexpensive laptop.
Reviews.Author: BL
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small backup laptop for web surfing, that I would keep in my living room at all times. Based on the low cost and high reviews this model got I decided to check it out.First the bad: The keyboard is not great...frankly it just feels cheap. Its not terrible, but its not a pleasure to use. The display is disappointing too. Colors seemed washed out and the display seems kinda dim.Now the good things: Its light, runs cool, really does get around 8 hours of battery life, fast browsing. super fast startup with the SSD. Also you don't have to worry about viruses or malware with the chrome os.Im happy I purchased this computer,. I'm a firm believer that you get what you pay for. Acer scarified build quality for better internal components. For $200 I'd consider this a great bargain, you get a very capable computer for online functions.

Reviews.Title: Excellent computer for many uses
Reviews.Author: Lou V.
Reviews.Content: Wife surfs the 'net for various educational articles, and reads her email.  Definitely not a power user.  The clean interface of the Chromebook plus the VERY quick boot time, and automatic updates made her much more comfortable with working online (compared to her old Windows laptop).Decent construction/durability.  Clear screen.  Quick response.  WiFi.  USB ports for additional storage devices, if needed.Definitely a good purchase for us!

Reviews.Title: Great value for the money
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Rohde Christiansen
Reviews.Content: Much faster than my old Samsung Chromebook.  Keyboard is the only downside as it feels really cheap but it does work fine

Reviews.Title: So far, so good.
Reviews.Author: Goldwave "shopper"
Reviews.Content: A very handy little option.  I mainly wanted a small device like this which I could use for writing and doing homework etc. on my dock or out and about.  And I didn't have a lot of money to spend.I didn't go into this expecting a top-of-the-line cutting-edge sort of product.  So if you are comparing these against those types of parameters, you are missing the point.  This is for pragmatic convenience at a good price.I just recently got this, so I haven't yet gotten around to partitioning it with Linux but note that, if you didn't know, you can do that.  That means that you CAN add an operating system to this device.  From what I have been reading, you can then use the Linux Wine software to even run things like Windows and other software that might not be available in a Linux version.  Don't take my word for that as I haven't tried it; but if it is of interest to you, you can research it.  With this particular unit, you'd need an SD card probably if you are going to start doing things like that; but no big deal.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with it
Reviews.Author: suzanne m lecuyer
Reviews.Content: I'm finding I really like the Acer Chromebook, every thing that I read in the reviews has been true, great battery life, its super fast, easy to use. I've had to figure a few things out, I'm not very technological at all but have managed to do everything I need. It's quite a good machine and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product.
Reviews.Author: Sean J. Schluntz "photographer, motorcyclist ...
Reviews.Content: This is what I needed. Same weight as my MacBook Air 11" but lasts twice as long on a battery and costs less than 10% of the Apple product. They really aren't comparable but besides just a bit of stutter when watching HD it does the vast majority of what I need it to do. You can't beat what you get for the price.

Reviews.Title: very solid chromebook choice for the price
Reviews.Author: Ryan Burnett
Reviews.Content: pretty much everything i expected in a chromebook.battery life is better than i thought it would be. Was able to stream march madness games for a solid 6 hours before having to charge it back up.

Reviews.Title: good buy
Reviews.Author: Rockadopalous
Reviews.Content: I got this little puppy for my parents and they love it. I will get one when my computer from college dies. Small, lightweight and does everything I would need now that I am out of school.

Reviews.Title: Quick and easy!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love this computer. The images are sharp and crisp. The speed is great and it is compact. The battery life is amazing. I would recommend this computer.Oh and by the way Amazon shipped this next day!!!

Reviews.Title: A great search engine
Reviews.Author: conrad lai
Reviews.Content: This is great affordable search engine for the web, it'response time is very fast . I like to use it  to watch You Tube it is great!

Reviews.Title: Excellent For the Price
Reviews.Author: Matt ford
Reviews.Content: Very light and portable.  Great for media and web browsing.  I wanted an Ipad but didn't feel like paying the extra $300.  In fact the chromebook, because it runs full webapps and not mobile versions, is in many ways more powerful than an Ipad.

Reviews.Title: Love this!
Reviews.Author: Mary L. Sheppard
Reviews.Content: For me, this computer is perfect. Just the correct size and weight. I can easily take it with me  wherever I go. All I do is touch the pad and it quickly goes to the site I have requested! Love it!

Reviews.Title: better than expected
Reviews.Author: Anthony Martinetti
Reviews.Content: We have an imac, macpro, nook, and ipad - weren't sure how the Acer would fit in  - but it has done well.  As others have noted, don't expect it to be your 1st computer, but it works well and is easy to understand - as intuitive as our Apple machines.  No complaints, in fact we are quite pleased.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my needs
Reviews.Author: Nile Dacre
Reviews.Content: This does exactly what I wanted it for. Web browsing and portable video/music playback. A second screen when I'm using my PC for something fullscreen.The professional reviews seem to mark down the chromebooks for not doing things that I wouldn't expect from it. If you're interested in the getting a chromebook, just look up the available features and check out what's in the Chrome app store. It will do all of these things really well. If you need something that isn't available, the the chromebook is not for you.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for what I need
Reviews.Author: M. Milsap
Reviews.Content: This does everything I need it to do and it does it perfectly. Very light and seems I'll get about 6 hours on a charge with full brightness and lots of exts/apps installed.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Chromebook!
Reviews.Author: M. Barland
Reviews.Content: I got this for my wife to replace her reliance on a failing, old full-size laptop with a bad battery. She loves this C720P. It's fast, boots up in a few seconds, does everything a light web surfer would want (even basic document editing), and has a tremendous battery. I feel like we've been spoiled by the always ready, long battery life of the iPad. This C720P is as close to that quality of all day long use as you'll get in a laptop.The automatic updates are a plus, so I don't really have to think much about it.And the best part? No Windows 8!I've never used the touchscreen version, but that's the only thing that seems lacking here. I would think that the upgrade would be worth it and am looking to get another one with a touchscreen to supplement the wife's C720P.

Reviews.Title: Great value but there are limitations
Reviews.Author: Andre
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my in laws so they would get a user friendly platform.  We are using Verizon's MIFI to provide the internet connectivity.  That part was easy...The hard part is trying to get a printer connected. Google uses Cloud Print which is a good idea but because we have a low budget solution, that is no WIFI in the house, it becomes a major project.  You cannot just use a cable to connect a printer because chrome books don't let you use printer drivers.So the process requires you to first register the printer with either MAC OS or Windows based computer on a network.  Once you have registered the printer, you may also need a range extender or router you can use to connect the printer and then have the router connect to the Jetpack...gone are the days of plugging in the printer...

Reviews.Title: Great Asset
Reviews.Author: David Hayes
Reviews.Content: I had no idea that the Chromebook would be the missing link in my business (Realtor). I have cut my Listing Presentation down from 30-45 minutes to 15 minutes allowing more time to discuss preparation for the market.

Reviews.Title: This is a good buy!!!!
Reviews.Author: Rome
Reviews.Content: I love this chrome book its awsome Im glad i made this purchased this product . its slim,compact,and very quick no laggin... its worth the money no complaints here also im happy with the battery life...

Reviews.Title: Acer Chromebook
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This has been by far the best small laptop I have bought! It is light, and battery life is amazing! I do not have to worry about carrying my charger everywhere. It is great for traveling and all browser based (which I love). I am glad I purchased this laptop.

Reviews.Title: Why I answered this way
Reviews.Author: Laura Fry
Reviews.Content: I am not Tech smart and it did not come with any sort of directions.  I am still trying to figure how to use it.  Fortunately I have a couple of friends that have been able to help me some.

Reviews.Title: It's just what I need
Reviews.Author: Corey Heim
Reviews.Content: This Chromebook is perfect for how I use a computer at home--basically browsing the internet.  I have a Roku to stream video to my TV and simply don't have a need for much else.  But having Google Drive is great.  It's accessible just as easily on my phone and I can just store just about anything in it.  And Google Docs, Sheets, etc are just as easy to use and work pretty much the same way as the Microsoft equivalent.  It boots VERY quickly, is very stable and doesn't do anything to get in the way of the browser (the OS doesn't bog the computer down).It's not perfect, though.  You can't view sites or video that require Java and you can't really install anything unless Google's created a plug-in for it.  But those limitations come up rarely, though.For the price and the positives, the few minor inconveniences are overcome.  If you need a light and fast laptop to basically connect to the internet, the C720 can't be beat, in my view.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for web browsing
Reviews.Author: Brian Nicholson
Reviews.Content: I got this Chromebook for my kids and now find myself using it for browsing the web.  It gets the job done for the kids' homework and for light word processing and spreadsheets (Google).  I have not used it much when I don't have an internet connection.  I think it would be almost useless without one.  It is not a problem for us because there is always wifi nearby.  This laptop will not replace a windows or mac laptop, but it is great as a secondary laptop for browsing the web.

Reviews.Title: GREAT Chromebook
Reviews.Author: Doug63026 "Doug"
Reviews.Content: My laptop bit the dust and I've been looking for something to replace it. I didn't need all the bells and whistles and sure didn't want to cough up the $ for a laptop. I couldn't be happier with this Chromebook. SOOOO happy to have closed the page on Windows and Norton. There isn't much to add to all the geeked out comments already here on Amazon except I REALLY like my Chromebook.

Reviews.Title: laptop
Reviews.Author: Jacklyn  Lynch
Reviews.Content: was agreat gift for a friend daughter couldn't be happier.. shes loving every minute of it so its such a blessing

Reviews.Title: amazing piece of tech for two hundred bucks
Reviews.Author: needa
Reviews.Content: its fast and snappy. my only issue is there is not enough horsepower under the hood to cast a tab to chromecast with video. it seems to hiccup a bit and the audio is out of sync. but as far as surfing the web and playing videos... there really is no other product at this price point that compares. this thing is every bit as fast at suring and opening tabs etc as my 2nd gen i5 with 8gb ram laptop. and i actually reach for my chromebook instead of the laptop for most everything i do.

Reviews.Title: amazing piece of tech for two hundred bucks
Reviews.Author: needa
Reviews.Content: its fast and snappy. my only issue is there is not enough horsepower under the hood to cast a tab to chromecast with video. it seems to hiccup a bit and the audio is out of sync. but as far as surfing the web and playing videos... there really is no other product at this price point that compares. this thing is every bit as fast at suring and opening tabs etc as my 2nd gen i5 with 8gb ram laptop. and i actually reach for my chromebook instead of the laptop for most everything i do.

Reviews.Title: Awesome little computer
Reviews.Author: Edmond D. Quesada "Ed"
Reviews.Content: wow, what a deal for $200. Great for student; easy to set and operate. Just download OpenOffice and your set for applications

Reviews.Title: Great.!
Reviews.Author: Tee M.
Reviews.Content: I think this is a great little laptop just for me.! I haven't  had any problems thus far. It's a great laptop.

Reviews.Title: Super fast
Reviews.Author: B. Carlson
Reviews.Content: We needed something for quick internet access when the laptop was tied up. The chromebook is super fast, nice size - easy to have on your lap, large screen and nice size key board. We have had it for almost 4 months now and love it.

Reviews.Title: chromebook is the bomb!
Reviews.Author: Sheila Haney
Reviews.Content: I am really enjoying this chromebook. It is very easy to use and the speed of the system is awsome. I would recommend this type of chromebook to everyone i know that is looking for something like this!

Reviews.Title: Chromebooj Review
Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: With the exception of a couple missing features - no delete and Caps Lock - it's exactly what I needed.

Reviews.Title: Worth the price!
Reviews.Author: Sal subhan
Reviews.Content: It's a step below a laptop and a step above a netbook. I use it everyday and its actually faster than my laptop. The best part is the chromebook takes about 5 seconds to turn on. What I don't like is that I can't connect my non google drive printer to physically to my chromebook. But I can still save my documents on google drive and open it up with my laptop to print. This is great for college students

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my daily use
Reviews.Author: PRAVEEN
Reviews.Content: Acer C720 Chromebook is really fast . Its good for browsing and every day usage and it has great battery backup I recommended buying it

Reviews.Title: Great browser
Reviews.Author: LuvtoShopAmazon
Reviews.Content: LIghtweight, plug and play, intuitive.  Comfortable to use sitting in the recliner or carrying to bed.  I'd read many technical reviews on it prior to purchasing and they were positive and I would agree so far; have only had it a week.  Perfect for the things I do on the computer now - web browsing, online searches, etc., plus apps available for kindle reader and documents. Affordable and functional.

Reviews.Title: No complaints
Reviews.Author: R.E.T
Reviews.Content: Bought for my 6 yr daughter, and she loves it. Added a purple hard shell case which just topped it off for her : )

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Michael C. Taylor
Reviews.Content: Very cool laptop for the money. I put crouton and ubuntu/elementary on it so I'm not using it solely as a "chrome book". I am using it for python/django development and it works very well. I was concerned about the 2gb memory but so far it has not been a problem even when running a local web server for django. At the price, hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Nancy Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: Love it so far! I have a 27 inch i mac but i use this one when I cant use my desktop! Amazing for the price!! A+++

Reviews.Title: What a great way to surf the web!
Reviews.Author: Vicki Watson "viccola8"
Reviews.Content: i just got this today and am so thrilled with it!  so easy to set up and use!  it is perfect for anyone who uses the web most of the time.  The speed is amazing........no hesitation at all when going from site to site.  I would highly recommend this to anyone who surfs the web a lot.  Battery life is also great....8.5 hours!  So happy I gave it a try!

Reviews.Title: Excellent value!
Reviews.Author: Sue Ford
Reviews.Content: Great value for older user just getting started!  It does so many things so easily.  Handy to carry around and love the long battery time!

Reviews.Title: Lightweight and affordable
Reviews.Author: Laura D. Dawson
Reviews.Content: This is a great little laptop and worth the money. The price was very reasonable and it is lightweight and easy to take everywhere. It is exactly right for our needs.

Reviews.Title: Acer 720 Chromebook
Reviews.Author: M. Greiner
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice machine, light weight, good screen. Only negative is learning to use chrome as the operating system, after using a device with Microsoft for so long. It is a "work in progress."

Reviews.Title: use it all the time!
Reviews.Author: Wayne Teh
Reviews.Content: Works great, very limited functionality but does what I want it to do. very light, beautiful and cheap. sturdy, this is my go-to laptop. highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: First impressions
Reviews.Author: Donald S. Campbell
Reviews.Content: Unboxed and set up my Acer C720 chrome book yesterday. This will be my personal chrome book to use in getting up to speed before our district rolls out chrome books to students. So far I am impressed with the ability to have 6 students work on the same document at the same time.

Reviews.Title: Was a gift
Reviews.Author: Jetski "basketball granny"
Reviews.Content: I personally liked it but the person I bought it for as a Christmas gift wasn't really thrilled about it.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the price
Reviews.Author: Sado Marin
Reviews.Content: For the price and size this is a perfect machine for simple tasks like writing docs and web browsing. Very light, powers quickly, and google has need developing plug ins for google doc that make it comparable to Microsoft word. So the fact that it's basically a google operating system isn't much of a negative.

Reviews.Title: Great Machine Love the"Hangouts" App!
Reviews.Author: Lori Mead
Reviews.Content: I chose the Acer C720 Chromebook because of it's cost and the many advantages. This was purchased for my daughter and son in law basically for the propose of using the "hangouts" application. The kids then decided to purchase Wi-Fi for their home. I live in PA and they live in NM. We absolutely love the hangouts app and they love the slim and user friendly enjoyment of this particular chromebook.

Reviews.Title: Great Machine
Reviews.Author: Evan Valentine
Reviews.Content: Love the operating system.  Make sure you download any apps that you need.  Light, Cheap.  I bought a 32 gig SD Card, loaded all of my daughters favorite movies on it and gave it to her.  She loves it!

Reviews.Title: a great multi-generational laptop
Reviews.Author: Debby Lu
Reviews.Content: i bought this chromebook for shared use by our two young kids (4 and 7 years old) and their grandparents, and it's worked out well  for both sets of users, who use it exclusively for web-related activities.  good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: very pleased
Reviews.Author: metal worker
Reviews.Content: This is a fine notebook,plenty of Mg space lots of RAM sleek design and well thought out. Has more computing power than notebooks costi.g three times as much.

Reviews.Title: It was
Reviews.Author: Kay A. Lohrke
Reviews.Content: it was delivered fast. For me it works great, I'm 62 and I'm having a great time with it. It's not so big that I can't carry it with me. Or so small that I can't see the screen. I would recommend it for everyone.

Reviews.Title: Good Concept
Reviews.Author: robert rangel
Reviews.Content: I was looking for something cheap that would allow basic linux experience with the ease and features of Chrome.  Different flavors of linux tried do not work very well and the flavor of linux that does work well has issues with getting Chrome installed.  If the ChromeBook itself allowed for X windows to be sent from remote servers to run GUI applications from remote servers via SSH, it would work perfect.  If VNC worked better, it would also be a great device to use.

Reviews.Title: Good computer
Reviews.Author: Whitney Davis
Reviews.Content: I love the Acer C720. It is a fast computer and did everything that I needed it to do. Try it out for yourself.

Reviews.Title: I love this computer!
Reviews.Author: Debbie Bryan
Reviews.Content: The chromebook is just amazing- I will never go back to Windows. It's fast, easy to navigate and does everything I expected.

Reviews.Title: Acer C720 Chromebook
Reviews.Author: Willye A. Belcarris-Brooks
Reviews.Content: Purchased it for my granddaughter.  She absolutely loves it. She selected it for the price and quality offered. Very nice choices.

Reviews.Title: Quick,Fast,and Fun!!
Reviews.Author: Lee A Humbert-Baker
Reviews.Content: Well I have a bit of a learning curve but I am liking it!!! Starts up really fast compared to my 4 yr old laptop.

Reviews.Title: Better than I expected
Reviews.Author: jackwack "Jack"
Reviews.Content: If you have never used Chrome you will be a little confused. It has taken me about 3 weeks to get used to it Have only downloaded a couple of apps so far. Overall It is certainly worth the money. I have shut down my P.C. except for printing. Glad I bought it.

Reviews.Title: acer chromebook C720 review
Reviews.Author: Miesha dennis
Reviews.Content: i love this product its awesome it does everything i thought it would do plus some its the perfect size and you can take it any where i absoultely love it

Reviews.Title: Love my chromebook
Reviews.Author: C. Christensen
Reviews.Content: This tablet was a great deal for me. It is fast and fun although I have not figured out how to print off of it yet.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet-ish laptop
Reviews.Author: Gene
Reviews.Content: Great for anything you can get via the web, and all the google apps (email, calender, docs, etc).  Super fast boot time and long lasting battery, very easy to carry with you, will be my travel laptop for sure.  I say tablet-ish laptop because I prefer the keyboard, but functions like a laptop (this version no touchscreen though!)Only downside is can't really install anything onto the laptop beyond Google play apps, would have liked to be able to have a few things I was used to on my Windows 7 laptop work on there.

Reviews.Title: great device
Reviews.Author: sterling
Reviews.Content: Great battery life...extreme portability...style...and overall performance is great. This is great for some thing like school. Very nice. Its great

Reviews.Title: chromebook
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: at first i didnt really understand how it would work having so little memory but once you learn about all the stuff you get when using google chrome and how it works it is a great product for a good price.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what we needed
Reviews.Author: Robin M
Reviews.Content: Got these as first computers for 7 & 9 year olds. Felt it was time to get them started using a laptop for school on a regular basis.  I did a lot of research, the Chromebook is different, a totally different system, but it works. We have both PC's and Mac's and it was no problem to switch to a different system.  The children have had no problem learning to use them for schoolwork, games, YouTube and General surfing.  What has impressed me most has been the simplicity and reliability?

Reviews.Title: Perfect for what I purchased it for!
Reviews.Author: JOHN A KUPREVICH
Reviews.Content: The Acer Chromebook has turned out to be the perfect size and functionality for me to use.  It is compact, quick to boot up and works without issue.  I am pleased with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Just what you need.
Reviews.Author: Steven
Reviews.Content: If you just need something to keep the kids busy and do just simple browsing, this is the product for you. There are, yes limitations of what you can do, but if you don't need optimum processing power the Acer C720 Chromebook is the perfect product.

Reviews.Title: Simple, easy to use, sturdy, and not afraid of losing it.
Reviews.Author: Toodle doo
Reviews.Content: I bought the Acer 720 at BestBuy, they have it $50 cheaper at $199 and it's a good machine. My backpack was stolen and with it my Macbook Air. I needed a quick replacement and didn't have the money for another $1000 laptop so I bought this little guy 4 months ago and haven't been disappointed. I mostly use it to type papers using google docks, which I would argue is the same as using Microsoft Word, submit papers online, and to look up info online. Secondary, I use it to blog, check e-mail, and play online chess. It works for me.As is well known by now, if you're planning to edit video/pics you'll be disappointed. If you're a student looking for a great laptop to do school work and your interests don't involve cleavage and car chases, this is for you. (Although it can player movies, too!)

Reviews.Title: Simple, easy to use, sturdy, and not afraid of losing it.
Reviews.Author: Toodle doo
Reviews.Content: I bought the Acer 720 at BestBuy, they have it $50 cheaper at $199 and it's a good machine. My backpack was stolen and with it my Macbook Air. I needed a quick replacement and didn't have the money for another $1000 laptop so I bought this little guy 4 months ago and haven't been disappointed. I mostly use it to type papers using google docks, which I would argue is the same as using Microsoft Word, submit papers online, and to look up info online. Secondary, I use it to blog, check e-mail, and play online chess. It works for me.As is well known by now, if you're planning to edit video/pics you'll be disappointed. If you're a student looking for a great laptop to do school work and your interests don't involve cleavage and car chases, this is for you. (Although it can player movies, too!)

Reviews.Title: GoGo
Reviews.Author: Daniel Cadorette
Reviews.Content: the Acer C720 is very fast and lightweight. Start-ups are a breeze and shutdown is even faster. I will be traveling..flying and would like to know what needs to be done to use the 12 GoGo Inflight Passes that was part of the deal. The Acer C720 I bought is the 2848 Series.

Reviews.Title: Nice unit for what it was intended
Reviews.Author: jack
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the Acer V720. About the only thing I use a computer for is my E-Mail and this is very good for that

Reviews.Title: This Acer Chromebook Just Smokes!!
Reviews.Author: Principaled Reviewer "Timothy Loversky"
Reviews.Content: Love this machine!  Right from taking it out of the box, it started up in less than 10 seconds.  About 45 seconds after getting it going, I logged in, entered my wifi password and was in!  Everything synced to my Google account, including passwords, Chrome tabs, etc.When I close the lid, the machine shuts down instantly.  The re-start takes about 4-5 seconds. Really, I could not imagine a better machine.  It is NOT a Windows laptop, and does not do Office.  But since I use Google Drive (docs) for almost anything, this is no inconvenience.I have now used it for a little less than a week.  I have browsed, bought, surfed and streamed.  This Acer Chromebook just smokes!

Reviews.Title: My Acer
Reviews.Author: sherri moxley
Reviews.Content: I was in dire need of a new computer. I am use to Windows and not Google chrome. So I am surprised that I love the easy flow of it. I am still learning to navigate.

Reviews.Title: Didn't think I would like this, but I do
Reviews.Author: Daniel LeBoeuf
Reviews.Content: Outside of having to get used to using Google Drive instead of Microsoft Office I haven't had any complaints about this notebook.  I can still use my favorite search engine even though I can't make it my default.  The whole thing was so easy to set up and start using right out of the box and after three months with it I'm still very pleased.  I tried a tablet but wasn't happy with the keyboard interface I had to buy separately.  This gives me a substantial feeling and good-sized keyboard with reactive keys that have a good feel to them for touch typing.  The screen is large enough and easy on the eyes.  The battery life has proven to be as advertised.  Do follow the instructions on draining and fully recharging the battery for the first few times to improve battery function and life.  I liked this so much that I bought one for my wife to replace her dying Dell, and she hasn't picked up the laptop since the day she started using the Chromebook.  I've used Acer in the past when building my own PCs and their quality still does not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: just enough, not too much
Reviews.Author: GenuineImitation
Reviews.Content: this is the right addition to our computer "collection". we needed something for web access, not too big. Didn't want to spend the outrageous amounts for a pad... this is just perfect. You can browse the web, watch TV.. basically use it like a pad. I find this to be more convienent and it is SO lightweight! If you use your pad as a cookbook (in the kitchen) this might not be for you -  there is an attached keyboard, so it is shaped like a traditional computer, rather than a single flat screen

Reviews.Title: Perfect solution for the WWW
Reviews.Author: G. Lockwood
Reviews.Content: My wife was using our high end HP laptop to see FB, get email and surf. She loves that her new Chromebook is light, cool, quiet and quick ( from powered off to online in less than 10 seconds!) I love that it is very affordable and easy to travel with.

Reviews.Title: Fast, Cheap, and fantastic battery
Reviews.Author: C.
Reviews.Content: It's very easy to load ubuntu on here thanks to Chrubuntu. Both ChromeOS and Ubuntu are rock solid with graphics acceleration.

Reviews.Title: That google chrome os will take some getting used to..
Reviews.Author: Suede
Reviews.Content: 1st off, this laptop is small and compact...about the size of a school folder,, its nothing fancy at all. its basic as hell...But it looks good, fels good, and operates ONLY on the google chrome OS..Now if you dont know what a google chromebook is, basically, its a laptop that ONLY works with google related apps. Its not a regular computer...Theres no START menu at the bottom left corner of the desktop..Its completely different than a windows 8 laptop. Most of whatever you will do will require internet..except for the google apps that you can use offline. It will take a minute to get used to, but it serves the purpose as a standard laptop, it gets the job done.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Nate Dunning
Reviews.Content: This computer is great, very light, very portable and an all around reliable computer. Not meant for heavy users but for users familiar with Google apps and a need for a web based machine.

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect
Reviews.Author: Stewart Chaimson
Reviews.Content: There are just a couple of things I don't like; one is the mouse pad which doesn't have a separate button so I often accidentally zoom in on google maps (since I have one finger on the "button" and one on the other hand "pointing"). The other thing is I almost always have the audio "headphone" jack plugged into my home stereo, and I am startled by a loud buzz when the book goes to sleep or turns on, or at other times (it happens fairly frequently) and is really unsettling. And I guess a third thing is I do have to limit the number of tabs (pages) open, or I get the "he's dead Jim" message. On the whole though, I'm very happy with it. I use it to read, often when it isn't plugged in, and the battery life seems fine. The screen isn't nearly as good as my 15" laptop, but it's so light and easy to travel with (around the house or out-and-about), I am really glad to have it. The keyboard is fine, only the mouse pad, lacking keys which aren't also part of the pointer surface, is the only thing I'm having to struggle with (and the loud buzz).

Reviews.Title: Great buy!!
Reviews.Author: Gloria
Reviews.Content: Purchased this for my daughter and she loves it!  I don't think I would like it for me just because I like microsoft products and I can't use it with my iphone/ipod/ipad.  But this is what my daughter's school has so she is very familiar with it and loves it!

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Alexander Hewitt "geezer geek"
Reviews.Content: This is the answer to security hole ridden laptops, Although it is possible for the system to be hacked, it isn't easy and the performance of ChromeOS with the hardware provided by this machine is very impressive. This is my new recommendation for people who don't want to spend inordinate time to the care and feeding of a personal computer. Nice job Acer and Google Chrome.

Reviews.Title: Husband can't put it down!
Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: My husband loveeesssss this computer. The best, most streamlined experience if you don't care about other things other than the internet. It's very fast!

Reviews.Title: Happy with Santa's Gift
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Donald Fisher"
Reviews.Content: This was a Chrismas gift for my wife. Arrived in plenty of time for even me to get it wrapped. My wife was surprised with the gift and loves her Chromebook.

Reviews.Title: ACER 720 Chromebook is sweet!
Reviews.Author: John M. Snyder
Reviews.Content: I have had the unit for almost 2 weeks Put about 20+ hours on it personalizing and learning. I love it. Yes, it is different than other laptops as everything is Chrome web based. It takes some time to learn this system especially if you have never used Chrome before.  After using Windows based systems for 20+ years it is different. However, it is perfect for me. I am retired and travel a fair amount. This fills the bill for what I need to keep in touch with family and friends, read news, watch movies, pay bills,etc. My speadsheet days are over and I am no gamer so cannot speak to these applications. It is light, fast, inexpensive and I am very happy with the purchase. I have read a number of reviews where people did not or do not understand, this is a Google Chrome system with their own apps, Yes, you must have wi-fi and yes very few things work off line but what the Chromebook does it does well. Come on $199.00 what do you all expect?  With a 100 GB free data for 2 years, and 12 free flight wifi passes, it really is a deal.

Reviews.Title: Very nice, but complectation...
Reviews.Author: riartem
Reviews.Content: I m happy, what bought this chromebook. It work very quickly!But Acer might be include euro-type plug when send items to Europe.In the rest all is ok!

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: myrna
Reviews.Content: this review is for Acer C720 Chromebook (11.6-Inch, Haswell micro-architecture, 2GB). had it less than a week and love it thus far. fantastically quick start and long battery life are quite an improvement over my old Windows based laptop. learning to use features of chrome has not been difficult for this old fogey. highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Nice Chromebook
Reviews.Author: Nanci J. Macall
Reviews.Content: The screen was just a little small for my liking. I am 57 years old and cannot see as well as I did at 20. I like a tablet much better. You can increase font easier.

Reviews.Title: Fast and light Best sub-$200 machine. Pull the trigger and buy now.
Reviews.Author: Alvaro Olaguera
Reviews.Content: TL;DR: Blazing fast performance (better than the Chromebook 11 by a wide margin), light, stellar battery. Buying any other Chromebook under 12" would be a mistake.I've owned the Samsung Series 3 Chromebook and the difference between these two machines is astronomical in terms of performance. When comparing speed, snappiness, and quickness in loading pages, the C720 is the hare to the Samsung's tortoise. Most websites load just as quickly as they do on my MacBook Pro Retina 13", and once the website is completely loaded, scrolling up and down quickly doesn't hang it up at all. The Samsung's ARM processor is sluggish and there really isn't a comparison. Unacceptably for a modern machine that is supposed to give you the "best of Chrome", the HP Chromebook 11 has the same processor as the Samsung from 2012 and the performance is not much better.Trust me - nothing is more frustrating than waiting for websites to load, and a close second pet peeve is poor performance, lagginess, and abrupt jerkiness when navigating around a page. You will get none of that on the C720. In this day and age, I need the internet to work immediately and reliably. The use of the older ARM processor is a huge oversight by HP and something they shouldn't have skimped on.The Samsung and the HP definitely win in the looks dept., but the C720 isn't an ugly computer by any means. People moan about its design, but it's quite easy on the eyes when you see it in person. Pictures don't do it justice. The metallic gray is pleasing and the shiny bezel around the display is reminiscent of Apple's design choice, which I prefer to the matte black bezel of the Chromebook 11. The C720 is also very light and feels quite sturdy in the hand despite being made of lower cost materials. The keyboard is good enough to use, even though the keys do feel slightly "mushy", but they haven't caused me any significant errors or slowdowns so far.You really can't complain of much when spending $199 on a computer. If you're looking for something fast, light, and can last all day, throw your chips on the Acer C720. You will not be disappointed.

I don't carry the charger and the power cord at all wherever I go.The so-so (not the bad):1. The screen is decent, not bad or ugly at all. Reviews.Title: Great Replacement for a Tablet
Reviews.Author: Brian From MN
Reviews.Content: Over the past year I've had an iPad, an HD+ Nook, and a Samsung Tab 3.  What I liked about tablets, compared with a full-fledged laptop, was the instant-on availability, and all-day battery.  This Chromebook has both, plus it has a decent keyboard that I was missing on the tablets.  I use the Chromebook for web surfing, and since I don't play games I don't miss all the apps; there's a website for everything I need.  I have the 2GB RAM version, and I haven't had any noticeable degradation in performance.  I frequently have 5-10 tabs open at a time.  As for the touch pad, it took a getting use to, but after several weeks I really liked it.  The only problem is trying to select large blocks of text can be tricky.  The screen isn't as good as most laptops, but for a couple hundred dollars it isn't bad.  One thing that's really nice is there's no function keys, and they're replaced by very useful buttons like contrast, volume, refresh etc..  Overall I'm extremely happy with this Chromebook.

Reviews.Title: Fills a Niche
Reviews.Author: JustOneGuy
Reviews.Content: The perfect traveling business computer (and family computer). I've gotten tired over the years of getting my family (wife and 3 kids all ages) a new computer every few years because by playing online games, etc. it's gotten so bloated or infected with malware that it's unrecoverable. No more waiting 8 minutes for the computer to boot up (this one is more like 4 seconds) or 2 minutes for it to shut down (instant), or "Dad, why is this thing running so slow?". Everyone can hop on and off as they need, quickly or not. The keyboard is a necessity for writing papers and emails (thus why I did not opt for a tablet). Integration with Google accounts is seamless. I can use it for business (at least most of it) and when it's not in use for that, anyone can log on and I have no worries about cross contamination or it getting bogged down. It's lightning fast - not the prettiest chromebook available, but I have no complaints about how it looks. The extra horsepower and battery life far outweigh any vanity issues I have.Where computers, traditional laptops, and tablets fail, the chromebook shines. And at this price point, if it gets broken it's not the end of the world.

Reviews.Content: I bought the Acer C-710 fro my wife as a Christmas present and while I was setting it up for her I found how easy to use the Chrome OIS system was to use. After giving her the C-710 I decided to get a Chomebook for myself. I went with the C-720 because of the great reviews that I read on multiple web sites and the price. This computer is very fast and very efficient. There will be information out there stating that a Chromebook is useless without the internet and this is false. There are offline apps that can be downloaded and used. You can create documents and play offline games. You can even access emails that you have previously read with gmail offline.Please do your research before you buy this if you are an avid Microsoft user because there are differences. However, most files are transferable and google has similar programs. For instance, Google Docs is basically Microsoft Word, and Google Sheets is the same as Excell. I recommend keeping a Microsoft based computer in the house if you are an avid Itunes user or just like Microsoft in general, but this is a great on-the-go little laptop that is very versitile.
