Reviews.Author: Logan Carroll
Reviews.Content: I had a thousand dollar Asus break on me after only two years, so I decided to replace it with something cheap. I'm a pretty light user, my main uses are internet and word processing, so between CHEAP and LIGHT, I settled on a Chromebook. I do edit photos and design flyers, which almost turned me off of this computer (I know you can get the Adobe CS or whatever they're calling it for $50 a month, but that's my health insurance premium.) I'm going to install a Linux system along side the ChromeOS, so I'll update when I've done that and tried a little Scribus and Gimp.The c720 is fast, the speakers are pretty good, and the screen looks great. The only complaint I have, really, is the trackpad. It's almost unusable, I'm going to have to get a wireless mouse. On the whole, this computer is exactly what it seems: an average computer with a really low price.

Reviews.Title: Great secondary laptop
Reviews.Author: Spencer Goolsby
Reviews.Content: It came as advertised and the battery life is incredible!  My sons were using it pretty much non stop Christmas day and the day after (charged it overnight when not being used) and the device just kept chugging along with not a problem to be seen.  A little bit of a learning curve since they are 12 and 7 years old and more used to Apple products, but they were easily picked up and ran with.

Reviews.Title: Must have for google lovers
Reviews.Author: oasis
Reviews.Content: If you have an android phone and are in the google eco system, you need a chrome book. end of story.

Reviews.Title: Chromebook C720
Reviews.Author: Richard G. Cervera
Reviews.Content: .I like it very much because of it's size and speed.  This is the first time that i have own a lap top.

Reviews.Title: perfect for my needs
Reviews.Author: Lisa Rettler
Reviews.Content: I'm loving my Chromebook.  It is very easy to use, quick and just what I was looking for.  I like the size and speed also.  I use it for email, facebook and watching videos.  I haven't found anything to complain about.  I really like the price too!

Reviews.Title: This is a beast!
Reviews.Author: rustymx
Reviews.Content: I recommend this to anyone looking for just web browsing or online banking that is what I got it for. I haven't been able to put it down since it arrived.

Reviews.Title: rocks
Reviews.Author: Dan johnson
Reviews.Content: Like this chrome book so much I bought 2 more for Xmas gifts can't say enough about what this book can do.and the shipping awesome,amazon rocks.

Reviews.Title: Fast shipping even though it was out of stock
Reviews.Author: Cocozelle
Reviews.Content: I ordered this for $199 from amazon even though it was "temporarily out of stock"; since a lot of other stores were out of stock on this item too, I was pretty much just hoping that it might become available before Christmas. And it did - it was shipped only two days later!!!

Reviews.Title: 2gb version
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: I have the 2 gb version for a whopping $199.  What everyone has said about this amazing cheap laptop is true.  I am a teacher and it suits my needs perfectly.  I won't repeat all of the great things about it.  Others have written it already!

Reviews.Title: nice looking chromebook
Reviews.Author: cathy valverde
Reviews.Content: it's fast, i like the size and easy to operate and great deal i would recomend this to friends and students also great for traveling

Reviews.Title: Good and Good-er
Reviews.Author: Blerberjerbs
Reviews.Content: I like this chromebook. It is considerably better than my old chromebook. I think it was worth the money. It is good for doing things. It is good for other things too. "Good" is a good adjective to describe this chromebook. The keyboard is good. The trackpad is even good-er. The screen is more good than my old chromebook. The battery life is also more good.

Reviews.Title: A great entry level Chromebook (plus some suggestions for a mid-range Chromebook)
Reviews.Author: Dean
Reviews.Content: For those looking for a great and inexpensive laptop, this is it. I have been a Chromebook fan since the early days and find this a great entry level unit.Pros:-Great battery life (real world 6-7 hours)-Faster then Samsung or HP Arm Processor-Small and light-They improved on color and design slightly (less plasticy- more metal looking then 710, but still wish it was more premium)Cons--Screen (both in quality, and size). Now realize I might be a little biased on this one. I have a few of the Samsung Arm Chromebooks for the kids, and I own a Chromebook Pixel. I recently bought a Mac Air (to do more developer things), and had to return it because the screen just does not cut it for me (after using the Pixel). I got a Macbook Pro to find the screen to my liking. So if you are coming from any retina type screen, this will be harder to adjust to. Otherwise, what more can you ask for in a $199 notebook.-Design is still a little on cheap end, too large of bezel-Speakers have OK volume, but Bass is distorted at higher volumeSuggestions (not specifically for this model, but Chromebooks in general):-ACER (or Asus, Samsung, or Toshiba - you still have a chance to surprise us in early 2014), there IS a market for a little nicer unit. This is what I would change on this (and any lower end chromebook).1) The bezel is a little too large. Seems they could of pushed 12.1 or 12.6 out of same form factor by reducing bezel.2) Go IPS, HP 11 is a beautiful screen (too bad they couldn't of put a Haswell in that one).3) Love the Micro USB charger of the HP 11 (although not sure if that was part of recall of that model).4) Must be Haswell type power with 8+ hours of battery life5) Must be under 3 lbs.6) Sound through keyboard7) Backlit keyboard8) Metalish look please, and sturdy frame. Not a huge fan of the polished plastic look that HP went back to in the 11. Reminds me of the first series 3 Samsung I owned. Maybe even going leatherish feel with aluminum trim (like the first Nexus 7) gave off a professional look while keeping costs lower.While I understand almost 2 of every 3 units going out the door is for education, you would like to see one company step up to make a in-between model. For those of us that own the Pixel, we are disappointed in a battery that cannot perform past 3 hours making it almost useless in some cases. Someone should be able to make a great model like above in that $299-$399 price range.

Reviews.Title: Very quick, but I couldn't live with the cheap keyboard
Reviews.Author: klaberte "klaberte"
Reviews.Content: This is a nice device.  For $200, you would be hard pressed to find something more useful for casual web surfing, facebook, email, etc.  The new Intel chip is indeed fast.  The screen and trackpad are serviceable, quite acceptable for such an inexpensive device. The screen is not as bright as some of the others, but I believe that is due to the matte finish, which reduces reflections.  However, I found the keyboard to be unacceptable.  Just poor feel, short travel, and just didn't feel right.  To be more specific, I used an online typing test back to back on the Acer and Toshiba.  On the Toshiba, I scored 63 words per minute with 98% accuracy.  On the Acer, I scored 51 WPM with 85% accuracy.In the end I returned this for the chromebook by Toshiba.  Same speed and specs, but a much more quality device (albeit more expensive, it is well less than three hundred), especially the keyboard.

Reviews.Title: Best Li'l Laptop EVER
Reviews.Author: Anonymous American
Reviews.Content: I bought my Acer Chromebook C720 at Best Buy for $199. I am actually writing this review on it. It is AWESOME. It's really light, and thin, so it can be stored easily. Two things I LOVE about it: the screen quality, and the sound quality. The sound is perfect. It's clear as crystal, and rivals the Dolby Digital 5.0 speakers on my Kindle Fire HD.  The Video quality is terrific, I always test that out by watching the Longmire season 2 trailer, and it was as clear as watching it on an HD TV. I'm only going to use this computer for writing, school work, music, and very little internet use (research, shopping, and the like).The screen is 11.6 inches, as the page shows, and, as I said, the screen resolution is Perfect (1366x768, 720 pixels). Now, for such a low price you may be thinking that this is a cheap piece of crap. It's not. It's a very firm little computer. There are two USB ports, and one USB 2.0 port. The computer has no Microsoft or Apple software, just for those of you who were wondering, it's all Google, which is perfect if you (like me) work with a Google account. It does have an Intel Celeron 4.1 GHz processor. The battery life of this computer is 8.5 hours, compared to the average 4 hours on other laptops. This says that the start-up speed is 7 seconds, but I swear, it's more like 3 seconds, and the same for shut-down speed. Now, there are two little blue lights, on the front of the computer: the one on the right is if it's charging, and the one on the left is if it's on. One other thing, you don't have to push any buttons for this to turn on. All you have to do is flip it open, and pow! the screen comes on. This is one nice little laptop.One thing I recently figured out is how to download things on to it, it has no major software, but it does the ability to download things, like picture or videos, or you can download the web address. You have to place the mouse on the picture, and tap the mousepad with two fingers, and you'll get the option to download it. You can upload those on to this computer, via jump-drive, so I do that as well. It also comes with this model's standard charging cord, being about 7-10 feet long. Now the space on these may not be so appealing to some: 16GB, or 32GB. One thing you can do, is buy a USB hub, and pug it in and use that as your storage. I have the 16GB, and I'm fine with that, because it gives me some restrictions.This is a great little computer, especially if you need it to do schoolwork. It's light, portable, has great sound and video qualities, great battery life, and a very good processor. I would definately recommend this to any one needing a small computer, or wanting a good one at a low price. You can't beat this laptop's bang-for-it's-buck.

Reviews.Title: Old NW Sailor Guy
Reviews.Author: Michael L.
Reviews.Content: 1) It is a Chrome OS based unit so you need to know if you like Chrome or not.  2) The notebook is working fine after a few months but it is not a replacement for a full sized laptop (LP)  -- but for me was a compromise between  LP and tablet.  Setup was easy but make sure you know the password to your wireless router :).I bought a wireless mouse and an HDMI cable and can plug it into my TVs and use the web for whatever.  For anyone who needs reading glasses, you may need them even when it is in your lap.It is light weight , keeps it's charge very well (including me accidently running it down) and has ample ports.  The SD card port however, leaves the card exposed like a thump/jump drive.Overall, IMHO, it was worth the $200 I paid but I would not buy a second one unless I really needed it or it was less expensive.

Reviews.Title: It stopped functioning within 2 days
Reviews.Author: Gary Wright
Reviews.Content: The chrome book  was very fast but after two days it would freeze up. If we moved the screen the computer woou;d usually start gain but this is no way to use a computer. We returned it and bought the Samsung Chrome Book.

Reviews.Title: A dud
Reviews.Author: Caroline Fausel
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we got a dud. The trackpad didn't work from the minute we booted up so I sent it back for a refund.

Reviews.Title: didn't meet my needs
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: The TN display had very poor viewing angles and was dimly lit.  When I tried turning up the brightness, the contrast was lost and everything was washed out in white.As far as the viewing angles, as long as I was viewing it from a very narrow angle it looked fine, but I found myself constantly adjusting the screen tilt to get a clear image that was otherwise fuzzy and not clear.  I returned mine and will likely be targeting more expensive devices with higher resolution IPS displays in the future.  This device just hurts my eyes for reading.It's a shame, because I really did want to like this since it performs spectacular and is a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great first computer
Reviews.Author: K
Reviews.Content: Bought this for a gift for a child under 10.  She loves it.  Seems to work well with almost no set-up required.

Reviews.Title: Great buy, but ANY HINT of Water and it malfunctions!!!
Reviews.Author: Peaches
Reviews.Content: I would have given this Chromebook 5 stars, but there were several small but irritating issues: First, Chrome runs only Chrome apps and can't run Microsoft Office except online. So you have to do all your docs in Google Drive. You don't get the FULL web sites, just Chrome versions of them. But having both a touchsmart and an Iphone, I can see that the sites are not very different at all. I even streamed movies on my Chromebook! It is REALLY fast - takes just 10 seconds to turn on, and the shortcut keys make navigation a breeze. Chrome has come a long way - I LOVE my chromebook! However, I was washing dishes and had my Chromebook several feet away from me. A bubble popped onto the Chromebook and the number that the bubble landed on NEVER WORKED AGAIN. Acer doesn't cover "water-damage" so I thank GOD I had just gotten it! I returned it back to Amazon and got another one the very next day. I didn't have to wait until I returned the damaged one - they just got it out the following day which is why I never shop ANYWHERE online except Amazon.com using Prime. With the second one, works GREAT! But KEEP AWAY FROM ALL LIQUIDS!!!

Reviews.Title: All you really need, for a great price
Reviews.Author: bruvark
Reviews.Content: Unless you want to play (non-Android) games, or use intensive video/graphics programs, this little guy is all you'll ever need. Takes care of everything that you'd do on a day-to-day basis, with no noticeable sluggishness or other down sides - all for $200!Need Word? It can do that. Need Excel? It does that too! Just want to look at cat pictures all day? I think it goes without saying that you'll be good.It's been a month, and I've yet to run into a situation it couldn't handle. The future is pretty damn sweet.

Reviews.Title: Just purchased form Walmart yesterday.
Reviews.Author: Jessica Noll
Reviews.Content: So I just purchased this laptop yesterday and absolutely love it. The only thing I don't like is that it doesn't support Skype yet. I got this because I am becoming a full time missionary and need to keep in contact with my friends and family while I am across the world. lol It does everything else I need it to. Its really light weight and easy to carry around.It was a little difficult to start using the webcam, but once I got it connected to wifi it was a no brainier.I gave it a 4 star only because you have to do the go around to use skype. Now Google does offer a different way of doing video calling, and I'm not to sure about this because I think your friends and family need to have a google account to be able to use this. Apparently if you install the plug in with an outlook email address you can use skype but I haven't completely figured this out yet either.Like I said I just purchased this laptop yesterday and got it mostly figured out but not everything. Its pretty self explanitory and they do a great job having a step by step way of setting this up. the manual is also on the computer itself so no extra paperwork in the box.If you have any questions feel free to ask. I will be exploring this laptop a lot in the next couple of days.

Reviews.Title: Great little Device
Reviews.Author: K. Conklin
Reviews.Content: I had the problem of two computers running Windows XP and I took a chance on purchasing this Acer for one of my homes. So very happy with speed of bootup, battery life, portability, supplying and supporting all my computing needs in the location I chose it for. Screen resolution fine but sound is a tad bit tinny. Doesn't trouble me because I loved the price for what this little puppy can do. Glad I ordered this vs all the laptops I researched with Windows 8.1. Yup, another satisfied customer.*Added Tip - I am one to ignore direction sheets. I got a notice from Google to update my payment info for the $5 legacy storage plan I have been paying for a number of years to ensure my photos in picasa were maintained. Lightbulb! I don't need to pay for the storage for two years with the purchase of the Chromebook as you get 100 GB free for two years, but you have to redeem the offer by visiting chromebook.com/goodies.

Reviews.Title: Bought it for the Linux Support, not for ChromeOS
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: Hands down one of the best laptops I have paid a little over 200 dollars for. Does the job in GNU\Linux (Xubuntu 14.04) well. Requires some kmods for trackpad but easily doable. Battery life is still great even in the other operating system.

Reviews.Title: Just a note about the keyboard
Reviews.Author: Jeremiah Chavez
Reviews.Content: I did some research about the differences between various models of the Acer C720.The keyboard for the regular model of the Acer C720 (non-touchscreen) has a better keyboard than the touchscreen model (C720P). This was true for 2013. I have a 2014 model of the C720 but the keyboard feels worse than some of the test units at local stores I visited to test the Acer C720 before buying one. Maybe I'm just imagining things, or maybe Acer changed the way they make the non-touchscreen models so they are not as good now. I don't know.For what it's worth, the specific model that I have is an Acer C720-2848. I hope this helps anyone thinking of buying an Acer C720.

Reviews.Title: nice for web!
Reviews.Author: osito
Reviews.Content: i just love it. every penny worth it.if you just want to hang out in web, this is the laptop you have to buy it

Reviews.Title: Awesome linux computer!
Reviews.Author: bradv
Reviews.Content: I bought this computer to run linux. I've only tried ChromeOS briefly, so I can't comment on Chromebook usage.With Xubuntu 14.04 loaded, the computer performance is amazing, especially for the price. Everything from boot time to application start times are really quick. No need to worry about the 2 GB memory limit; I've had no slowdowns even with 15 Firefox tabs open. Movies, music and Humble Bundle games run perfectly.I leave a tiny Sandisk Fit 64 GB USB drive in the computer for file storage. Works great.It's amazingly cool and quiet running. The temperature of the notebook barely rises, even when playing games. I haven't yet noticed any fan noise.Just follow the Arch Linux instructions, and you'll have a fast, ultralight linux laptop in no time!Pros: Good performance, lightweight, inexpensive, linux-friendly, cool and quietCons: USB storage needed

Reviews.Title: Fantastic machine
Reviews.Author: Andrew Willson
Reviews.Content: I bought this on impulse after receiving loads of gift cards for Christmas. Once of the best purchases I've ever made.I bought it expecting to be used as a secondary machine, but it's honestly been my primary computer since I bought it. The Haswell processor is incredibly quick, and the SSD is lovely. This thing loads pages as quickly as my i7 gaming rig. I've never had a single problem with it. I would definitely recommend this as a secondary machine, and in some cases a primary one. Great product!

Reviews.Title: just love it
Reviews.Author: Deb "movie  freak"
Reviews.Content: Yes you cant do everything on it, but pretty close to it, quicker and simply. Great for email surfing the net , and video watching, Very good screen resolution and sound quality, A very quality product, go ahead you cant do any better especially at this price.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my needs
Reviews.Author: Thomas Smith "tjaye"
Reviews.Content: Instant start, great apps, charges quickly. Used mainly for web surfing.  . Enjoy it more then my tablet for my needs. Plus do not have to use IE which is much slower.

Reviews.Title: Really like it, from a happy owner.
Reviews.Author: H. Wang "jwangamazon"
Reviews.Content: My 5-year-old Window-based netbook computer was too slow to run latest web browser. So, I was looking for replacement. But I didn't want to spent too much money for a full-blown notebook, as my main purpose was web surfing and email checking. So, my choice would be either tablet, or chromebook. I tried the 7 inch and 8 inch tablet and I was not happy with the small screen real estate as I didn't want to hurt my vision with small fonts. So, I gave it a try on chromebook.I was surprised that such an inexpensive device could do so much. The whole setup took about 2 to 3 minutes only. After having it for couple of days, it became my favorite machine just because it was so simple, light and super fast start-up with the solid-state drive. Better yet, I never need to worry about virsus or malware. And the battery life was great...8 to 9 hours run on my tests. Some people complained about the keyboard. Frankly, I didn't feel anything wrong with the keyboard.However, the display was a little bit dim for my taste. So, I usually brought up the brightness. This was done easily with the brightness adjustment keys on the keyboard. Not a big deal.I bought the Acer Chromebook from local *C*O*S*T*C*O store because it had a very generous 90-day return policy. Before the end of the 90-day trial period, I bought one more for my daughter for doing homework at after-school center. It's cheap enough so I won't feel too bad if it is damaged.Up to now, I have owned the Acer Chromebook for more than half year and it's used on daily basis. I am very happy with it, especially with its low price and good features. I would definitely recommend Chromebook to my friends.

Reviews.Title: just received
Reviews.Author: loretta rodenburg
Reviews.Content: this computer took all of 2 minutes to set up and go..it's extremely light weight and has a great picture.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop for College Students
Reviews.Author: Christian Kiernan
Reviews.Content: Cheap and easy to use. Great for note-taking due to its small size, runs internet great, solid battery life. Can be annoying dealing with Google Documents (hard to transfer over to Word sometimes). Overall you get a good bang for you buck!

Reviews.Title: great value
Reviews.Author: michael putnam
Reviews.Content: no complaints--100% what I expected from Amazon's info--lightning fast, lightweight and for me @ 57yrs a perfect laptop for all basic needs.

Reviews.Title: Wife loves it!
Reviews.Author: Jewdi-Nite
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife. She absolutely loves it. It is low maintenance and lightning fast! She has recommended it to all of her friends.

Reviews.Title: love this laptop
Reviews.Author: Deborah Hoster
Reviews.Content: We received our acer C720 this week and i love it. Easy to use right out of the box. My husband, who is not computer literate, has been on it every night. All the reviews helped. I highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: Mr. Randall Miller "rlee"
Reviews.Content: This thing is so neat I don't know where to begin. Maybe it's because I am not much of a "techie" but the idea that I can do most anything on this little baby that I can do with my desktop is to me simply phenomenal. Opened it up, typed in my Wi-Fi and gmail passwords and up popped my Chrome browser that I use all the time on my desktop configured with all my settings, favorites, etc, and I was on my way.There are a few keyboard quirks (no delete key, just a backspace key delete after highlighting) and a few other learning curve items but, as I said, I'm no techie and an old guy at that, so if I could whiz through that you can too!Delivered within 48 hours of ordering, great price, and thanks again Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Price/quality best ratio
Reviews.Author: Guillermo
Reviews.Content: Before you complain, remember this is a $199 product. I like the product, works fine. I knew the limitations beforehand but it does what I need. I cannot play HD videos (or if it does, with no sound) but this is not a HD screen so it makes sense. It takes time to learn keyboard shortcuts and there is no Delete key.

Reviews.Title: Would buy again! Its a steal!
Reviews.Author: steven
Reviews.Content: First time using a chromebook. In fact first time buying a laptop. I decided to get this one, so my girlfriend can use it for college and let me play video games in my desktop pc. After almost 2 months, she liked it so much that her iPad is collecting dust somewhere in the house. It seems well build. Screen is not the best one, but it gets the job done. Battery last around 7 hours with low screen brightness. I installed chrubuntu on this, and Im loving it!

Reviews.Title: My go-to device when I need quick information
Reviews.Author: Archie Bunker
Reviews.Content: Love this little unit for its' speed and simplicity. Faster and easier than using my iphone or android tablet. I know that many laptop fans will look down their noses on this unit since you do need an internet connection to make it work, but that's what I do mostly - surfing the web and reading emails. Battery life is fantastic - better than any device I own. And its' nice not having to deal with the clogging security programs you need with a Windows laptop. Love this Chromebook!

Reviews.Title: Chrome Book
Reviews.Author: Roosevelt D. Hall "The Rose"
Reviews.Content: This computer is for anyone who doesn't have an ego that they need a dvd drive and all the other bells and whistles and for folks who work for a living and don't have large amounts of money to throw away on a laptop, but needs one that delivers exactly what the folks at chromebook promised.

Reviews.Title: Chromebook
Reviews.Author: Michele A Dwyer
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect gift for my 11 yr old son and 15 yr old niece.The love it.  It was easy to use.  My son can log into his school google account and do assignments.  My niece is into the social media and this was also perfect for her. The only difficulty is if you absolutely must use Windows products or if a website is not current enough to support Google Chrome. I only paid $200 each.  It was a "WOW" gift for both of them which is not easy at their age.  Niece wanted $1200 Mac book but forgot all about that after receiving this one. Both were received quickly and in perfect condition.  Will do business with these vendors again.

Reviews.Title: Awesome laptop
Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: This is the best laptop you can get for the price. The only thing about it I don't like is that it doesn't have a DVD drive. But other than that it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: simple
Reviews.Author: LK Duck "Lloyd"
Reviews.Content: This is a great communication device for simple task and web surfing. An inexpensive cross between a small notebook and a large tablet that works very well.

Reviews.Title: Great fast, starter laptop.
Reviews.Author: Elijah Margeaux
Reviews.Content: Laptop is great, it's just for browsing and watching movies. Wish Google had more "umph" to offer but overall these CB's are great for having when the guest's need something to enjoy during the weekend. If your a downloader or have some sort business, avoid. These are browsing laptop's only.

Reviews.Title: What a great device!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "orestes909"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Acer with the touch screen and the new Intel processor. I get at least 8 hours of battery life. I also bought a 64 GB sd card and I loaded with videos and documents I might need when travelling. So far I haven't used much of it because the way Google Drive works is absolutely fantastic. I have immediate access to everything I need and the videos can play from the Drive into the TV using Chromecast directly from the tab you have them open. Everybody I have shown the Chromebook have gotten interested in it. I also replaced using Skype with Google Hangouts in terms of the ability to have video and audio conferences with other people in other cities and countries. The interface is great!.The most significant aspect of this device is the 7 seconds that takes to start the laptop...A great product.If you are ready to try a different approach to productivity, without depending on Microsoft software, this is for you.

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: Bob "bcongdon"
Reviews.Content: Hard to expect a lot for $199 but the Acer Chromebook C720 is pretty amazing for the price. Yes, it would be nice if the screen was higher resolution but for most of what I want to use it for (and for the money) this is a great deal.By the way, even though you won't have to charge it very frequently, if you're looking to buy a second power adapter, I found that the "Pwr+ Ac Adapter Charger for Acer Chromebook C720-2848" (available here on Amazon) works great.

Reviews.Title: Great book for the price.
Reviews.Author: Corey Robertson
Reviews.Content: This is a great little surfing laptop. Not a powerhouse, but has enough to run some Google Spreadsheets. Starts so fast you'd think it was still on.

Reviews.Title: This acer is fast, and Chrome os is great
Reviews.Author: satisfied dude
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about chrome os but now i am hooked. Acer put a mucsle car under the hood of this chromebook.

Reviews.Title: vary handy and easy to use
Reviews.Author: Hawaii Archer
Reviews.Content: i love this laptop. the only reason i give it a 4 stars is that it can't open some type of file, and you cant edit someone's powerpoint file.

Reviews.Title: Fulfilled all of my needs at a great price!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I needed a light laptop to use on campus. It's perfect as I only use it for web browsing, netflix, spotify, etc.

Reviews.Title: Its a Chromebook, not much functinality
Reviews.Author: JD
Reviews.Content: BUT! Price is good, and it uses an SSD so it operates very quick, great for just simple work loads

Reviews.Title: Skeptical at First, but WOW!
Reviews.Author: terry l correll
Reviews.Content: This thing is awesome. At first I was a little uncertain that a 200 dollar (yes, only 200 bucks) laptop could be worth anything at all. However, after using this thing for a while now I am thoroughly pleased. The web browsing on this thing is impeccable and, in fact, loads faster than my family's $2500 mac desktop. I recommend this to any school who wants great research tools for their student or to anyone looking for an awesome way to access the web.

Reviews.Title: Intremittent lost power and crashed.
Reviews.Author: Michael Ellis
Reviews.Content: Intermittently lost pwer and crashed with lots of battery life left. We followed Acer's instructions to correct the problem but none worked. Seemed to be a nice machine when it worked. We sent it back and will wait for new models probably not from Acer.

Reviews.Title: Love this laptop
Reviews.Author: Tracey I
Reviews.Content: This laptop rocks! It's a perfect size and easy to use.I bought it for my computer illiterate boyfriend  and he was able to turn it on and look at Craigs list .I love it! I was going to buy one for myself, but..

Reviews.Title: wow
Reviews.Author: bvande
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a "cheap laptop" to get me through the last semester of school...and, this thing is amazing!! I have it dual loaded with Xubuntu and ChromeOS and it's plenty fast in both environments.The only thing I don't like is the keyboard...hate these new flat keys but whatever :) I'd buy it again and have recommended it a few times already.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: ana
Reviews.Content: Awesome little laptop. It runs off Google chrome, so if your expecting the Microsoft programs this isnt the laptop for you. It has Google docs for letters and such but does not have any of the Microsoft office programs. It does its own updates and no virus worried so far. Awesome for social media, checking, email, and everyday tasks. Comes with a  built in camera so you can do online video chat, and its pretty small and portable so you can take with you almost anywhere. And for the price how can you complain! :)UPDATE: I've had it for 3 days and it turned off on me and refuses to fully turn back on I'm returning it I haven't even had it a week yet and already having problems

Reviews.Title: Not for the working man
Reviews.Author: Theodore Lewis-Lawrence
Reviews.Content: I like it,  is simple and sharp unfortunately it doesn't really help with any of my work.  Great for fun but don't buy if you are looking for a day job Computer.

Reviews.Title: How can you not love this thing?
Reviews.Author: Mr. John V. Briggs
Reviews.Content: A $200 laptop that works better than my $700 Sony Vaio? Check. When you meet other people that are using chromebooks, it's an instant connection as well.

Reviews.Title: Works great and the battery life is awesome!
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I'd recommend this laptop to anyone... as a second computer.  It's great for what a chromebook is meant for, delivering internet content.  I still think having a primary pc is a good idea for other tasks.  I say this, but I know this will be my primary computer now, because I usually only need a computer for the internet.The fast boot times, instant on from sleep mode and battery life make this a great purchase.  The only downfall is the screen.  For $200 you have to realize you can't have it all.  The screen isn't bad, just not great from different viewing angles.  I definitely wouldn't consider it a deal breaker by any means.I love the keyboard and trackpad.  The 'chicklet' style keyboard is great to type on.  I love the trackpad and the two finger scrolling.  It's extremely easy to get used to.  I've read a lot of reviews that say it feels cheap.  It's $200!  It's not going to be made out of aircraft grade aluminum.  I like the plastic case for this chromebook.  It's very light and I don't think it feels cheap at all.

Reviews.Title: Really like this computer
Reviews.Author: fancyloot
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my son and he really likes it.  He finds it easy to navigate, it does all that he wants it to and the size is perfect.One beware issue:  I thought I was purchasing from AMAZON but it was a private company.  I paid $70 more than Amazon list price as Amazon was out of stock.  The 3rd party gouged me during the holiday season.  When I called to resolve the issue, Amazon was apologetic but had already funded the seller.  Amazon had advertised it at $70 less which is how I found out that I over paid.  Very Frustrating......

Reviews.Title: Good for ny kids, not for me
Reviews.Author: Keisha Lee
Reviews.Content: Great for my kids who do everything on the internet....i just wish they were able to use skype in them. So far that is the only drawback

Reviews.Title: Fast and Easy!
Reviews.Author: thomas e mcdermott
Reviews.Content: Great way to browse the internet--but oh so much more-so many extras with all the Apps and learning to store stuff "in the cloud" is so easy

Reviews.Title: Works better than Win8
Reviews.Author: CC
Reviews.Content: It does only one thing, browse the web, and it does it very well. It doesn't have many features, and that's a good thing because it makes it very easy to use. I bought this for my 50-year-old father who really struggled to use a Win8 laptop, and this Chromebook is a big upgrade.

Reviews.Title: Surprisingly effective as a second computer
Reviews.Author: Craig A Estep
Reviews.Content: There's a bit of a learning curve, I imagine, if you're not used to google apps, but I'm surprised how much of my work and daily activities I can perform on this small, cheap device.  And just as quickly as on my $1000 2012 ssd mac mini.I was afraid that I wouldn't be able to do much, but I continue to be pleasantly surprised. I can hook this up to an HD monitor and stream HD video on it while continuing to work on my little screen.  There is a file system that can open most files in the chrome browser.  My epub files are handled through a Chrome Extension as I imagine many files are that are not natively supported in the OS. The battery is what it claims to be (8-8.5 hours). The device starts up extremely fast, charges fast (2-2.5 hours?), and shuts down fast.  Being connected to the internet is more important on this device than others, but being connected to the internet is not a problem the vast majority of the time for me.  The screen is more than adequate.  Not great viewing angles but the screen can be tilted 145 degrees or so (just an estimate).  Speakers are loud and adequate.  The touchpad is not super sensitive--you had to make sure your two fingers are a little apart most of the time when scrolling.  I like that you can use 3 fingers on the touchpad to scroll through open tabs. Keyboad is more than adequate to type on. Learning the ropes with keyboard shortcuts is worth your time.Again, most of it is adequate. I'm impressed by how quick it is and the battery life.  Well worth $200!!!

Reviews.Title: Good value, just the right size
Reviews.Author: Frequent Amazon Shopper
Reviews.Content: Meets the needs for surfing the web, watching web videos and email. The office productivity apps are a bonus. Battery life is decent, seems to be close to about the 8 hours they claim. We charge it about every other day.The display could be better though

Reviews.Title: my husband now thinks it's his
Reviews.Author: ld
Reviews.Content: We love it..it's fast,  lightweight and easily portable. ?..carries a long enough battery life that not quickly drained. Only it just doesn't have all the usual Google apps, ....can't figure why that is, ...but no biggie,  because we have a phone with all the apps desired. ?..I bought for me but may have to buy another because my husband love's it.

Reviews.Title: Amazing secondary device
Reviews.Author: ATM
Reviews.Content: Pros:- boots up in 7 seconds if not less- battery life almost 8 hours- loads sites fast- light- secure (great for older and younger people or for people who don't know a lot about computers -- in a way this is the best feature)- cheaper than iPad and I like to have keyboard and touchpad, a USB mouse too.- easy to share with other people, each one can log in with their own google accounts to personalized browser experience (bookmarks, history, tabs and so on).Con:Like any other Chromebook is not for everyone or for any purpose, for that it's better to have another PC with Windows or Mac OS in your household, this is a great second device. I highly recommend it for such a purpose.(I got the 4GB model, I don't know if having only 2GB would negatively influence the performance, the 4GB works great, I don't think that the 2GB would be underpowered).

Reviews.Title: great computer
Reviews.Author: julio pardo
Reviews.Content: I have had other laptops before but this one is the best by far. It just takes seconds to turn on like advertised. It was a great buy and i would recommend it  to anyone. The only thing that the app store does not have is Skype. I hope it will be added.

Reviews.Title: WiFi issues??
Reviews.Author: DJO
Reviews.Content: I like this mini laptop a lot, very light and convenient to hold. BUT, on occasion, I'm getting the dreaded "web page cannot be displayed". It will load OK after I repeat the command. I've rebooted my router and even did a pwer wash, but to no avail. Guess have to live with it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent device.
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: As a teacher how uses Google Docs with my class, I have found the new C720 to be an excellent device that is fast, easy to use and perfect for in the classroom :)

Reviews.Title: Cannot print to a local networked printer in a reasonable way!!!
Reviews.Author: PJS
Reviews.Content: If you are considering buying this device, be sure that before you click "buy" you thoroughly understand its lack of reasonable options for printing!!!If printing is not important to you, then feel free to skip on to the next customer review, my comments will not be relevant to you.In our home we have multiple computing devices... Windows PCs, Linux PCs, Macs. All can easily print to any of three home printers over our local network.With the Chromebook, you must 1) Have another computer with Google Chrome installed, up and running and connected to the Internet (not just your local network) 2) Register that printer with Google so that they can manage printing to the device through "the cloud".(the alternative is to buy a special "cloud ready" printer that you connect to Google's cloud services.)I wish that Amazon allowed offsite links in the review so that I could point you to the details as documented on Google's own website. If printing is important to you, I urge you to do a web search and find their site and read for yourself.I have no intention of consigning management of my printer to Google, Microsoft, Apple, or any other company. I am not going to keep a second computer running just to print.This is a show-stopper to me. I wish I had not wasted my money.Maybe you never print from your computer. Maybe you are OK with Google managing your printer. If so, go ahead and buy a Chromebook.

Reviews.Title: New Experience with Chromebook
Reviews.Author: mike
Reviews.Content: I used to publish a newsletter for our Legion Post. When my old laptop died in FL, I bought a Chromebook. Even with the MS Word App, it won't do most of the things I needed to get the newsletter done. On the positive side, I like the speed with which it handles internet duties--mail, browsing, calendar, etc. It's very handy, light, and travels well. Charging time is fast and battery life is super. Again, on the positive side, someone else got stuck doing the newsletter.

Reviews.Title: Amazing $200 Gadget!
Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: First off, let's get this out of the way...IT IS NOT A LAPTOP! But let's get to what it does do! It is an amazing web browser. It is very fast. I have had mine a little over 6 months and I have never had an issue with it. It boasts a 10 second start up to internet speed and that's accurate. You do have to be connected to the internet to use it. It is a paperweight without it. It is really nice being able to access all of your files, pix, ect on any internet accessible computer with the Google Drive.Google Docs is really nice too. It's free and you don't have a trial period like Mic Office. I really like it. I highly recommend for the basic computer user. It's not for the super high tech people, but for the basic student or web browser, it's great. If you use your Google Drive space (similar to cloud), then you can buy more.

Reviews.Title: Impressive
Reviews.Author: Ralph Thayer
Reviews.Content: Once you understand that a Chromebook can only do what otherwise can be done through Google's Chrome browser and a Wi-Fi connection to the Internet on a "regular" (Windows or Mac) computer, this can be a marvelously useful device for $199 (06-FB-14). Google Cloud, Google Drive, Google Docs, etc. really team up to give you broad range of utility: word processing, spreadsheets, photos, drawings, etc. and of course web-surfing.

Reviews.Title: Exactly What I Expected
Reviews.Author: MoonTiger
Reviews.Content: I've only had my C720 Chromebook for a few days, but I already love it.My desktop died almost a year ago.  It was almost 9 years old and obsolete.  I had upgraded it a few times, and it was a real workhorse while it lasted.  The BSOD (blue screen of death) had become a daily occurrence, so I finally let it stay dead.I replaced it with a tablet which I thought would be sufficient since I'm now retired.  But there were limitations - small screen (OK for watching videos & playing games) and no SD card slot.  I hated the virtual keyboard, so I purchased a Bluetooth keyboard, and that helped a lot.  But I really got tired of having to use my sister's laptop to upload photos from my camera plus having constant eyestrain, so I ordered this Chromebook.Setup was quick & easy!  Just log in to your google account and enter your internet password.  I adjusted a few settings for my personal preference, but that was it!  I had already been using Google Drive, so all my docs were already in the cloud.There are numerous reviews here that detail the technical specs, so I won't rehash those.  Just want to say the battery life is excellent, & the keyboard is decent.  And this thing is fast!  I usually have 7 or 8 tabs open, and I haven't noticed any slowing at all.  It boots up in about 7 or 8 seconds, and it wakes up from sleep mode instantly.I use it mostly for YouTube, Facebook, Pinterest, Email, shopping, banking, bill-paying -- all online stuff I've been doing for years.  Web browsing is a breeze, and I've had no problems in downloading (saving) pages.I'm giving it 5 stars because it would be hard to beat at this price point, & it does everything I need it to do.  If something happens to make me change my mind in the future, I'll come back & update this review.

Reviews.Title: Missing Power Cord
Reviews.Author: pikoman
Reviews.Content: The box is opened (and sealed with a VOID sticker) and the power cord is missing in the box. Amazon should check all the items are ok in the box before selling it.

Reviews.Title: So far so good...
Reviews.Author: sisy m mogollon reina
Reviews.Content: The keyboard feels flimsy and the screen is a little smaller than the Ipad's screen. However, the battery life is very good, it charges quickly, it is super light and it is perfect for what I needed, fast, convenient access to internet.

Reviews.Title: Teen user
Reviews.Author: Kristina
Reviews.Content: I love this little computer. If you just need something to use the internet and not save a lot of stuff because there isn't enough space on it. It is easy to use and very lightweight. Its definitely portable and you can use it offline if needed. I love it! Don't buy if you need an actual computer.

Reviews.Title: Numerous perpetual issues
Reviews.Author: No name
Reviews.Content: I really liked how light this chromebook was but the issues were perpetual. I could not get it to stay connected to the internet. It was constantly "reloading" and locking up. I couldn't open attachments to emails and then get the "reload" message pretty consistently. I finally surrendered and put it all back in the box. Overall incredibly disappointing so I returned it.

Reviews.Title: great til it breaks
Reviews.Author: Let Girls Lead
Reviews.Content: first off, amazon only gives you 30 days to return this product, so if anything happens after that, goo luck replacing it.second, the 'warranty' on this compute doesn't cover any sort of damages or replacements. the screen cracked while i was opening the chromebook, which was irritating enough. i called customer service to ask how to go about fixing it and was told that the 1 year limited warranty only covered replacement of missing parts. when i aske how much it costs to fix the screen, i was surprised to find that it was $199 plus tax, so essentially the same price hat was paid fo the computer in the first place. how does that make any sense? so not only can i not return it, but its not even worth fixing it. i hope it can at least be recycled b/c the last thing i want to do is contribute to the terrible e-waster pandemic.it works great, espcially for the pric, and the audio is fantástico, but if you forsee a drop or crack, get something sturdier and with a better warranty.i've had it for a month and a half

Reviews.Title: I love the SWAG
Reviews.Author: Billy Watt
Reviews.Content: Wow, the processing SWAG in this laptop was like none I've ever seen before. For such a cheap price, the SWAG processor would be worth it alone. A must buy.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Joseph B. Schulz
Reviews.Content: For $200 you can't go wrong. It's lightweight, boots up in just a second, and has a very stable operating system. Surfs the web quickly and without any problems. You can't do much offline "work" in the sense of traditional PC tasks on it, but it does have the advantage of having tons of apps available. It's a great product that will save you a lot of time and make your life easier.

Reviews.Title: worked fine until the touchpad started doing whatever it wanted
Reviews.Author: brian
Reviews.Content: The touchpad broke a month after i could get it returned or replaced.  Very horrible news for me.  It's decent but who knows how long it will last.

Reviews.Title: Acer C720
Reviews.Author: Shirley Turner
Reviews.Content: I chose this rating because I have had my Chromebook for about a month and it keeps flashing like a bad neon light then, the entire screen goes black and I have to close down the lid and lift back up.  After a few minutes, I have to repeat the process over again.  When it started happening, I tried to click on "get a replacement" and was informed my time had expired!  I haven't even finished paying for it yet so YES, I am disappointed.  Other than that, I like the Acer.

Reviews.Title: We're Happy
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I does all it is supposed to do at a fair price.It sits on the end table next to the couch.

Reviews.Title: it starts up super fast and its super cheap
Reviews.Author: AMAZON SHOPPER
Reviews.Content: the chrome thing takes some getting used to but i'm getting therei didn't get the storage thing because apparently i waited too long to submit the formso i tried emailing google like five times and i just keep getting form emailsbeware googlei'm hooked on all of theirsurfemailmusicphotos butGOOGLE IS WINDOWS ALL OVER AGAIN

Reviews.Title: Speedy browsing tool, but not for some parts of the world where Google access is restricted
Reviews.Author: Peide Xie "William Y. Ja"
Reviews.Content: Lightweight, speedy web surfing tool to travel with, especially for use in the USA or perhaps much of the developed world. But it would be a mistake to take it to countries in which Google access (search engine esp.) is restricted by foreign governments. Also, while the product is touted as Microsoft Office files compatible, it does not offer easy editing or document changes unless your MS documents were created with MS Office 2007 or later. Worst of all is that the Chromebook does not allow easy installation of any non-Chrome OS, general third-party applications. Has unpredictable, unstable performance issues with some of the most popular media files such as .flv and .avi. Perhaps later versions of the Chrome OS might be "more ready for prime time".

Reviews.Title: Affordable, Fast, and lots of Fun
Reviews.Author: William J. Umlah
Reviews.Content: Good operating system and machine. Video graphics are good. HDMI hook up is easy so you can use the Acer to watch movies. The operating system is fast and the available word processor and spreadsheet work well. This is the wave of the future and this machine is an affordable way to ride the wave!

Reviews.Title: Does not work for me.
Reviews.Author: Rustam Garrey "power user"
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to love this Chromebook.  It is a great value for the money and solidly built. Screen, keyboard and track-pad are not outstanding, but easily four stars. Inputs and outputs are adequate for what this gadget is. I like the size and ergonomics. I can see someone using this for email, news and Google searches in the kitchen. Great for a granny, useful for a middle-school student. But not for me.What made me return it are three big negative things (for my uses):- USB port would not access most devices as mass storage. Thumb drive - yes, smartphone or MP3 player - no. Did not test this extensively, but what did not work is enough for me.- No decent media player is available for download. Built-in one is a joke. Does not support multiple audio tracks or any advanced audio codecs, no control over anything.  It did play my homemade MP4 files with PCM audio well, but that was it.- No Skype. Whatever they tell you about workarounds (outlook.com, IM+) is not true - these only allow to text message via Skype. There is no true audio/video calling capability. Google tries to steer you towards their own video-chat service (anybody surprised?), but all my friends use Skype.In my view Google took the idea of doing everything on the Net and in the Cloud a little bit too far too fast. I think I am not yet ready to love this kind of computing. I still want some offline capability and peripheral expandability.

Reviews.Title: Great deal.  Refurbished = new.
Reviews.Author: Samantha Marshall
Reviews.Content: Couldn't be happier.  For the price, a great second computer for the kids to use for school work.  I find myself using it sometimes instead of my iPad, even though I have a great keyboard/case for the iPad.

Reviews.Title: Chromebook
Reviews.Author: crissi
Reviews.Content: Words of advice do LOTS of research on the chromebooks. If your not connected to the internet you CAN NOT do ANYTHING on it. As well you can only use google made programs.. I didnt do a lot of research on it and have been kicking myself for it ever since.

Reviews.Title: VERY FAST
Reviews.Author: janet serrano
Reviews.Content: IT WAS FASTER THAN EXPECTED. BUT DID NOT KNOW ABOUT SIGNING FOR IT TIL I NOTICED IT WAS LEFT OUTSIDE. NOT GOOD.BUT I KNOW NOW WHEN I ORDER..

Reviews.Title: Great computer BUT will take some getting used to.
Reviews.Author: Serg E.
Reviews.Content: This computer has a brand new operating system so the typical programs you have been accustomed to on a Windows or Mac computer are GONE, but the Chromebook is still very user friends thanks to Google Drive.It comes standard with programs that closely resemble Powerpoint, Excel, and Microsoft Word. Thankfully, you are allowed to dowload, open and edit .doc, .docx, ppt, pptx, and Excel files. Granted, it was a struggle trying to figure out how, but it worked out in the end.Also a plus, all the files you make are automatically saved to your Google Drive, so you can access the files from any computer. If you want to access from a Windows computer, you will be able to download the document as Word Document or even a PDF. BUT from my experience, the format of the Word Doc may slightly change, meaning you'll have to reformat things in the Word Doc, which can be a pain.The trackpad also takes getting used to. It sometimes does things that I do not want it to do. It is pretty cool once you figure out all the shortcuts.Overall, I would buy another one in a heartbeat. Great product with a couple of minor problems here and there, but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding value
Reviews.Author: KKID44
Reviews.Content: I bought the Acer c720 to replace my 7 year old Linux HP netbook.  The C720 is definitely a second computer, but it is the best web based device to have.  It has a decent screen size, real light weight, a super long battery life (8 hrs), almost instant on use (I use to do quick checks of my email before I boot up my iPhone or desktop), and fast (I find it loads web pages faster than my desk, Ivy Bridge i7 16gig RAM desktop machine).  I believe the virus checking on my desktop and continual updating really slows things down.  I think that the MAC and Windows based machines have to watch their backs.  Now there are downsides.  I one that bugs me the most is the lack of DELETE key on the Chromebook keyboard.  If you are looking for doing Email and web surfing this is the best thing you can do for yourself.

Reviews.Title: perfect!
Reviews.Author: Tamika Quinonez
Reviews.Content: its so perfect. perfect notebook. fast, doesnt catch any viruses. not much maintenance. volume is really good, quality is really good. Its a really cute product too.

Reviews.Title: Excellent laptop if your usage is surfing, facebook, netflix , gmail etc
Reviews.Author: Srinivasan Krishna
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife and we both love it. Excellent battery, display, no annoying sounds of fan. The web streaming is surprisingly very good even for high definition videos. Very light weight too.Only negative is the small 11.6 inch. I did not know it will be this small. If I buy another Chromebook for me as my second computer, it will be a 14inch HP one.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for me
Reviews.Author: AWN
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this purchase.  I bought it because my 2008 Macbook Pro stopped working.  The Apple store worker told me that it would cost $500 to replace a part.  I realized I didn't really need or use that laptop to it's full potential.  So I decided to purchase this Chromebook to "tide me over" until I made a new laptop purchase. But this has suited me wonderfully so far.  I use this as my entertainment computer. I am able to check emails, websurf, stream movies, etc.  I also love that it is so light and portable. I can take it everywhere. The battery life is long. And at such a low price, I don't feel bad about the possibility of losing or breaking it. In that way it contributes to less stress for me- like one less thing to worry about.

Reviews.Title: Just what I ordered
Reviews.Author: Carrie Karolcik
Reviews.Content: Received when promised, Works for what I need. Thank you very much, I am looking forward to using my Chromebook.

Reviews.Title: Plenty of bang for just a few bucks
Reviews.Author: Richard Airhart
Reviews.Content: We needed a faster computer for Facebook, online videos, etc. and couldn't afford a full fledged laptop, so after reading some reviews of the Chromebook, I realized that it would do everything we wanted to do online and at a very low cost. You just have to buy into the concept that it uses the online Google software and applications for spreadsheets, word processing, etc.; there is no actual hard drive, just a small 2 gig storage drive that works similar to a built-in usb flash drive, and they give you some extra space on Google Drive free for a couple of years. You can also save files to USB flash drives using the usb ports, but you have to download to the built-in drive first and then cut and paste to the flash drive. There is no DVD player or burner. You can't install on-board software; but we use it mainly for web browsing, You Tube videos, Facebook, etc., so we are very happy with our Acer Chromebook, especially for the low price we paid; and would definitely recommend it to a friend. It apparently has a very fast processor and can stream high definition videos even with multiple windows open. It has a large high definition screen - the picture quality is excellent and it is very thin and lightweight, and the sound quality is amazingly good from the small built-in speakers.  It also has a built-in web cam which is surprisingly good quality. You can't use Skype, but you can use Google Hangouts which is similar to Skype.  The only problem we have had is that it often has trouble finding our home wi-fi network and I have to reset my router every now and then and restart the Chromebook to clear up the problem; but I think the problem is being caused by my antique router which I need to replace. As an experiment, I took the Chromebook to several bookstores, coffee shops, McDonald's etc. to test it and it jumped right onto the wi-fi networks every time - it is only at home that I have the connection problems, so I think the Chromebook is fine as long as you have a good strong wireless router. All in all - a very good value and a good product for wireless web browsing.

Reviews.Title: Chromebook meets expectations
Reviews.Author: robert mestrez
Reviews.Content: I have considerable experience with Windows computers, so I was curious about the Chromebook.It meets all my expectations, (remoted to my desktop with Windows 7).  Enjoy the instant on, off andthe complete lack of concern for viruses.  The build quality is sufficient for the price range, the screenalso is adequate.  However, the entire laptop, desktop, monitor market ought to be at least 1080p bynow.  Kudos to amazon.com for another faultless transaction.  Oh, and not part of this rating, throwall congressmen out of office NLT tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: Mom loved it
Reviews.Author: Adaobi N.
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my mom for her bday! She takes it everywhere cuz it's so light! I think it's worht the price

Reviews.Title: Great Chromebook But If You Have The Money Get The 4GB RAM Version
Reviews.Author: Tyson Chaplin
Reviews.Content: I am in charge of finding and purchasing computers for my school and I recently bought a couple of these for some students to pilot prior to buying this model in quantity. This is a great Chromebook! It is speedy, has good wifi connectivity, and has all of the features I would expect when buying a pricier model of computer such as a webcam and HDMI port. The battery life on this Chromebook is also insanely good. I have been consistently getting about 7-8hrs of battery life while doing light web browsing and word processing.Now for the slight downsides to this model. First, the 2GB of RAM is not upgradeable later on. The modules are soldered to the motherboard and therefore, cannot be removed. I would have liked to have been able to add more memory later on as the computers aged but alas, that will not be the case with this model. For that reason, I would suggest buying the 4GB model that is available for slightly more money. The 4GB makes the Chromebook a slight be zippier and will help it age more gracefully. The reason I opted for the 2GB version was to see how it performed for the students during their daily tasks and I was also looking to save some money. When I do a complete rollout to the student body, I may end up purchasing the 4GB model for the extra $50 a piece.Lastly, if this is your first Chromebook and you are used to a bigger screen, I don't need to tell you this screen is noticeably smaller than what you are used to. I do most of my work from a 15" laptop and this model is a strain on my eyes when I have a lot of tabs open. I think users could get used to this but I just wanted to warn potential buyers. Before buying, trying to see what this model looks like in real life to make sure the screen is adequate for your needs.This is a great Chromebook, possibly the best currently on the market at its price point but if you can afford it, get the 4GB version just to stretch the life of the machine a little bit more.

Reviews.Title: Good computer, but not great.
Reviews.Author: Jschneids86
Reviews.Content: I do like this computer, it's fast and easy to use. Only thing is it's not compatible with a lot of websites or software. Google OS is a somewhat new OS so that's to be expected, but it can be frustrating. Hopefully google and other companies will work together in the future to come out with more compatible software.

Reviews.Title: Great for email and internet surfing
Reviews.Author: Paul 1946 "Paul46"
Reviews.Content: I bought this Chromebook (C710-2847) used as I needed something for my wife to use at a church conference and all the materials are to be online to eliminate the need for 3 huge binders of materials.  We have an ancient laptop that weighs in at about 10lbs. and not something anyone would consider portable today.  I bought this little marvel at a pawn shop with 4Gb of ram and 32 GB hard drive for $100 out the door.  What a delightful machine!  It operates very nicely but you do have to get a google account (free) and you will be up and running in no time.  You will also have to figure out how to get your router and the tablet connected... not all that difficult.  This is a very powerful little notebook and if there is a downfall for me it is the keyboard.  My fingers like a traditional keyboard so I have simply reverted to using my index fingers to navigate the keyboard.The other thing I like is all the bloatware is gone and you don't have to deal with antivirus software either.  My chromebook is nearly as fast as my desktop computer that has 8gb of ram. I have come to appreciate what salves we are to the sloppy Windows operating systems we all tolerate.  I am very pleased with my chromebook and traveling with it is going to be painless.  Also, the battery life is quite long depending on how bright you like the screen.It is not a computer as such but very close to fulfilling all my computing needs and a very low cost.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: steff
Reviews.Content: Fast, lightweight ,  great sound,  very happy with it!!  I'd recommend this chrome book  to anyone on the go!Love it.

Reviews.Title: Cheap
Reviews.Author: Tom H Ryan "Tom"
Reviews.Content: Looked cheap. Felt cheap. Too heavy for a 11 inch. Returned it because of the trackpad and forked over the cash for the samsung, which was $50 more. Other than that, i like the concept of a chromebook. It was fast, and had a good keyboard, but the trackpad was a deal breaker for me.

Reviews.Title: NOT a standard laptop
Reviews.Author: Darrell R.
Reviews.Content: Nice CPU just not a good fit for Me but would be great for traveling just for web or music

Reviews.Title: Best working computer I have owned.
Reviews.Author: Kenneth D Hart
Reviews.Content: This is the best working day computer I have owned.  It might not be what a gamer wants but it boots quickly and works all day.  Perfect for me.

Reviews.Title: Fast and portable. I do have some complaints, though.
Reviews.Author: Aubree
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product about two weeks ago from Amazon. It was packaged securely and arrived a day before the estimated delivery date. It's exceeded my expectations for the most part. I'm very minimalist, and so is this laptop.Pros: FAST start up, like 2-5 second fast.Easy to use if you're familiar with the chrome browser, and really isn't all that hard to learn otherwise -- very minimal, I would definitely recommend this as a laptop for an individual who isn't that good at handling computers (I would say the elderly but the screen is very tiny so that might be a problem...).Fast everything, honestly. Videos run smoothly, even if I have 10 other tabs open.Cons: Battery life isn't as good as the reviews make it out to be. Maybe I got a defective one or something, but my battery life is just as good as any other laptop -- 4 to 5 hours.Webcam quality isn't *that* great but it's good enough. When I do hangouts with other's they describe me looking like a watercolor painting.There are popular programs that you won't find an alternative app for such as Skype. Big bummer.If you're an artist, there's a good chance your tablet won't work. You might be able to use it but there is no pressure sensitivity which could be a crucial thing for you depending on what type of art you create.The only thing I was disappointed about when I first got this was how small this machine actually is. It is 11.6 inches but the screen itself is 10. Sometimes pages are a little mis-matched because the items on the page don't fit together so they kind of get squished together. This for the most part isn't a big problem, in fact the only encounter with this problem I've had is on the site Gaiaonline. But you get used to the screen size quite quickly.I've seen complaints about the sound quality as well, but I don't have that problem.

Reviews.Title: I love my Chromebook!
Reviews.Author: Aunt Di "Diana"
Reviews.Content: As a person who has never owned a laptop due to the expense, I'm thrilled with the capabilities of this device.  I use it every day, and honestly a bit too much on the weekends. I was frustrated that I couldn't click and drag... until I read the instructions and found how easy it is.  Cloud printing is an amazing thing to do with this too.  I just enabled cloud printing at my desktop to which the printer is attached, and can print from anywhere in the house.  At work, the company runs on a Google system, so it's easy to log into my work email and applications any time I need to.

Reviews.Title: Acer Chromebook
Reviews.Author: Ann Taylor
Reviews.Content: This thing works exactly as promised. It's battery time is what they say it is and it fires up quickly.  Very handy device.  The only thing I don't like is that when you put pictures or files on it, Google really only wants you to use it for their applications, and makes it very hard to use them where you want them.  Also, would it kill them to put a manual on/off switch on the camera lens for the paranoid among us?  The post it note looks a little tacky.

Reviews.Title: Great for College Students.
Reviews.Author: Daniel Newton
Reviews.Content: Works exactly as I exoected it to. I wanted something small and light to take with me on campus and last me all day on a single day and with this, I definitely have those needs met.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for traveling.
Reviews.Author: Kathleen andrus
Reviews.Content: Very easy set up and user friendly for those who are not very good with computers. Perfect size for traveling.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Jefferson L Freeman
Reviews.Content: This little Acer is capable of so much more. With its dual core and decent amount of RAM, it handles anything you need. I upgraded my SSD using http://www.amazon.com/MyDigitalSSD-Super-Cache-Solid-State/dp/B00EZ2E8NO A 128GB unit from MyDigitalSSD. With these two mated, I am now dual-booting Ubuntu and running a fast, lightweight, full power Linux box!

Reviews.Title: I love my Chromebooks
Reviews.Author: itsjustme
Reviews.Content: This is my second Chromebook.... The first one I have is the Samsung... I love them both.  I love what they can do, I love what they can't do and they serve a fantastic purpose for me.

Reviews.Title: Fast, light, well designed and inexpensive
Reviews.Author: Michael P
Reviews.Content: So far I'm totally impressed with where Google are going with Chromebooks, and particularly with this C720.  It does pretty much everything you want for everyday use, including fast browsing, playing web-page video or YouTube content, music etc.  The one exception might be writing documents, as the intention is that you use Google apps and Google Drive.  My existing '.odt' OpenOffice (LibreOffice) documents cannot be opened this way.The C720 is lightweight and low power so it doesn't get hot and makes for comfortable laptop browsing.  The 8-hr claim for battery life is a bit optimistic if you happen to launch a few web-page videos, but several hours is realistic on a single charge.I bought it with the intention of using Crouton (chroot) to also run a Linux system in parallel.  So far it works great after installing Ubuntu "Saucy" with the Cinnamon desktop.  With this setup you can use ChromeOS for everyday browsing and playing media, and switch instantly to Ubuntu for development work, or to use LIbreOffice for document editing.At $199 this is a new price point for a capable PC.  The dual-core Celeron is way more performant than some quad core Android devices (see my Minix Neo X7 review).My only complaint is that the SD card socket is not one where the card pushes all the way in.  The card sticks out about 1cm, which could lead to damage if it were knocked.  With only 16GB of on-board flash it would've been nice to have a flush fitting SD socket.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: George Sand "booknerd"
Reviews.Content: It's definitely for a certain kind of user, because it's not a pc, but it's light, fast and boots up and shuts down in less than 5 seconds. For the price, you can beat it. As a writer, I need something trim and slim for the road, because it's a total hassle to drag around a heavy laptop that takes forever to boot up. Also, it automatically syncs with my android cell phone, re: Google docs, contacts, photos, etc. I still use my laptop for certain things, but this is a definite thumbs up. I'll write more as I continue using the device.

Reviews.Title: Great for what it's meant to do.
Reviews.Author: Luis
Reviews.Content: I definitely think this is a good laptop. The speakers sound quite loud, it is fast at loadup, easy to use, and the battery lasts around 8 hours. so far I'm happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Killian Crawford
Reviews.Content: Does almost everything I need it to do. For the cost and capability I doubt there's better. 1080p streaming to a 40 inch led is a little tough. But its hard for my 4 year old laptop to even do that, so very happy with my purchase. Make sure you have a printer that works with the chromebook or that can be annoying (wirelessly). Great for school (lightness and battery life). Does everything you could want minus Photoshop and hardcore dedicated gaming of course

Reviews.Title: What a usefull device!!!
Reviews.Author: Todbiker
Reviews.Content: Quick to fire up and surf or check email, facebook oir the weather forecast, etc.Great to do online shopping.It's my understanding it's not as likely to get a virus because of the lack of a conventional operating system, so it's safe to do banking on a secure network. It's probably the best money I've ever spend on a computer and cost a lot less. I usually don't have to work on my home computer, so it's perfect in that domain. Small, but not too small, I prefer it to a tablet because it has a real keyboard.I would give it 4.5 stars, but it is not immune to being sluggish occasionally, but overall very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Very Impressive.
Reviews.Author: Steph
Reviews.Content: When I choose to buy a Chromebook I knew exactly what it is.Chromebook is a browser + in a laptop body.I was on the market to buy a 10" tablet and I changed my mind when I tried the chromebook.The Acer is a beast!  Don't be afraid of the 2 GB of ram. The Acer is very fast even with 8-9 tab running at the same time.Only 7 seconds for a complete startup.Before I bought the Acer C720 I made my research. This Chromebook is the best choice. Not sure if the 32 GB worth the extra money since all your stuff is on Google Drive Cloud.In conclusion, the Acer C720 is one of my best $200.00 investment!

Reviews.Title: Boots quickly; screen is lacking
Reviews.Author: Jonah Behrmann
Reviews.Content: This does everything you want it to do. If you are looking for a no frills, internet surfing machine. I use it primarily for web browsing and watching netflix, which it does well. The screen is weak though as it has a very limited viewing angle and is prone to wash out. But, what do you expecdt for $200.  For the price I am very happy with the purchase.  If you are looking for nice screen quality look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: I hate to give things 5 stars because nothing should be perfect.  However I am more than satisfied with the product.  The remote desktop app worked almost instantly.  The application is reliable but still has minor fixes that are needed.  These bugs are not anything that will hinder the app (at least so far).  The chrome book is extremely fast.  As a windows user, I am use to right clicking for options.  However the trackpad behaves like a mac trackpad (correct me if I am wrong).  The camera is mediocre (something I hope the specifications conveys).  Overall though the chromebook is definitely worth my money.

Reviews.Title: My favorite machine.
Reviews.Author: Rich
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite machine. Light and thin...I hardly use my desktop anymore. Love the fast boot...6 seconds. The touch pad is very responsive. Much better than my Lenovo at work.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: GWW "wood worker"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Acer because it gives me the opportunity to connect with a HDMI to my TV and stream things from the internet. It is great as a laptop computer provided you like the Chrome browser and have WIFI. Does all I expected and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great machine
Reviews.Author: Mike Roach
Reviews.Content: Delivered on time as promised by Amazon. It took less than a minute to get it unboxed and connected to my network. Added a few apps from the Google store and found this device to be an excellent replacement for my aging MSI Wind U100.  This is not a replacement for my laptop but certainly meets my needs.

Reviews.Title: Perfect first computer for 6th grader
Reviews.Author: Mike R.
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our 6th grader and she loves it, there are limitations as to what you can do with it, definitely not a windows or mac computer.  But, for what she needs it for, for the money and for a kids first computer it fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop! This is not a Windows type computer!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Go Steelers!"
Reviews.Content: Chromebooks may not be for everybody, but this one works for me.  This is not the Windows type computer you grew up with. You cannot download office, or install any app other than what is in the Chrome OS app store. Don't complain you have been warned. That being said I love this laptop and OS!I'm in sales and typically work out of my home, so for many reasons I use a Windows desktop. When I'm on the road I will travel with my tablet and for the most part that was all I needed. However there are still a few things that are still cumbersome to use on a tablet, that being excel and powerpoint presentations. I wasn't all that psyched about buying another laptop due to cost, and the whole Chrome OS thing intrigued me. The price was worth giving it a shot, if I hated it then I wasn't out that much.I am 100% satisfied with my Acer C720. The boot up speed is unbelievable, less than 7 seconds. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the hardware. The keyboard is very nice with little give, and the track pad is fine. I've never been a big fan of laptop track pads, and would say this preforms like all others I've used. Not great, not bad, use a mouse.The Haswell processor handles all tasks thrown at it quickly and without lag, and the battery life is amazing. I have yet to run out, but I would estimate a solid 7-8 hours of constant use.

Reviews.Title: Chromebook!!!! I Love You!!!!!
Reviews.Author: L. Platt "lotows"
Reviews.Content: Says it all, I love this thing!  This is so fast to surf with, simple to set up, Instant on, sturdy build, It's no computer but I can do everything I need to on or off line. 32gb sd card holds my movies for trips . Yes, Bill Gates,  I love this thing!!!!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: jcbl
Reviews.Content: If the capabilities of a Chrome OS computer are sufficient for you....as they are for the vast majority of users...you cannot go wrong with this machine.  Keyboard feel is excellent and quick start from boot is really nice.  It's instant start from sleep.At the price it is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Great for internet use!
Reviews.Author: ERIC R PRINCE
Reviews.Content: This Chromebook has been great.  It boots up super fast, and is so small and light you can take it anywhere.  Great for internet use!

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!
Reviews.Author: Rosie
Reviews.Content: Love this so much I bought myself a second one.  It is very nice, light weight. I do most everything on it.  Don't hesitate to purchase it if you are in the market for a small, light weight laptop.

Reviews.Title: Good Enough
Reviews.Author: Denzel Lafeuillee
Reviews.Content: Pros :This laptop is efficient, manageable, good speaker quality, compact, and also has a sleek look. Cons :There should have more applications to be accessible to everyone from the Store and it feels a bit too restrictive and i expected apk files to also work.

Reviews.Title: Acer C720 Chromebook
Reviews.Author: Nita J Wright
Reviews.Content: Old 17" HP laptop about to bite the dust.
